review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is on the edge of the tenderloin which is the low income area and there are a lot of homeless people walking the streets but not one of them bothered us, it was actually very sad to see how desperate they were. It's located right round the corner from great shopping and the union square where the hop on bus starts and easy walking distance to china town. The hotel is newly refurbished and the restaurant not open yet but it's so close to hundreds of great restaurants so wasn't a issue. Great room as we were out all day sightseeing and the bed was the best I've slept in for a hotel. Great shower! For location and price it's excellent and I wouldn't be put off by the area and would definitely go back.

This is one of my worst experiences ever!
3 hotels for that rat hole?
The staff? the receptionist must have smiled once, but when? Awful welcome.
A tiny, stinky room, with a small window whose view is limited by a wall, yes a wall on the third floor! By the way, I could have touched him easily if the window could open...
A coffee-maker, yes. But no plug. So it is very convenient to put it in the washbasin and hold it...
No other plugs for the computer or the phone.
The size of the room? for a 3-star hotel it is a shame. You have the queen bed and a tiny desk where it is impossible to work on, another tiny bedside table and that's it!

Free breakfast? in another tiny  room, 2 tables on which you have coffee and fruit juice,half broken  toasters, some plain bagels and basic pastry and the rest (oatmeal...) in powder!
And plastic plates to put what you can on them and then go back to your room since there is no space to sit and "enjoy" such a delicious meal... and then you eat on your bed.
Checking out? Same receptionist, same kindness and cheers.

So I would really like to be reimbursed. I usually trust you, totally. But this time, I don't understand. At all. Please, review the rates and get that hotel out of your recommended hotels!

review.title: A pleasant surprise
review.reviewText:
We've stayed all over Union Square on occasional weekends for the better part of 20 years. We've stayed almost literally everywhere you can: the Nikko, the Westin St. Francis, the former Crowne Plaza, the former Powell Hotel, the Abri and just about every other boutique and chain hotel in the area. Compared with most of those, this is more of a budget accommodation, and if you've never stayed in SF before, you might find the Hotel Fusion underwhelming. However, if you have a clear picture of what Union Square hotels are like (think European style), then you'll find the Fusion a good choice. 

Rooms and hallways are clean if not a tad tight. The continental breakfast is very European - toast, bagels, fruit all served in a tiny room. But if you're in town for a ballgame or shopping, that fits the bill just fine. 

Our room was inward facing, which meant no view, but also reduced street noise. Union Square can be a noisy place no matter where you stay. Maids cleaned the room early every morning - by the time we got back from breakfast around 10 a.m., the room was cleaned, which was nice. 

Quick tip on the parking situation: every hotel in SF charges a LOT of money to park your car, but it turns out they're just parking it in a nearby garage for a lot less and pocketing the difference. Hotel Fusion is literally a block away from the Ellis-O'Farrell parking garage, which ran me a total of $33 for a two-night stay as opposed to the $90 Hotel Fusion wanted for it. Park it yourself!

I would stay there again!

However it was in the perfect union square location, right next to Westfield and the cable cars and perfect location for the bus to all tourist locations. The free breakfast each morning was amazing also. Bagels, toast, pastry, oats and juice. We really appreciated this. As well as the turn down service at night with the little mints on your pillow. review.title: Tiny room, but the price and location are great
review.reviewText:
The room itself is very tiny, to the point that it's really just a bed with enough space to walk around it and a desk on one side. If somebody sits at the desk, there's only enough space left for another person to squeeze between the chair and the bed. Put simply, the accommodations are about as tight as you can get this side of the Pacific. This isn't to say it's bad, but there's no extra space for more than two people, if that matters. This is San Francisco, after all, so a lot of places are going to be pretty tight. Everything was clean and seemed pretty well maintained. Each room has its own bathroom (something that isn't true about every San Francisco hotel).

The AC unit for the room worked really well, but like many hotels in the city, it's designed to dry out the air as much as possible to prevent mold. This has obvious side-effects, so you'll want to keep a bottle of water handy, or just turn off the AC as often as possible. I used to live in Las Vegas, and I never felt as dehydrated as I did after a night in my room.

While the room is nothing to get too excited about, the location is perfect. It's about 5 minutes to dozens of spots, including Moscone Center. There is a decent nightclub downstairs and some good restaurants within a block or two.

Put simply, the rooms are bargain priced, but there's nothing actually bad about them, unlike many other spots in the city. Just be ready for the little issues, and it'll be a good hotel. I plan to return in the future.

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText:
My first impression is that the hotel is a bit over priced.  But when you take into account that this is San Francisco, the room price here is really not so bad.  It is a great location, just a few minutes walk from Moscone Center, Union Square, China Town and many other places.  Flew into SFO and rode the BART to Powell Street station which is right around the corner from the hotel.  Super convenient!  The staff was very attentive and efficient, and always greet you with a smile when you're going in or out.  Maid service was very good, keeping the room clean and tidy.
There are a lot of great places to eat within a 3 to 4 block radius and a nice new Walgreen's with a deli right around the corner.
The room was a good size with a queen bed and a small but very usable desk.  A nice LCD TV was mounted on the wall. It was quiet and comfortable, so I was able to get some work done while not at the conference.  The room had both a ceiling fan and air conditioner.  I was there at the end of April and only used the ceiling fan occasionally. This room had no view since it was on a side facing another building, but this did not matter to me.  The closet was a cabinet, but large enough to hang enough clothes for a week easily. It also contained and iron and board.  Bathroom was compact but not cramped and very clean.

review.title: Thanksgiving weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Hotel Fusion over Thanksgiving.  The location was wonderful.  It is only 1 block from BART, the visitor center, cable cars, shopping and dining.  The employees I saw were all very friendly.  My room was very small (but typical in SF at this price range) and at the back of the hotel.  The weather was warm, so the window was kept open.  I apparently was about 1/2 block from Powell Street, so I did hear the cable cars and other traffic during the evening and early mornings.  The bathroom was good sized for SF and the glass shower enclosure looked very new.  The room also had a huge closet that was big enough to hang clothes and hold the luggage rack with my large suitcase.   The closet had a large shelf that held folded clothes as well.  The room was not fancy, but it was very clean and comfortable.  Breakfast is a grab and go affair and selection was quite limited.  Apples, oranges, bagels and pastries and instant oatmeal.  

It appears that they are constructing a larger lounge/lobby space.  That will be nice when they get it done.   

I'm sure I will stay here again.

The breakfast arrangements - and the breakfast - are inadequate.  A small range of items (mostly pastries) is laid out in a small room which quickly becomes congested.  Having collected our food there was nowhere in our room to sit and eat it.

On the last day we needed to leave our luggage until going to the airport.  Because we had 4 pieces we were charged for the privilege!  Apparently they allow for 3 per room.  Surely for 2 people, international travellers, it's not unreasonable to have 2 cases plus 2 carry-ons - ie 4?

review.reviewText: Great location of hotel, you are right in the shopping district so lots to see and do. You're also next to the trams (though the ques are long!). The best bit about the hotel was the location. The room was quite small compared to some of the other places we stayed but that could be usual for a city. It was nice having breakfast included (though there isn't a dining room, you eat it in the room, we didn't mind that though). The area felt safe and it was easy to get around from the hotel as there were good transport links

review.title: Nice, clean hotel close to the action
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Fusion for 4 nights and I will have to say, it was a very clean hotel and the staff was excellent. The room was rather small, but we really were not in the room a whole lot. I had wished there was a comfy chair or something in the room for watching TV but there was no room for that. The bed was kind of uncomfortable, but we were so tired from sight seeing at night that it really didn't matter. They are doing some renovations right now to the lobby and it needs it...so it will be nice when its done. I would stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, cleanliness and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were uncomfortable.

review.title: Great location but rooms cramped and basic with ve
review.reviewText: Check in was very late with a very terse justification about a convention checking out. Lobby is being updated but they need to prioritise this in the rooms. Strange smell on fifth floor masked with strong disinfectant odour. Airport transfer organised by concierge failed to turn up early on morning of departure leaving us scrambling for taxis. Not good.

review.title: 2014 HILDAY
review.reviewText: GREAT STAFF AND EXCELLENT LOCATION OVERALL THE HOTEL IS IDEAL FOR MOVING IN AND ABOUT SAN FRANCISCO
review.negativeRemarks: ROOM RADIOS COULD BE BETTER

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: very nice and I would stay at this hotel again    I would recommend this hotel to anyone who did not expect a large room   there was no bathtub so if that bothers you be aware
review.positiveRemarks: the location was great   the staff was great   the room was small but comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: the carpet could be replaced and ice maker fixed
review.locationRemarks: the location was 2 blocks from the bart [public transportation] which takes you right to airport and in walking distance to shops and restaurants

review.title: comfortable Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText: Myself and 2 others were at first apprehensive about staying at the Hotel Fusion, but we were very pleased with the hotel.  Staff was helpful, the rooms were very clean, staff was willing to help when asked, room was a bit crowded, but bathroom was very spacious.  We stayed in the Queen / suite room and all three of us were comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful and courteous.  The complimentary breakfast was nice starting promptly at 7am with lots of pastries and drinks served.
review.negativeRemarks: The room where the breakfast was at in the 5th floor was a bit crowded and at times too many people were in the room.  Everyone was patient.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to downtown activities and walking distance to all city public transportation.

review.reviewText: good locationgood serviceroom is not badprice is finevalet Parking a little bit expensive
The room is small like a closet!!!!! Super super small

review.title: cramp
review.reviewText: room two small for 2 suitcases, stuffy, cramp.  Location good
review.locationRemarks: downtown San Francisco close to union Square

review.title: Did the job.
review.reviewText: A great location at the end of the cable car line. Our room was small as it had the stair wall intruding into the space. It was very hot and stuffy, the bathroom had no fan, and the windows didn't open (I understand why).  To make it habitable we had to have the air conditioning on, which was then so noisy and so close to the bed head, it was difficult to sleep. Reception suggested paying for another hotel, as they had no spare rooms. So our stay was one where we slept badly, and I wouldn't use the hotel again. But SF is fabulous, and we enjoyed our stay, and there are worse things to worry about. Cycling over the bridge is great fun. Buy a pass for the cable cars from the turntable offices at the end of the lines - it's great value. Go and watch the Sea Lions on Pier 39 and wonder..

review.title: An unexpected surprise !
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness. Cultural fusion of decor, nice and bright.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary breakfast is good but minimal. A few items like yogurt could be added. Also no seating in b'fast area yet. Needed to tray food to room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the center of town. Close to cable cars, financial district, shopping, restaurants, Chinatown, and bus tours within easy walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel although incredible warm and small
review.reviewText: Great location  close to all ameneties but too many tramps some very intimidating

review.title: Close to all forms of transportation and shopping
review.reviewText: Great time in San Francisco will definetly go back again. Not very happy with Expedia and the way they handled our travel plans after they had made changes to our flights.

review.title: Overpriced and in need of a renovation
review.reviewText: Don't be fooled by the pictures, this hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. It was extremely overpriced and the TV didn't work properly, AC was loud and didn't work, when we called hotel staff to come check the TV they said someone would be right up and no one ever came. For the same price (or a little bit more) you can stay at the Westin and know you're getting an amazing experience. I would not recommend this hotel or ever stay here again.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping and places to eat nearby.  Best of all Powell Street Cable Car and F-line streetcar connecting you with the waterfront are one block.

review.title: Central to city
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. Close to trolleys and trams, very central near Union Square.  Provides Grab and Go breakfast!
Super redevelopment due to begin Dec.2014 which will include proper breakfast facilities and bigger public areas.  This will make the hotel even better!
Would recommend.
review.locationRemarks:
Close to Union Square.  Very nice restaurants nearby
Close to metro, trams and trolleys
Great location.
Good access to airport using the metro.

review.title: Don't EVER stay here!
review.reviewText: The hotel is dilapidated.  I would not stay here again.  The location is GREAT, however the hotel is run down.  The rooms are cramped and most have no windows.  The bathroom sink sits outside the bathroom.  The bed does not even have full size pillows.  If I were you, thoroughly look at pictures of the hotel online before you book.  We checkin early and asked for a higher floor room so as  to not hear street noise.  We left our luggage went shopping and came back.  The front desk person forgot our request and were we stuck with a 2nd floor unit.  Bad service!
review.positiveRemarks: The location is perfect.  In the heart of Union Square right off the Powell St.  BART line.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire hotel decor, design, and staff service.

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText:
From the moment we walked into this hotel, the staff were friendly, efficient and accommodating. We arrived early and a room was found for us. Initially, the hotel could not find any record of our booking through Expedia but the staff handled the confusion quietly and efficiently referring to our booking records.
The room was large, clean and well appointed. The air conditioning worked well and street noise was not a problem, in spite of the hotel's central location. 
Breakfast was basic but this was a minor issue. The location of the hotel was fantastic, right in the heart of the shopping district.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms are comfortable, not very large. Excellent location for all local transportation. Cable cars are only 2 minutes walk away, as are the street cars and train. Lots of shops locally, including Macy,s five minutes away,  It's also within easy walking distance of china town. There is a continental style buffet breakfast included, though its only in a small room, so you either have to eat in the corridor or take it back to your room.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location for all local transportation. Cable cars are only 2 minutes walk away, as are the street cars and train.
review.negativeRemarks: The room breakfast is served in could be bigger
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shops locally, including Macy,s five minutes away,  It's also within easy walking distance of china town.

review.title: Well situated and within a short walk of the tube
review.reviewText: Short walk to the tube and information centre. Clean hotel with great staff

review.title: Good Location, but get what you pay for...
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located close to Union Square, and Powell station.

Although the hotel provides breakfast, it is basic and only for take away purposes as it is a small converted room. So you are forced to have breakfast in your room.

Staff were friendly and helpful. 

Computer access available if you ask at reception.

review.title: Average hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Did not get the room we had paid for. paid for a Jr. Suite with a queen bed and we got a regular room with two twin beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning!
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. cable car, Union Square, shopping.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great location and lots of nearby shopping and restaurants
review.positiveRemarks: location and breakfast included ( although room very hot) . The ice water in lobby is nice to have.
review.locationRemarks: unlimited shops and restaurants nearby

review.title: Nice hotel, well located in NobHill
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, well located in NobHill, at walking distance of many great neighborhoods and great restaurants. The restaurant and night club attached to it is also very pleasant; we enjoyed our meal there. Breakfasts were very good and did include a little bit of everything: perfect to start off the day! The room was clean. Our only little disappointment was with the no-bath, shower only.
review.negativeRemarks: Baths instead of just showers
review.locationRemarks: Great location in NobHill: you can shop nearby anytime. The restaurant next door is very good.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced and close to Union Square. I'd go back

review.title: Decent hotel, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is located well for Union Square, it is also close to the Tenderloin area (perhaps a less desirable area of SF).
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms and close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Having somewhere to sit and have the complementary breakfast, rather than having to take it back to your room.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Bay Area Rapid Transport from the airport and to the Powell St tram.

review.title: Very expensive for a lousy room and facility.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very expensive for its location and small, dreary room.
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding, bathroom, coffee and service.
review.locationRemarks: This is the only redeeming factor as it's close to a Union Square.

review.title: Don't stay here just because of the price!!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very okay.  Nothing great, nothing horrible.  What really sucked was the extra $90 for parking I had to pay.  If you want cheap do your homework for overnight parking.  Yes I expected to pay but not $37 plus $5 for tax each day and $15 for a car wash to remove all the bird dump on it.   Outside valet parking???  Really.  Also, it you are someone who looks for breakfast this was the worst excuse for continental breakfast I have ever had.   They should put their crummy red apples in the lobby and maybe they would get the occasional thanks.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking! Continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of vagrants along the way.  Lots of construction that you don't hear in the hotel. Beer drinker...Go to 21st Amendment on 2nd St. Walk to Giants.

review.title: June 2014 Stay
review.reviewText: A really nice hotel in a fantastic location right near Union Square. There also the Powell - Hyde and Powell - Mason cable cars at the end of the street, only about a 1 minute walk. The hotel was really nice and clean along with friendly staff.

review.title: Great location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Room was in a great location minutes from the BART and also the cable cars. We spent most of our time down on fisherman's wharf though. We had a junior suite and had 3 adults inside I would recommend this room for even just 2 guests, it is a but small for 3 people. The bathroom was spacious and exactly what we needed. We a only stayed 3 nights so it was perfect for us at the right price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free wifi, very helpful front desk staff and complimentary breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the rooms and it does need some updating
review.locationRemarks: Close to transport, restaurants and shopping mall

review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, the staff members were helpful, and the breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: took a while for valet parking to park the car but eveyrthing else was great

review.title: Charged for Snack Bar
review.reviewText: After confirming that I had not taken anything from the snack bar when I checked out I found a $14 charge on my account which they stated was for items taken from the snack bar in my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service, beds
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, restaurants and bars

review.title: Excellent location, basic room but nice enough
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for four nights and we were surprised by how close the hotel was to union square. The room itself was fairly small but comfortable and clean enough. Everything that we needed for a short stay in San Francisco. If you are looking for luxury, this is not for you but if you are looking for something reasonably priced, comfortable and clean and within walking distance of Union Square and other major tourist attractions then this is perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger rooms with a view.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square very nearby. Lots of shops, restaurants and bars.

review.title: Great location, affordable.
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean. Rooms are very very basic and small. Bathroom is shower and a toilet, sink is in the bedroom. Breakfast was just a small room with very basic pastries sitting out for you to take, no seating. If you are looking for a very basic affordable hotel, it's a decent choice.
review.negativeRemarks: They should have a real breakfast room where you can sit down and not have to take breakfast back to your room

review.title: Sure wasn't the best.
review.reviewText:
Close to Union Square and other things. Some other reviews mentioned noise, but it wasn't an issue, our room was on the interior of the building. Room was clean.

Really small room. May have worked for two people. Was not meant for 4 people at all.

Beds were uncomfortable.

Bathroom was really small.

Breakfast room was about a big as a shower stall.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, Close to City Activities, Price
review.negativeRemarks: Improve Beds.
review.locationRemarks: Couple of blocks to Union Square and Westgate Mall. Great Location.

review.title: Nice and central to shopping but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated for all tourist destinations and a great location to transport especially the cable car. The rooms windows all faced walls of other buildings and the noise from other rooms was very audible. The continental breakfast was convenient. I've been to better places with lower stars

review.title: Happy with our stay at the Fusion
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel to be clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Our first room was located on the side street of the hotel and two nights in a row, we found it to be too noisy due to fights in the street after the club closed and glass bottles and trash being thrown in the dumpster late at night. We mentioned it to the front desk staff and they immediately moved and upgraded our room.
Overall our stay there was a fine time.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff and how clean and neat the hotel was.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located close to the cable cars, subways, Union Square and of course there's a Walgreen's around the corner.

review.title: Impromptu San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: First time using Expedia. Hotel Fusion is a nice, clean and convenient hotel with an accommodating staff. Very close to Union Square and all the sights. Decent rates for both rooms and valet parking. Breakfast bar (7-9 only) is a carb overload, though--so be prepared.

review.title: The hotel was cute, but the service was terrible.
review.reviewText: The service was terrible due to lack of staff. It took valet 40 minutes for the car to come to the front. I also requested an extra blanket and they never brought it, so I called and they didn't have the key to get to the linens. They didn't even call me to let me know, I had to call them.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and bathroom was very comfortable.

review.title: Close to everything good.
review.reviewText: Came for our 25th wedding anniversary and we weren't disappointed. Wanted some where close to public transportation, within walking distance of everything, and good restaurants. The room was small but comfortable. I read tons of reviews about the place. The A/C was adequate. We requested a room away from the Lounge for quietness and were easily accommodated. The "grab and go" breakfast was just what we expected and provided you didn't arrive exactly @ 7 am when it opened, you could get your stuff and go. I would hope they expand the small area for more convenience, but it was ok. The bathroom was small, but recently renovated and clean. It's within easy walking distance to the major cable car line, Powell and Market St. hubs for bus and electric car service. We love to walk and did average 7 - 10 miles every day. Yes, we did all the hills. We hit China town, Nob hill, little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, and the Ferry Building from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to transportation and some very good, reasonably priced restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast area. Food was good (bagels, danish, toast, juice, coffee, oatmeal, muffins) but the area is small and cramped. Don't arrive at 7 am.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, reasonably priced, variety of restaurants nearby and near all transportation. Good walking shoes are a must.

review.title: a minimalist room that suited my needs
review.reviewText: I needed a room for one night. I got a great deal on a hotel room close to where I needed to be. As long as I resisted the urge to indulge in the well-stocked refrigerator, life was good....
review.positiveRemarks: The folks at front desk were very nice - excellent service!
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the bed was bigger, but it was quite clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Many options in the neighborhood - food, theater, music, etc....

review.title: Brilliant Hotel at a fantastic location!
review.reviewText:
Fantastic big, medium-firm bed. Extremely comfortable. I have great night sleep every night.
I booked a queen bed room and given one on the 5th floor.
Yes, the room is a bit old looking and there is no view when you look out.
But it serve its purpose to relax oneself after a day of shopping and sight seeing.
Nice big toilet with half-wall mirror. Clean and decent size room.

Breakfast is not creative. Bagels, muffins and danish pastries. But does the job to fuel oneself before the big day ahead.

Location is FANTASTIC. Smack right in the middle with all nice restaurants and shopping (i,e Normand's, Macy) in close vicinity.

Free WiFi. Fast connection. Awesome bonus.

If you are VERY particular about the room decor and views and spend most of the time in the hotel room or required hotel facilities (i.e swimming pool or spa), then this is not for you.

However if you just need a room to crash and spend most of the day outside, this is a brilliant hotel to be in. Cheap and central!
review.positiveRemarks: Location Nice bed Decent size clean room
review.negativeRemarks: Better breakfast selection
review.locationRemarks: Shopping area everywhere Food (i,e Bangkok noodles is fantastic. Chinatown is around 15 min walk, good food too)

review.title: Good location, good quality room and breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the room was adequate, but small, and the bathroom had a nice large shower. The breakfast was very nice, there were two different types of bagel, tea coffee, porridge and pastries. The location was very good, close to the Moscone convention centre and Market street.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, tea and coffee facilities in the room, clean, comfortable, nice shower
review.negativeRemarks: Both of our key cards stopped working 24 hours before we checked out, and the hotel staff blamed us for keeping them near phones (which we hadn't)

review.title: A "city stay"
review.reviewText: A good hotel in the middle of the city with shops and restaurants close by. Generally a good place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Entrance doorway does seem very inviting
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops and restaurants. The Thai restaurant a few yards up the road was great

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: You don't get much for the money you pay. At least it was close to the convention center.

review.title: Close to Union Square and shops
review.reviewText: This hotel is quite different from a large busy hotel and the rooms are rather small but there some redeeming features. It is very central to the city centre and shops and is easy walking distance to most places of interest around town. We found the hotel to be quiet at night time also. The continental breakfast was just about what we expected and there was plenty. Make sure you know what size of bed you are getting when you book as terminology may be different from country to country as to what "one full bed" is. We enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: It was fine.
review.locationRemarks: The waterfront is very accessible walking and we enjoyed the shopping.

review.title: Well located but just for sleeping.
review.reviewText:
I got a good last minute deal (160$) for an impromptu week-end in SF. The main point for me was to be right in the heart of the city, and Hotel Fusion is perfect in that sense. Staff was very efficient and welcoming.

On the down side, for that price, I had a very tiny room with a blind window. On Saturday and Sunday morning, I was waken up at 7:30 by the guy next door switching the TV on, which I could hear as if it was in my room.

The hotel provides breakfast, but it's a buffet in a very small room on 5th floor, so you can't sit and read the news while getting a coffee. And the buffet is just made of pastries. Walking to the Wallgreen's next block proved a better alternative with fruits and more healthy stuff.

So in a short: perfect for just sleeping and getting a Wifi base. But plan to stay most of your time out as the rooms are not meant to "live".
review.negativeRemarks: Drop breakfast, save on costs.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: I found this to be a great comfy hotel! We stayed here for 3 nights and it did the job perfectly! If your looking for 5* this aint it but for the price it was ideal! It's about 4 Min walk from Powell St station so great for airport, 4 mins from Union Square and 2 mins the other way to Westfield shopping centre! Free WiFi worked a treat and the free brekkie was a nice touch!

review.title: Fantastic hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Had a fantastic time the hotel was first class. In a great location. The breakfast was great

review.title: OK Hotel for a quick one night stay.
review.reviewText: Came to SF for 2 Giants games. Room was small but fit our needs just fine. Stuffy but had an air conditioner and ceiling fan.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - we were able to walk to ATT Park and restaurants. Nice staff and valet parking was very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Supposed breakfast provided and "brick" bed pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, clubs, walk to ATT Park.

review.title: A decent hotel, just somewhere to sleep really.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is fine. Very clean but there's no reason to stay in your room.

Wifi works but isn't fast and the free breakfast is ok but doesn't vary from bagels, oranges/apples, porridge or pastries. Would be improved by a bigger room so that you don't have to return to have it in your room (where there's either nowhere or only one seat to eat it in). Stayed here twice in a week and first check in was fine and quick but second time the receptionist was quite surly.

Location is great though and for the price I'd still recommend!

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. I attended here when I had a work training to attend. It provided great access to the Parc 55 Wyndham Hotel as it is essentially right across the street.It is also very close to a parking garage. The parking garage is right around the corner

review.title: Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText: Good location right by Union square , clean helpful staff would recommend for single person .
review.negativeRemarks: Sadly no view from room .
review.locationRemarks: Plenty right by Union square cable cars perfect .

review.title: Fine for a night
review.reviewText: Was fine, no complaints, room was clean and cheap and no bed bugs :) what more can you ask for in the tenderloin?

review.title: nice hotel, very convenient location.
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the reception I got when I arrived on the night of the 8th April. Unfortunately after that I found the staff to do their job but without any friendliness. The lift broke down one day and as I was on the 5th floor I was not amused. I had to walk down the stairs and a 70 with arthritis, it was not funny. It would have been nice to have a quiet lounge to sit in for a couple of hours instead of being confined to my room or sitting out in a street cafe.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the breakfast bar in the morning. The staff who cleaned the rooms were very pleasant and thorough, not at all intrusive.
review.negativeRemarks: As I said previously, a quiet lounge would be nice and the reception staff, except one could be more pleasant and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect. Everything was at hand. Cable cars, Muni transport, Shops. Restaurants, I went everywhere by public transport. BRILLIANT!

review.title: Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText: The room was really small. It was clean. The floor creaked every time we walked on it. The toilet water ran, but we kept the door closed and couldn't hear it. What we could hear was when someone took a shower. It was very loud. The location was really great. The staff was nice, but didn't go too far out of their way to make sure everything was good. We did meet the manager and he was really nice and asked us how our stay was. It is an old hotel. I am happy because it was a good deal and it was a place to sleep. I wouldn't call anything about it fancy at all. The continental breakfast was a good example of this. They have it in a tiny room which was warm. In the morning it was crowded with people. Oh and the elevator was broken but no signs on the elevator to tell us such. They were working on it when we took the stairs.
review.positiveRemarks: See what I wrote about my experience
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger breakfast room. Remodel.
review.locationRemarks: Everything was close by in walking distance or by bus.

review.title: Small but Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel pretty small but from the pictures we had already figured that. The room was clean and for the price it was definitly worth it. If you are looking for upscale this isn't the place but a good hotel at a good price I would definitly come back.
review.positiveRemarks: What I got for the price was better than I expected. Room was always cleaned well and a great location in San Francisco to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were not the most comfortable. Not horrible but could use improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Located in a good part of downtown. Pretty central to everything that we needed and use of the cable car to get to the Warf.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Very happy with our experienec at this hotel. Location was fantastic. So close to everything we needed including shops, public transport and eateries. Staff were very welcoming. WiFi was fast and room had everything we needed for our stay. Highly recommend and would happily stay again next time I am in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was a little hectic. Perhaps a bigger room would help. We skipped it most days.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping centres Public transport (trolleys, cable car, buses, trains) Plenty of restaurants and take out food options.

review.title: Good location, small room.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 14. The location is really good being close to Union Square and the Market St. Tourist info. We had a very small room that unfortunately backed onto a building that was being noisily refurbished. There was no double glazing and therefore quite noisy. The continental breakfast was reasonable but it is placed in what can only be assumed to be a small ex store room on the fifth floor and therefore if there are more than a couple of people in there at a time it can rather difficult.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise reduction measures and size of breakfast facility.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and access to all forms of transport to get around the city including the iconic cable cars and trolley buses.

review.title: SIngle room
review.reviewText: Got a single room for $80 the same night. Room was adequate, clean and just what I needed. No complaints.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Being in Union Square, close to all the best shops and restaurants. Local transport links. Recommend.
OK, could have done with the hotel. cant understand staff over the phone.

review.title: Nice hotel, right in the middle of San Fran
review.reviewText: Close to the trolleys and the BART. Plently of places to grab a bite to eat and get some drinks. All you have to take is the F trolley and your at Fushermans wharf. You can walk to Chinatown from the hotel. I would stay there again.

review.title: great discount hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of it's convenient location. If all you're looking for is a place to sleep at night, then you consider this hotel. It's bare bones, the bed wasn't great but did the job, the room was incredibly small (the bed frame overlapped with the bathroom door), the bathroom was very small, and there was only one usable outlet.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Good price in a city where everything is expensive.

review.title: Location excellent
review.reviewText: Great value for short stop to visit city centre very convenient

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Clean and convenient. Hotel had an awful odor throughout; breakfast options were not healthy; air conditioners very loud. Thus is a fine choice for those not planning to spend much time in room.

review.title: Right downtown
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful.

review.title: OK, but not up to billing
review.reviewText: The photos are misleading. The location is decent. Half of the staff are unfriendly, the other half are helpful. We had a "queen suite". The day bed was useless. The bed frame was creaky and the bed was hard. The bathroom was clean, but had NO space to place any toiletries, and the shower was encumbered by a rig for disabled folk. Oh, did I say the whole place smelled like an old folks home? I tried to get transferred to a decent room, but was told the only other option was worse, more noisy, over a nightclub. My room had a noisy window ventilation unit that looked out onto noisy roof ventilation units. All in all, not worth $200 a night.

review.title: Nice hotel, cute rooms, but hard beds
review.reviewText: This hotel experience was overall OK. GREAT location, right by union square, lots of shopping around and easy to pick up a bus or cab anywhere around. Also, a great little Jazz club/restaurant right down Ellis. Although the room was cute (small but clean - very compact but had all the amenities) the bed was very hard. I mean HARD. I was sore both days after and I am an active 27 year old. The hotel also had a very harsh smell of cleaning products that was unpleasant and gave my friend a headache. The bathroom was great - big glass shower, although no counter space, no hooks, and no shelves. The best part of this experience was that the hotel offers free robes in the room, free wifi, and free continental breakfast of juice, coffee, muffins, bagels, danishes, apples and oranges. Overall, I would stay again because the price was right and the location was great, but I'd see a few rooms to see if I could get a softer bed. I also did not like how they charged an extra $20 per night for a bed switch to two doubles instead of one queen - most hotels do this free of charge. The street was noisy because of the location, but the window air conditioner had a fan mode and we kept that on all night to drown out the noise in the street. There was a mini fridge and basket of snacks with prices above the cost of the same items at the Walgreens around the corner, and the fridge was too full for us to put our own water bottles in.
There is a connected club next door, and on the weekend nights it can be loud outside with lots of drunk people milling about. You will be asked to show your door key to get inside, and you'll need it to get the elevator to your floor (no sign posted telling you this, just a random slot in the elevator that won't accept your floor selection until it's read your card).
We stayed in the full size room. Overall room size was tiny, bathroom had no window and the ventilation did little to deal with the steam. The shower itself was small, but with great water pressure. This was probably the best part of the entire room. The windows in the bedroom didn't open (and had a note in marker on the window saying not to open it.) Felt like a classic dorm room with attached bath. Full size bed was fine, with four throw style pillows (instead of two normal pillows) But hey-no bed bugs!
Check out was a breeze, and we were off to the first bart train of the morning on monday.
You get what you pay for. The room was fine for two city dwellers used to close spaces.

review.title: Smelly hotel

Everyone was conversing in a foreign language (Italian) and the person that finally served me had a China flag emblem on her shirt.

The room was the worst part. It was a small, crowded with no view (or a view of a back alley). There was barely enough room to lie down on the floor (not that you would want to). There was a Queen bed that seemed relatively clean. However, the smell was unbearable. It smelled like diapers or baby powder. It's hard to put your finger on how bad it was. The wifi was very shoddy and didn't even have enough bandwidth for me to make a Skype voice call.

The complimentary breakfast was in somebody's room at the 5th floor. Dried donuts and bagels. The orange juice was the only thing up to standards there.

When I asked them to book me a taxi, they told me that one was immediately booked and that they would notify me when the driver arrived. But then a bald man showed up and led me into a black GMC Yukon. There was no taxi sign, no meter, no identification. He only accepted cash and charged me $75 to drive to the airport (the ride there was $55 for comparison). The company was Kenan Gokce World Limousine & Town Car Services. Why they would call a big SUV limousine service for a young client who asked for a taxi? Someone is making money from referrals...
