review.reviewText: SLIGHTLY DISAPPOINTING STAY BUT JUST ABOUT OK VALUE FOR MONEY: GOOD FOR A ONE/MAXIMUM TWO NIGHT STAY, ROOMS COMFORTABLE BUT QUITE NOISY, WITH THE FUSION LOUNGE NIGHTCLUB NOISE FILTERING EVEN UP TO THIRD FLOOR. BREAKFAST WAS EXCEPTIONALLY DISAPPOINTING, AS EVEN AT THE 7AM OPEN TIME THERE WAS A QUEUE OF HUNGRY AND THIRSTY GUESTS DOWN THE CORRIDOR BEFORE ENTERING A LINE TO TOAST BAGELS AND MAKE OWN TEA AND COFFEE, AN EMBARRASSMENT FUSION HOTEL, MY ADVICE DROP IT, ALLOW A 10 USD DISCOUNT AND POINT GUESTS TO DINERS ACROSS THE STREET.
review.negativeRemarks: BREAKFAST ARRANEGEMENT. HALF HOUR VALET PARKING TO COLLECT CAR IN MORNING IS QUITE SLOW.
review.locationRemarks: CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE, NEXT TO GREAT SHOPPING, CLOSE TO THE TERMINUS OF CABLECAR ON POWELL/O FARRELL STREET.

review.title: nice hotel close to bart
review.reviewText: Needed a hotel for a spur of the moment trip. Arrived at bart station and delightfully found the hotel just around the block!! excellent location. staff very friendly and helpful. location great next to union square, cheesecake factory and lots of shopping. trolly car around the block. art museum and gallery's close by. room was clean, lite breakfast with Danish, oatmeal, coffee/tea, juices. Love to grab a little snak before leaving the hotel for the day so this was swell, and just down the hall from my room. microwave, fridge, coffee maker in the room a plus. air conditioner a wee be noisy but only used it at night. staff very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the maids. airport shuttle available but since the bart was just around the block opted to take that ride. Reasonable priced - stayed in a suite which was less than most other hotels in the area for single room. definetly would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioner
review.locationRemarks: shopping, museums/galleries, bart, cable car, buses around the block with access to the whole city.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was well located.

Room was a little smaller than expected but clean. Having read previous reviews we expected to hear external noise but this did not eventuate.

The package included a continental breakfast. The disappointment was that there was no dining room in which to sit and eat it.

Overall an enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: A dining room would certainly improve the hotel.

review.title: Decent hotel rude staff
review.reviewText: Rooms were small, but clean; staff was unfriendly to the point of being rude. Imagine walking by several male staff during your stay and feeling like they wanted to fight you, by the mean looks they gave. Who does the hiring?

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the hotel Sep 27th 2013. The room was okay, fairly good size but very smelly. Not sure if it's the cleaning agent they used or something else. Also, our package included breakfast, but it is served out of a tiny room on the 5th floor with trays, so you have to eat in your room, not what we expected. The Wifi is pretty weak and kept breaking down on us except in the lobby.

Lastly, the air conditioning did not work well at all in terms of using the remote to set it.

The location is fabulous though.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wifi strength, the breakfast room size, cleaning agent used

review.title: No Frills Hotel
review.reviewText: You get nothing extra at this hotel, but it's also not missing basic necessities. The hallways to the rooms have a faint odor of a retirement home and the walls seriously lack decor. Although the location is good for access to Muni and BART, it can be a bit noisy in the evenings. The room we stayed in only had a ceiling fan, no A/C unit, but it was sufficient.
review.positiveRemarks: It's in a convenient location to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Some paint, add some artwork to the walls, a formal breakfast room rather than a broom closet. Front desk staff could be a bit more friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, Civic Center.

review.title: very basic
review.reviewText:
very close to city centre is about the only plus for this place
Staff rude & unfriendly arguing about booking even when documents showing what was booked was produced
rooms very small but tidy
lots of beggars hanging around hotel entrance & no security on front door most of the time, so anyone can enter & go up to rooms as the main reception is down a hallway hidden from main door
review.negativeRemarks: staff & security

review.title: Nice hotel near Powell Street cable cars,Market St
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel near Powell Street, Union Square, Market Street, BART and MUNI. There is a dance club on the street level but I had no noise problems in my fourth floor room. The room was very nice and clean and appeared to have been renovated recently. Excellent bathroom, though small, with a nice glass stall shower (no bathtub). There was a flat screen TV, ceiling fan and a window air conditioner. Very comfortable queen bed with four pillows. In-room safe came in handy-I didn't have to carry all my cash and credit cards all around town with me. Excellent housekeeping. The hotel overall was very clean and in very good shape. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Oven
review.reviewText:
My room was tiny and was like an oven since there was no air conditioning in the room. I arrived on the hottest September day for 100 years. For the first few nights, I couldn't sleep.

The free breakfast was available to collect from a room on the 5th floor but there is nowhere to eat it so you have to take it back to your room. There was a selection of pastries and cereals and a coffee machine. It was better than I was expecting but was crowded at times.

The TV in my room didn't have many channels and the picture on some of them was unwatchable.

Some of the power sockets were along the side of the bed so I had to unplug the coffee maker to charge my phone. It looked like the desk should have been where the bed was. The desk had no power sockets but the bed had two.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It's within a block of the turnaround for the Cable Car and lots of shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need air conditioning. I thought they had air condition in the rooms when I booked but my room didn't and it was like an oven.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the main shopping district in San Francisco. There's a Westfield mall, Macy's and Saks within 2 blocks.

review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was ok and in a good location. Dissapointed to be told our upgrade was complimentary then got charged on checkout because the computer said so
review.positiveRemarks: Location to main areas of interest
review.negativeRemarks: Decor inside and out
review.locationRemarks: Most things within walking distance

review.title: Amazing stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at Hotel Fusion! The staff were friendly and helpful as well as considerate knowing that my husband and I were on our honeymoon. The location was ideal- a block from the cable car stop to Fisherman's Wharf and accessible to every sort of public transportation in the city. The room was clean,the bed was comfy. The breakfast is small but fine for a small boutique hotel. I was nervous after reading other reviews that it would be noisy because of the club next door. I just requested a room on one of the upper levels and we didn't hear a peep. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location and great service during their stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was very small,breakfast was not healthy, I would have preferred if the fusion lounge was acceble from the lobby.Fusion loung had no seating available except bottle service which was $410 .

review.title: Great location, comfortable room
review.reviewText: This is my second time staying at this hotel. I like the location with all amenities nearby. The room is clean and comfortable although it is not that spacious. The staff is great and always helpful.
review.locationRemarks: I would recommend an authentic Thai restaurant at Ellis X Mason St., The Old Siam.

review.title: Good location, bar noise
review.reviewText: Upon arriving I was disappointed with the drabness of the lobby -sorely in need of updating. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous and happy to hold luggage and make shuttle arrangements. The room was also dated but clean and acceptable. From 2 to 3 am there was no way to sleep because the bars let out and the sound of loud talking and laughing came right into the room (3rd floor). Recommend hotel hand out earplugs. The size of the room was not a problem as I was only one person.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby and room appearance. Sound through windows.
review.locationRemarks: Tons to do nearby, right near Union Square. Lots of Asian restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel , middle close to union square
review.reviewText: Room was small but cozy, just got a little stuffy.. But club downstairs was good .! Overll if recommend just beware there is no parking so you have to either pay daily or valet your car for 37 plus tax every night .
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very friendly , middle of everything , close to cable cars and muni station
review.negativeRemarks: Ventilation in the rooms .. Cheaper cost for valet .. Free entrance to club for hotel stay
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars take you everywhere .. Fishermans wharf, crookedest street , muni station

review.title: Not bad hotel
review.reviewText: Thank you to hotel staff. They were helpful and looked after our comfort. Hotel location was the best in the middle of town handy to every where any one would like to go to walking. Rooms are not bad but there is no seated restaurant to take breakfast but you would have to take your breakfast form a room in the top floor to your own room that is small and have not adequate space to handle eating your breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Handy walking to any thing

review.title: good location in San Francisco & a friendly hotel.
review.reviewText: Everything worked well in room, good to see a hotel catering for a single traveller instead of having to pay single supplement/s. Accurate description and good location in centre of SF. View from window poor & pidgeons around outside so wouldn't want to leave window open, fan on ceiling, but no air on. Staff very friendly & helpful.

review.title: Good location, but a bit over priced.
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night and did not spend much time in the room. The room was clean and bathroom was huge! Bed was comfortable. However I felt it was a bit overpriced. The location was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Excellent! Near the station

review.title: Close to Powell Bart station , cable car , union
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the location and price. Close to Bart, the mall, union square, pubs, shopping. Staff was accommodating and friendly (especially Darrien). Rooms were clean and comfortable. The only drawback was no air in the single rooms ( but in San Fran you can just open your window) and the breakfast room was tiny with a funky set up ( but breakfast was included ).
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast room and option of air in single rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location. Close to Bart, cable car stop, Union Square, the mall, shopping. But also close to Tenderloin district with many panhandlers.

review.title: Close to downtown.
review.reviewText: I've never stayed in San Francisco before so this was a rather pleasant surprise. The room itself was rather small, but it had everything one would need when staying in a hotel. The cleaning people came by very often to service our rooms so make sure you put out the 'do not disturb' sign on the door. Hotel staff was very nice and knowledgable about the area. The TV also had HBO and some other premium channels which was great for killing time. Shopping at Westfield mall was across the street, and the BART was also a few minutes away. Access to cabs and cable cars was also VERY easy.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved that it was right in the middle of downtown and all the excitement it has to offer. Everything was a short walk distance away.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel service threw away some important things I had out on the table. :/
review.locationRemarks: Downtown frisco with Fisherman's Wharf about a 35 min cable car ride away

review.title: my parent's love it
review.reviewText: staff was excellent we are happy with hotel and help because we don't speak English

review.title: Excellent base in the city.
review.reviewText: Really good base in the city, close to the cable car, trams and buses and within walking distance of the waterfront. Clean, comfortable and secure-feeling. Also good restaurants nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Difficulty in booking a taxi, for some reason
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is an amazing place. If you've visited the East coast then you'll be surprised by how friendly it is here.

review.title: Good for an overnight stay
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful, more so during the day though. Room was small so travelling with more than 2 bags fills the room and switching off the light switches off everything in the room. The breakfast wasn't very good; toast, bagels or muffins were the only options and the room was too small to allow for a good flow of traffic. My one night stay was long enough

review.title: Unbelievable!
review.reviewText: After a days driving from Las Vegas this was not where I should have checked into. The room was tiny and my wife and I could hardly fit onto the one bed. At 8am there was a knock at our door despite us having the DND card displayed. The lady announced "guest service". I shouted from my bed "what you can't see the DND sign" and she ran away. When I called the front desk to find out what was going on the guy who answered said "sir there is no one registered to this room, may I have your name please". As if it was my problem! Unbelievable, no sorry or nothing. For the price stay elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Near the centre of town but not the good part.

review.title: Would Stay Again!
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Hotel Fusion for 4 nights in June on my first trip to San Francisco. I chose the hotel based on location and price. The hotel is located in the town and is literally a 2 minute walk away from the Powell Street BART station and Cable Car terminus.

The bed was very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. There was a safe in the room, and a fridge with mini bar and a selection of candy bars (you have to pay for them - around $2.50 each) and tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was again very clean and had a good shower.

I had read previous reviews on noise from the nightclub in the basement and specifically asked for a quiet room at the rear of the hotel. I got a room on the fourth floor at the rear of the hotel and didn't hear any nightclub noise at all (and I'm a light sleeper!).

I thought the breakfast choice was more than satisfactory, you help yourself to fresh orange juice, coffee, tea, cereals, toast, bagels, pastries and fresh fruit and take them back to your room. Only slight niggle, breakfast is only served 7am - 9am and I'm not a morning person, so serving until 10am would have been better!

I spoke to reception a few times and always found them very friendly and helpful.

Overall, I was very satisfied with the Hotel Fusion and wouldn't hesitate to stay again on my next trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Quiet clean room. Comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast only being served until 9am!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, 2 mins from BART and Cable Car terminus.

review.title: Not as pictured
review.reviewText: The hotel was not accommodating. The rooms are very small and the hotel looks nothing like its pictures from the website. I was extremely disappointed. I would not reccomend this hotel!

review.title: Rating Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText:
Hotel Fusion's greatest asset is its location. It is in a prime location, located only steps from Union Square, high end retail and most importantly, affordable retail and a very nice mall. The mall has nice, affordable and high end retail, along with an adequate food court, should you decide to eat there. There are many affordable restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. As I said before, location was everything for this hotel.

The hotel staff was very attentive.

The breakfast was just OK, mostly bread and rolls. Also, the room that I was given was a corner room, which was a little small. There was only one night stand. The bed was rather close to the wall. If I was a bigger person, or a person with minor disabilities, this corner room would never have worked. Not all of the rooms were like mine. As I walked past several rooms, I saw several rooms with two night stands. Make sure you stress to NOT have a corner room.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the attentiveness of the hotel staff; I loved the location of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A better breakfast would make it nicer, and make the corner rooms specifically for solo travelers.
review.locationRemarks: There is a great mall only steps from the hotel. Union Square is only steps away. High end retail is very close, as is more affordable retail.

review.title: Good location shame about the air con
review.reviewText:
The room was too hot and the air conditioning was far too noisy to keep on and the fan speed could not be adjusted. The window was screwed shut so could not be opened for ventilation but the was a ceiling fan which made nights more bearable.

Location was good close to Market Street and the F trolley which took us down to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: No AC and a chair that I could not sit in.
review.reviewText:
Low water pressure, Really hot room with no AC.
Sitting on the chair was sit on on a frame with no cushion.
The breakfast options were: pastry, bagel,juice, coffee, apples and oranges. No cold cereal, yoghurt, banana. The breakfast room itself was basically a large closet. As soon as more than three people at a time try to use it (which was all the time it was open) everyone had to tip toe around so as not to knock someones drink over.

My room was small enough that I could reach from the bed to the desk, and my toes could be in the bathroom at the same time.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is close to Moscone Center. There was a mini fridge in the room that was useful, and the maid service was courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner, new chair, better water pressure. Cold cereals at breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: The Tenderloin has improved a lot since I last lived in San Francisco, still lots of seediness at night, but plenty of good food and entertainment.

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Very clean,very quite and staffs are very helpful. Great continental breakfast .
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator by the front door. Anybody can go up to guest floor
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to all public transportation.

review.title: Good value for the money.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and good value for the money. Good location in a central location with easy access to the Bart and easy walking to some nice restaurants.

review.title: Happy in San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff made you feel welcomed and important from the front desk clerk to the GM who stop us to talk to us. The Continental breakfast was very good. Centrally located that we didn't need a car for the 3 days we spent in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were small but sufficient for my wife and I
review.locationRemarks: Close to all public transportation, Good choices to eat and shop nearby.

review.title: Nothing fantastic about it. Just the location.
review.reviewText: I had booked this hotel for a very popular conference when all hotel rates go up. It was close to the conference place. I had booked it way in advance (like few months). When I came to check in, the room they gave me was not very good. I told them I'd like something else. They showed me another room which was equally bad. I took it anyways coz I knew I'd be there only for nights. The staff was not super friendly, nor very rude. The rooms were very clean but not very new-ish. No VIEWs at all. Overall it was an OKAY experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate the rooms / appliances.
review.locationRemarks: Very near to market/powel street, union square, cable car : major tourist attractions. Good food places nearby walking distance.

review.title: Nice place but need some furniture
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a good location easy access to buses and trains. Restaurant and Walgreens is right next door. Rooms are clean and hotel in general is nice and clean. Staff is helpful and pleasant. Room comfort was rated low as it did not have central air or I was not aware of it. I had use fan to have it comfortable. Moreover it does not have a desk or a table to sit and eat or to even do your work. There was only one chair and your bed.
Otherwise it was a very good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Absence of a table
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Accessible.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location. Very easy to get here from airport on bart. This was our first trip to SF so we had several questions about different things. Carmen at the hotel answered every email and question we had which was such a great help. Rooms were just right for 2 people, plenty storage, most important very clean. We loved it and will defiantly stay here if we return to SF. We were upgraded from a queen to a king for our 25th Anniversay. Thanks Hotel Fusion we loved it!!
review.locationRemarks: Location is right next to cable car and bart. Also you must do the hop on hop off tours.

review.title: good location but that's all...
review.reviewText:
The best thing about the hotel is the location - close to everything.
The worst thing about the room was the bathroom fan/light - was very noisy and unbearable.
Also the club downstairs was loud and kept us awake.

review.title: Excellent location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Location was perfect for us, near all Muni, Bart, and subway service. We were able to explore every corner of the city easily from here!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and quiet with very courteous staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The business center equipment was unable to handle document scanning or read media cards.

review.title: Decent hotel close to Union Square Park
review.reviewText: Decent hotel in a pretty busy part of San Francisco. Lots of nearby shopping and a short drive to Fisherman's Wharf. Valet service takes a while, so make sure to call ahead of time so your car will be ready.

review.title: Great location but basic & overpriced
review.reviewText:
Great location just off union square so good for getting around all the sights of San Francisco. I think it was over priced for what it was, which is quite a basic hotel but this appeared to be the going rate for San Francisco.

Small pokey room with terrible view.

Good business services, I.e free Internet & printing services.

Complimentary breakfast was poor & not covered up so had fly's all over.
review.negativeRemarks: Comfort of room & the view
review.locationRemarks: Great, just off union square

review.title: Great value for the location - friendly staff
review.reviewText:
The staff at this hotel were so friendly and helpful and made us feel so welcome. The rooms are fairly basic and small but very clean and well maintained. The rooms are also good value for the Union Square area. I would definately use this hotel again.

The only concern I have with this is that the nightclub underneath the hotel is open until 2am Tuesday to Saturday and the music is constantly "boom boom boom" - there isn't any sound-proofing!! The only respite you have is Sunday and Monday evenings when the club is shut!!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff gave us such a warm welcome and did anything they could to help
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the nightclub underneath the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is so diverse and the rest of the city can easily be accessed from here - a fab location.

review.title: Small hotel & rooms, nothing special
review.reviewText: The rooms are really small and the continental breakfast is a small spread of food in basically a room that would normally hold a couple of vending machines. You will have to take the food back to your room to eat as there are no tables/chairs to sit at and eat breakfast. The rooms are clean but the hotel is nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast layout
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to everything

review.title: LOVED THE STAY
review.reviewText: The Staff was outstanding. When we arrived it was alittle early for check-in, but Chad was able to check us in and gave us an upgrade on our room. He was wonderful. Bianca helped us out by mapping out some area to check out. Our room was very clean and the beds so comfortable. I definitely recommend this hotel. Loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: WE HAD NONE.
review.locationRemarks: IT WAS CLOSE TO EVERYTHING WE NEEDED.

review.title: Great location but unpimressive room
review.reviewText: The write-ups of the hotel I read in various reviews were by and large very positive, and the pictures we saw on the websites were very nice too, but I was a bit shocked by how small the lobby was when we arrived. The room was very small too and the head of the bed faces the door directly which could have been avoided by a simple rearrangement of the furniture but not done. The hallway is spacious, but not useful. The bathroom is very spacious, but it just has a pedestal sink with no counter space for toiletries. It offers simple but adequate breakfast with bagels and pastries and hot drinks, but you have to take the food back to your room to eat it. And with only one chair and a small stand, one of us had to put the tray on the bed and eat on bed. However, it's hard to beat the location. It's a very short walk from the Bart and buses and two blocks away from the Union Square. The neighborhood is very fun and lively. If the comfort of the room is not a major concern, this hotel is a great choice, if only for the location alone. But if you would like to come back to a nice and inviting place to relax after a day of sightseeing, it may well be very worthwhile to pay more for a nicer and roomier place. In short, I love the location but very unimpressed with the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The size and the layout of the room
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, easy walking distance to public transportations

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText:
I had to move from a nearby hotel (which was 3 times the price) partway through my stay because they were booked out, so I wasn't quite expecting Hotrl Fusion to be on par, but surprisingly it was. Room size was adequate. I prefer hard beds, but this one was a bit too hard. Pillows really small but sufficed.

I liked that they laid on free wifi and breakfast 7-9 am which was great (made you get out of bed ;). The only downside is that it's located right above a nightclub, which made it difficult for me to sleep with the doof-doof bass and the guests leaving in the wee-hours.

Incredibly, it's located about 60 yards from the Powell Street cable car, and I could hear the ding-ding all day and night, but it didn't bother me at all.
review.negativeRemarks: That breakfast ended at 9am. Way too early when you're on vacation
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Nordstrom, Powell Street Cable Cars, BART & Muni. Fantastic if you don't have a car.

review.title: no thanks
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a great area but very cramped & the rooms & bathrooms are very small with window AC that makes your room more humid than cool. The pillows gave me cramps in my neck & overall we were just not comfortable.

The staff was friendly but everything else overruled our stay & we won't be staying at the fusion again.

review.title: excellent for both individuals and families
review.reviewText: excellent value for money,well positioned near everything!

review.title: great getaway
review.reviewText: Every thing was great i would stay there again. every one there was really nice and very helpful
review.positiveRemarks: very close to everything we wanted to see
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Passable hotel if on a tight budget.
review.reviewText:
The staff is making every effort to accommodate their customers, and the rooms are clean, but the facility is aging, and accommodations for vehicles are difficult at best.

Continental 'breakfast' (if it can be called such) was served in something little larger than a closet. After trying for 3 days to get into the room (which was 'full' with 3 other people already inside), I gave up each time and just went out of the hotel to go buy food. For the final 2 days of my 5-day stay, I didn't even bother trying to eat at the hotel.

review.title: Great value and location. Bad bathroom config.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a great deal considering the price and location. The room I had was clean and quiet for the 4 nights I stayed there.

COMPLAINT:
The bathroom is very large and roomy, which is great. However, there is ZERO counter space. The sink was a tiny little powder-room style sink with barely enough space to put a toothbrush and small tube of toothpaste. I ended up bringing the luggage rack in from the closet and putting the little mini-ironing board across it to make a little table for my meager toiletry bag next to the sink.

I'd stay here again, but the bathrooms need to be remodeled.
review.negativeRemarks: ZERO counter space in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: excellent location, 1 block from Powell Street Cable Car station.

review.title: Too expensive for mediocre
review.reviewText: Simply stated, this hotel is way over priced. The room was so small, like a miniature studio apt. Nothing fancy about it. They charge $50 additional for per day parking at an 'off site' location. Other than the hotel location, I wouldn't recommend it to others. You should be able to get this size and quality of a room for $90 or less per night, NOTHING MORE. There are tons of other nicer hotels in the area that charge around the same price but are actually worth it and have their own parking garages on site.

review.title: not a genuine 3-star hotel
review.reviewText: I am a businessman in my mid-thirties who spent a night at this hotel. This hotel should be rated at 2 stars, not 3 stars. The lobby is very small, and played loud, electronic-style, music. The front desk service was a bit stiff. The pictures have misled me -- the building and the rooms are old. What they market as a "suite" is a misnomer.. it is just two small rooms with an extra futon. I do not recommend this hotel for business travel. Most of the guests of this hotel are tourists, mostly young. This is a budget hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: lobby too small & loud, rooms are small

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Hotel met all my expectations and the staff were very friendly.Room size wasn't very large; but it's very excellent value for what you pay. Highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location. Hotel met all my expectations and the staff were very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size wasn't very large; but it's very excellent value for what you pay.

review.title: Good location & price, 2* hotel though, not 3*.
review.reviewText:
No hot water at times, breakfast was very poor quality with no seating. There was no desk in the room. It was noisey due to being near to the ice machine & noisey neighbours.

the location & price was good
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast & noise
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great Locality For First Time Visit To SF
review.reviewText: Great location, the BART station is less than a block away so getting from SFO to the hotel is very easy. The historic cable car for the Powell/Hyde street line is steps away, as is the F streetcar which connects to all of the wharves. I was happy with the room cleanliness and the WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all public transport, shopping district

review.title: Good location, but gets loud at night.
review.reviewText:
Pros: The hotel's in a great, central location. There's a mini-fridge with ample room to store your own snacks. WiFi is free and fast. Staff is friendly, but sometimes forgets to follow up on service requests. If you can get a deal package, this hotel is a bargain.

Cons: Lots of noise at night from the Infusion Lounge club in the basement. Can be heard until 2 AM. Walls are also thin and people can be heard from the hallways. Bed sheets seem old and although they didn't feel dirty per se, they didn't feel super clean and comfy either. There's also a musty odor in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, old, didn't seem very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Great Boutiqe Hotel In The Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a great boutique hotel in the heart of the city. I stayed with friends so we had two rooms. Ours was fantastic, theirs was just lacking an airconditioner (oversight i am sure). It runs a bit loud, but difuses any noises (which there really weren't any). Rooms were very comfortable, and standard small size for the area. The hotel is adding on more accomodations so it should be a great find. We had terrific rates through Expedia, so it was a real find.

review.title: Good location and good value
review.reviewText: Good value for money. Good location. The staff was prompt and room had all the simple amenities we wanted.

review.title: Not for light sleepers
review.reviewText: even though I phoned ahead to check in early, I was told I probably wouldn't be able to check in before 1:30. I arrived at the hotel at around noon I waited in the small lobby. And then others begin checking in. So I had to ask to check in early a second time. The room lacked a chair other than the desk chair. I was awakened both nights by loud music from a nightclub that persisted until 2 am. The A/C did not work and was not repaired add requested for the second night.
review.negativeRemarks: Nightclub noise.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk from Union Square.

review.title: "Small" doesn't even describe this room...
review.reviewText:
The room was soooo tiny! My friend's suitcase wouldn't even fit on her side of the bed. We ended up having to keep the luggage in the bathroom, which was almost literally almost the size as the hotel room. The bed wasn't too comfortable. The hotel, however, was really close to all modes of transportation. The hotel wasn't dirty. It was just old. And it definitely wasn't the "boutique" hotel I was expecting from its website.

We got a hotel room in Fisherman's Wharf the last night(had planned to do so all along...we didn't leave the hotel because of it's condition) for the same price and it was triple the size and soooo much more comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: SMALL room
review.locationRemarks: Fort Lauderdale, FL

review.title: Average hotel and small rooms for the price
review.reviewText:
Our overall stay was pleasant, but for the price, you can probably get a larger room elsehwere in the city. The rooms are nice, but VERY small. The hotel staff was ok. Requested extra towels and took a while to get them. 30 mins before we checked out, we called and requested our car from the valet. When we were checking out a 1/2 hour later, the original desk person had gone home and never requsted our car. We waited an hour to get our car from the valet. The desk person who checked us out was very sweet and refunded half of our $33 valet fee because he knew I was not happy.

I've traveled quite a bit and very picky, so that's why I rated this hotel as average.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - in walking distance to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: The small size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: great location on a budget
review.reviewText: The staff is helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and quiet. The hotel is in a great location and the rates are very reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is so helpful and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The only issue I had that it was impossible to open the window in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Very central location/

review.title: Overall, great for the money.
review.reviewText: Room is medium size but clean. Bed is 3-4 star, not the most comfortable. Having moved from Marriotts Marquis Executive suite probably has some effect on my comment. Staff, location and breakfast are great. Overall, great for the money.

review.title: Clean, quiet, reasonable, good location
review.reviewText: Traveling on business and attending a large conference at the Moscone Center, I chose this hotel for walking distance to the convention center and public transportation; hotel's location met both perfectly (1.5 blocks from MUNI and Powell BART station) and the price was right considering this is San Francisco. The room was clean and very quiet even though on a busy corner. I was on the 5th (top) floor, which may have helped minimize the noise. The room was stuffy and I couldn't figure out how to open the windows. Room was very small, but I wasn't in SF to spend time in the hotel room, so not a big deal. I did feel the hotel was safe enough for a solo female traveler. For the price, this is a good place to stay. If you book far in advance, I do recommend that you check the rates a few days prior to travel and before the cancellation cut off as the rates dropped substantially from my original booking. Saved a lot doing this.
review.negativeRemarks: Stuffy room
review.locationRemarks: Busy, close to MUNI and BART, and Moscone

review.title: memorable
review.reviewText: For our trip the manager of hotel fusion was outstanding, very nice hotel and only one block from the trams for downtown. try and purchase a 3 day ticket for the trams at a cost of 22 bucks (current) , cheaper than 6 bucks a journey, they are well worth the rides. Alcatraz is a must, try and book tickets before you go, it saves time and you are guaranteed, if you turn up and hope for a ticket you may be disappointed, not forgetting the golden gate bridge is also a must to see and a walk over if your brave enough, it is windy, but go for it , you will not be disappointed , if you have a car to go over the gate, do it, WOW and drive up the mountains, such views to remember always, you will not be disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great location , trams just outside.

review.title: Great hotel for business traveller.
review.reviewText: The room was extremely clean and nicely appointed. The location was superb. The only problem was that the window was small and looked into a tiny area so there was a very slight claustrophobic feeling. It reminded me of a Japanese hotel. The continental breakfast was very convenient. Getting to the hotel from the airport by BART was extremely easy and convenient.

review.title: Great location, but room unfortunatekly configured
review.reviewText:
This is a pretty *basic no frills place in an excellent location -- right next to the much pricier Hotel Nikko. The staff mostly is friendly (one awful exception), the rooms are kept clean and the bathrooms are spacious.

Breakfast is lining up in a doorway on the 5th floor for coffee and sweet rolls only--
not what I'd want, but the rest of the guests seeemed satisfied with it.

Our only complaint is that our room was oddly configured! The bed was exactly between the closet and the bathroom door -- so there was no room for a nightstand nor a lamp!!
What was particularly strange is that there was a much longer wall right across the room with a dresser with the phone, lamp, etc right there. But when we tried to drag the bed across to the more sensible wall, we saw the bed was bolted to the floor. We like to read
in bed, keep our phones, water, books etc by the bed --- all impossible in this room.

We saw other rooms all had swinging arm lamps on the walls -- why wasn't there one in this room which could have solved at least one layout problem?

We may have had the only room like this -- the others we peeked at all seemed to have a normal nightstand and light by the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room configuration
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Sq which to us is the heart of SF

review.title: noisy and not much comfortable
review.reviewText: I expected a lot to this hotel cuz I saw good reviews and high points. But I got disappointed... First, downstairs of this hotel has a CLUB.... I stayed on the second floor at first... but there were so much noise coming from the club and the street.... so I asked to change the room to the upper level.... but still I could hear a lot of noise and that was large enough to disturb sleeping. Not only the noise coming from outside, the soundproof between the rooms and from the hallway was awful. I could here all the noise from the next room and the hallway. Second, the condition was not as good as in the reviews. Bathroom wasn't that clean. And the room was very small... so it wasn't that comfortable... I wouldn't recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: no sound proof.. noise.. cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: close to union square and cable car station.

review.title: Mediocre stay - good if you are on a budget
review.reviewText:
Good stuff: the front staff were helpful, kind and quick to respond. The fourth room that I was moved to was a good size, comfortable and quiet. The location is excellent, close to everything. The internet access was fine on the 5th floor and the contintental breakfast items were a nice touch - orange juice, instant coffee, a selection of slightly old pastries, apples, oranges, oatmeal.

Not so good: I rarely move rooms, even if I'm unhappy. I moved rooms for many reasons - first one did not have a desk (something I needed for working on the computer), the second one was incredibly loud with the bar in close proximity (2nd floor, ear plugs did not do the trick), the third room vibrated constantly - I can not explain this any better, it just shook, and the fourth was great. The hotel is dated and half of the pillows should be tossed. The internet was very unpredictable on the 2nd floor. I should have spent an extra $50 a night and stayed somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy, very small rooms, not for families
review.locationRemarks: great location in the middle of sanfran, close to union square

review.title: Best for the nightlife crowd
review.reviewText: We were greeted with an extremely small room and bathroom. The noise from the night club next door kept us awake on saturday night. The television in the room was crooked and some of the channels did not come out clear. Their valet service was dreadful...it took an hour plus to get our car out...which made us late to our Alcatraz tour, but the staff was nice enough to pay for our way via taxi to and from. Overall I would recommend this hotel to young people who are into the night life scene in SF...as it is close to all that. We should have read the prior reviews!

The room wasn't as sparkling clean as other chains, and there was no AC (there is a heater and a ceiling fan), but the location was great and the wifi was free and fast.

review.title: 9 night stay

The nightclub downstairs is a fun place, so you would enjoy this location if you're a young person or just like to party. The staff is great, they will help you with anything. They even helped us contact the touring company when we almost missed one of our San francisco tours. I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The view wasn't so great
review.locationRemarks: The room was nice and quiet, a great sanctuary when you need to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown. Tip: request a room away from the nightclub.

review.title: Price/Location cannot be beat!!
review.reviewText: After booking this hotel mostly due to price/location, I got nervous reading some of the reviews. When we arrived the front desk staff was very friendly, and offered us the choice of a room on one of the higher floors, or the dreaded second floor (above the club).. we choose the second floor room because it was larger. Our room was perfect for the two of us, and we NEVER heard a thing from the club and we were there for 5 nights. The room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel's location was great! I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Clean and friendly - but BYO breakfast!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located, and economical - however we found the room to be hot and stuffy - and without aircon would have been unpleasant.
The biggest gripe, however, was the "light breakfast", which basically was a choice between pastries, danishes or cake, and tea/coffee/juice and a small selection of fruit (granny apples or oranges). We ended up buying breakfast elsewhere every day after the first because the choices were too unhealthy unless you wanted instant oats. i.e. no toast/yoghurt.

However, staff were friendly and our room was kept very clean. They also allowed a late checkout at short notice.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: central - close to union square and trains.

review.title: Not coming back
review.reviewText: When we first arrived I was shocked they only had one spot for valet and we had to go around the block to come in the right direction to get to it. Checking in was OK. The room is very small and the bathrooms need counter space. There was none. Our biggest problem was the valet service. We called 20 minutes ahead like they required and went down to check out and get our car. Well after 40 minutes of waiting I asked the front desk to check on our car. To my dismay they never came over to me to tell me how much longer. I inquired again after 10 minutes. They called again and said it would be another 10 minutes. At this time we have been waiting 1 hour. I advised the lady we would never stay there again and she did not seem to care. Well we will not be back and we stay in the city about 10 times a year. We like to try differant hotels but this one was a big disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet Parking

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText:
Stayed hear for ten nights towards the end of May this year, I was really pleased with the hotel, I stayed in single room on the fourth floor, I thought it was a good size for a single room. The bathroom was clean and good size too. The location of the hotel was ideal for me it was five minute walk from Union Square, Powell Street Cable Stop which can ride to both of the Fisherman Wharf stops and the BART. The continental breakfast I thought was decent; it consisted of a selection of pastries, porridge and fruit. Drinks were coffee, tea or Juice. You had to take this back to your room to eat, which did not bother me. There is a lot of diners near by where you get a hot breakfast you preferred.

I had no issue with the noise from the club or the area surrounding the hotel. I found it quite safe walking around the area by myself any time of day.

Overall, for the price I paid I could not fault this hotel, I would stay hear again.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value for money, great location near union square and the Bart. Would stay hear again

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Very nice stay, clean room and bathroom. The only downside of our Queen bed room is the size of the room is very small; about 12 foot by 12 foot room. Also kept banging our feet and shins on the wood bed frame because the room is very small and tight for two people to move around the room.

review.title: Central hotel with great customer service
review.reviewText: We checked in on a Saturday afternoon after getting into San Francisco a little bit early. The check in time was three in the afternoon with no option for early check-in. That's really nothing to be upset about though. Once we were in the hotel, the staff was always helpful and the valet parking was a treat. I was only charged for two days of valet parking even though we were there for three days (no partial day shenanigans!). The continental breakfast wasn't anything too stellar, but the pastries, juice, and coffee were good. We were on the fifth floor where we couldn't hear traffic or noise from the nightclub next door. The room was comfortable with air conditioning, a ceiling fan, and a small table-top fan that kept us cool. The shower was a little bit small and the showerhead was aimed directly at the gap in the door. This wouldn't have been a problem if the water pressure wasn't so fantastic. The room's free Wi-Fi worked like a charm. All in all, the staff was helpful and courteous, the room was pleasant, the breakfast wasn't too stellar, the Wi-Fi worked well, and the valet was great. There was absolutely nothing that Hotel Fusion lacked in and I was very pleased to be a guest there. I recommend it fully.
review.positiveRemarks: the customer service was outstanding, the facilities were clean, and the accommodations were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: continental breakfast wasn't anything special
review.locationRemarks: a great central location with easy access to Union Square shopping and the cable car gateway to everywhere else.

review.title: Comfortable and inexpensive stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion is in close proximity to BART and Muni stations making it very convenient to travelers from the airport or those relying on public transportation to get around the city. The staff, from desk clerks to the concierge to housekeeping, are friendly and attentive. The lobby and guest rooms are clean and well maintained. Both are also a little cramped. A queen bed, desk, and night table filled my standard room leaving little space for incidentals. For a night or two, the room is adequate. The ceiling fan was great as the window ac unit was rather loud. Overall, the Hotel Fusion provided a comfortable and inexpensive stay.

review.title: Amazing Hotel in the heart of down town!
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is right in the heart of downtown. It's close to catch the Muni, close to wonderful shopping and amazing eating places. The rooms are smaller than a usual hotel room, but if you are planning to stay all day in your hotel, don't waste it on a beautiful city like San Francisco. The staff is incredibly helpful and kind. Our room and bathroom was cleaned to perfection every day while we were out in the city. We will book Hotel Fusion as soon as we make our plans to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Snug & comfortable
review.reviewText: The Fusion is small but surprisingly comfortable, with more amenities than some larger hotels. They were one of the lowest priced hotels near my weekend location, yet included an exercise room and a light continental breakfast -- which I don't get at the hotel I usually stay at. The walls were a little thin, but the decor was a sort of laid-back, Pacific-fusion elegance, and my little room was excellent and comfortable. I did not drive a car, so do not know how they'd rate on that. Women travelers might be a bit wary of the fact that someone walking off the street could simply walk up the stairs, rather than needing a room card to enter the stairway or elevator. There was a desk by the door but several times while I was there it did not seem to have someone in position. All in all, very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The low price included an exercise room and a light continental breakfast -- which I don't get at the more expensive hotel I usually stay at.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls were a little thin, & no room card was required to access the stairs up to the rooms.

review.title: Nice and centrally located.
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel and central to almost anything that you would want to see in San Francisco. The Powell St BART is located just two minutes walk from the hotel and it's very close to Market St which is where you would get on a street car or MUNI. Although there is a nightclub right next to the hotel, it was quiet and in a nice part of down town. The room was a little smaller than I imagined but was not unpleasant. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was slightly small.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location.

review.title: Not if you need Internet access!
review.reviewText: Good, clean (although the maid didn't come in until late afternoon), ultra convenient. But no desk and lousy ( but free) wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was unusable
review.locationRemarks: Ultra convenient.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and in a very central location for visitors to SF. I would stay here again. The staff was super nice, friendly and attentive.

review.title: reasonable good
review.reviewText: Close to union square, very convenient. Old but nicely maintained hotel with sufficient service.
review.negativeRemarks: room layout
review.locationRemarks: just one block away from union square.

review.title: Great, clean and affordable hotel in SF!!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, very nice and clean rooms, cool decoration, and reasonable prices.
Superb location, just two blocks from Union Square, but without the noise of Union Square, and just one block from BART and Westfield Mall.
The staff was great and always available to help you with anything that you want: an address, suggest a restaurant, how to take the bus, etc.
Ideal for families, couples and business travelers. Next trip to SF probably I'll come back to this hotel again

Excellent option and affordable hotel in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I had a full bed room and as it said on the information it was really small (though big enough bathroom and closet). My window was looking at the wall of the next building which is a couple of feet away. At first that was uncomfortable but later when I realized how loud it is on the street and the noise wasn't getting to my room I didn't mind. Location is perfect to go anywhere in SF. Nice clean hotel and friendly staff.

review.title: Very low expectations, so they were exceeded
review.reviewText: After reading other guest reviews I was bracing myself for the worst, so I ended up somewhat pleasantly surprised. I booked a single room with a twin bed, which meant that the actual room area was just about the same size as the bathroom. Sounds terrible, but that's because the bathroom is actually quite large. The sheets were worn out, but the room is clean and the property is very well-maintained overall. The location cannot be beat (one block away from the Powell MUNI and BART stations), so if you're looking for a place to crash at night with a decent amount of comfort, it is worth the money. I wasn't impressed, but would return.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced and close to the Moscone convention center. It was very clean and well kept, staff were helpful and friendly. he location is great - one block from a BART station and right next to the Powell street cable car line. Not a five star hotel perhaps but a pleasant stay - who goes to San Francisco to sit in their hotel room anyway.

review.title: Very small and hot!
review.reviewText: The room was so small and very hot, no ac and the window opened onto a roof where other windows opened from other rooms. Great for an in and out trip don't plan on staying in the room for anything other then sleeping.

review.title: As far as el cheapo hotels go, its a 5-star
review.reviewText:
The single was tiny. But it was clean, recently furnished, and comfortable. What more can you ask of a hotel that is less than 1/2 price of the nearby mainstream hotels?

My only dissatisfaction was that the internet was choked to 0.5 Mbps. Kinda slow by today's standards.

review.title: Cannot recommend
review.reviewText:
My main complaint about this hotel is the lack of privacy. Literally everything can be heard from the neighboring rooms because of the lack of sound insulation and thinness of the walls.
The smaller rooms are Spartan in comfort and would be adequate for a budget price but given the rate I paid, very substandard.
The first night there was a........(editor did not accept the word) going on in the next room which would have put the Romans to shame. I had to call security in the middle of the night and demanded another room but of course, they did not have anything other than one above the noisy nightclub.
The next night they put me into another room which was bigger and more comfortable but still noisy.
Therefore, I cannot recommend this hotel and suggest taking it off the Expedia list.

review.title: Worst stay in the city by the bay... ever
review.reviewText: This hotel was small, cramped and, most importantly, hot, stuffy and without air conditioning. Other amenities such as a desk and full length closet also were lacking. The price was just less than more expensive hotels. The minimal discount was definitely not worth the minimal savings.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, great location and friendly staff. Could not ask for more

review.title: Good location near Union Square
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean, convenient and reasonably priced. The room was tiny but that was fine for me as I was attending an all day event from 8:30 am - 6:30 pm and used the room only for sleeping. Also, the hotel was remarkably quiet compared to other hotels I have stayed at in the Union Square area.

An added plus, the hotel is approx. 2 blocks from the Powell Street BART station, so getting to & from the airport was easy.

review.title: Great Hotel - Great Price
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel with a supurb location, this is it. It's not Marriott or The Hilton, and the rooms are small, but clean, comfortable, free wifi, continental breakfast - the showers are the best.

review.title: within expectations and can't beat location
review.reviewText:
Coming to San Fran for a conference and booking much too late, the Hotel Fusion was about the most convient hotel to moscone that i could find. The reviews left me hoping for the best and really it was fine for what i needed.
First it has no air conditioning, so get over that fact. Fortunately the weather gods shined and the temps were in low 70s upper 60s at night.
The rooms ARE small, yes.. but many hotels rehabbed from old buildings just have small rooms. I had a room on the air shaft so it was QUIET and shielded from street noise, altho not a lot of natural light.
Staff was really good and accommodating. so top marks there.
Location location location. can't be beat for to/from moscone.
free internet was hit and miss/ get what you pay for.. i had my wireless card so didn't need to rely on hotel.

overall a decent hotel. if you can get a room price deal, that would be best as i think if you pay rack rate you'd feel gipped.

review.title: I have never paid more for less
review.reviewText: Small room, pathetic, old, small worn out mattress, rude 'service', no concierge, no valet on duty, limited and expensive parking in the area, difficult to get to by car, barely an attempt at a continental breakfast, no A/C, window without a screen and a fan for climate control, TOTAL buyers remorse. I would not go back to this hotel if it was free.

review.title: Absurdly small twin bed room; room with no air conditioner
review.reviewText: While I received a very reasonable rate for this room and knew I would be in a room with a single (twin) bed, I was very surprised to see just how tiny the room was and even more surprised to discover it had no air conditioning. In San Francisco, air conditioning is not the most important item, but it's important enough to warrant some very explicit notice when it is not provided. Strangely, most, if not all, other rooms in the hotel seemed to have air conditioning, but not my room.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The breakfast was terrible, have to ask employees for food. No nice fruits....
Bed too small...but it was just a place to crash...
Great location...

review.title: A secluded nook
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a neighborhood adjacent to Union Square and the theater district that undoubtedly is a little dodgy in the middle of the night. The staff do an admirable job of securing the hotel against intrusion. They are uniformly friendly, helpful and accommodating to guests, and tolerant of the more needy traveler. One huge drawback is that the smaller (queen) rooms are not air conditioned and it took some effort to figure out how to open the windows. Thus, ventilation could become an issue. However, I am assured that it is almost never as warm as it was the first two days that I was in San Francisco. I think that this hotel is a good value for business travelers and people on a budget--all of the important amenities are there and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText:
Excellent location with friendly staff.
Could not of asked for a better location.
Very safe area.

review.title: location, location, location
review.reviewText: While the rooms are small and the breakfast buffet is unimaginative, the location and quality of the room are great for the money.

review.title: Will recommend to friends who plan to visit me in my new hometown of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with Hotel Fusion. I have been impressed every time I've stayed at a C-Two Hotel. I've also stayed at The Stratford Hotel. I sent an email to all my friends and told them to stay in any C-Two Hotel when they visit me in my new hometown of San Francisco. Hotel Fusion is beautifully decorated, very comfortable and in the center of town. My only complaint is I was told I could connect my laptop through an ethernet cable in my room for internet service. The lady at the front desk gave me the wrong connection cord twice. I didn't find this out til I checked out and another front desk employee informed me of her mistake. I was a little bummed because I selected the hotel because I could use my laptop in my room. OVERALL I was impressed and will recommend to others.

review.title: Tiny room and NO A/C
review.reviewText:
Service is good and condition of the hotel is clean and nice. But I got problem with 2 things, the room itself and parking service.

Might just be my room / deal I got. But it is a tiny tiny room, maybe 8x10. And I didn't realized there's such a hotel where there's no A/C in the room? Wow. I thought that type of rooms are only in Thailand. :)

Valet parking is a bit confusing too. There ONE (1) space in front of the hotel to park for valet. If someone's car is there, then where to park for valet?

It also takes 20 minute minimum to get the car. Plan ahead.

review.title: Looking forward to my next visit
review.reviewText: This hotel was very charming. Yes the room was small, but it was very clean and the location was excellent. It was so close to the BART, Muni, Powell trolley, and a nice area for shopping. I would definitely stay there again. I also appreciated that you needed your room key to use the elevator which made me feel safer since it is in a very busy location.

review.title: Not bad, but not great either.
review.reviewText: The queen bedroom was small - no bigger than your bedroom at home. TV was on the desk. Not much room to really move around. Hubby and I both thought the bed was really uncomfortable. The bathroom had no vanity, just a sink with a medicine cabinet type mirror, and the floor looked dingy, though the rest was pretty clean. Breakfast was pastry, Quaker instant oatmeal breakfast, apples and oranges, coffee, milk, juice. Not impressed, but better than spending money going out for breakfast. The valet, if you have a car, is horrible! Especially when the nightclub next door is busy. There isn't really anywhere to park your car by yourself, so you're stuck waiting the 20+ minutes every time you want your car. The hotel staff was apologetic and generally pleasant and helpful. All in all, we would go back if we couldn't find anything of similar or better quality that was cheaper. If your not picky, and just want a place to sleep and shower, but don't plan on spending much time, I would probably be ok recommending Hotel Fusion.

review.title: Great place for a our mother/daughter San Fran get-together
review.reviewText: The location was fabulous, just moments from the BART station, shopping, live music, & great eats. Our room was very compact but it met our every need. The staff was extremely accommodating when we needed transportation arranged.

review.title: March in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
All was great, location, room, hotel in general.
The only pit falls if I HAD to name any would be that the walls were a bit thin, the room small (but we didn't spend much time there, and not claustrophobic small). Great things like, location (close to BART/MUNI, a block from the rental car place, close to food and shopping....all erased any cons that we found.

review.title: HORRIBLE HOTEL!!!STAY AWAY!!!
review.reviewText: When I first TRIED to check into the hotel I was refused to be allowed to check in because they required a $100 deposit on a credit card and I asked if I did not have that, well I will not be allowing you to check in. WOW I paid for a room and was refused to be allowed to check in. I was told I could find a bank and deposit money so I could have the deposit for my room. I had to find a branch for my bank to deposit money, that is nice to do with luggage in a crowded unfamiliar city. I feel this is HORRIBLE customer service to someone that is just in the city for the night!! Room was small, bed lumpy and uncomfortable and comforter was dirty and gross. This is not some place I would recommend to anyone!!!

review.title: It serves its purpose, but its not a luxury 5*
review.reviewText: The reason for booking this hotel was all about location, as we planned to be sightseeting most of the time. Because of very bad weather we spent more time in the hotel than we'd planned to, which is why the lack of wifi (apart from in the downstairs lobby!!) was very very frustrating. If you have a laptop, take it with you - as they will provide ethernet cables. The hotel staff who clean the rooms etc start using the vacuums at 8/8:30am and they are loud, so dont expect to get an undisturbed late sleep :-( There is no parking onsite, its Valet only, but the service was good. The complimentary breakfast services its purpose, but dont expect too much. Also, don't wander two blocks to the left of the hotel into the Tenderloin as this area is a bit dodgy at night.

review.title: "Not Impressed, Will Try Another Hotel Next Time"
review.reviewText:
We had to wait forever for the valet to take our car when we checked in.
Only other concerns were that there wasnt enough soap and towels so we were constantly tracking down maids to get things - the maids vacuum and clean starting at 7am which is very loud and not fun for sleeping in while you're on vacation. It also took an hour to get our car back from valet when we checked out.

review.title: Great Hotel!!! Great Experience!!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel. We checked in late and our room was ready. Front desk clerk was very helpful. Room was nice, clean, bathroom was quite spacious and we had a great view of the surrounding area. A few steps from Powell Station Bart and Westfield Mall. I really recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Checked in for 4 nights. On second night we were locked out of the room. management could not open door. They upgraded us to a suite and were very apologetic. Great service. Rooms are a little small. They have the fusion club downstairs. If you happen to be in town on the weekend it gets pretty crazy in front of the club. Fun place to people watch

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is a sweet little hotel in a great location, an easy walk from Moscone Convention Center and right in the heart of a great shopping area near the Mission district. Easy access to BART trains as well. I was on the 4th floor, and there was no hint of the nightclub noise mentioned in other reviews. If you're using the Interwebs (free!), don't forget to ask for an Ethernet cable when you check in; no wi-fi in rooms. Friendly staff, clean room, great rate.

review.title: One block from Powell street cable cars.
review.reviewText: Everything it was advertised to be. A wonderful stay.

review.title: Fine place to stay
review.reviewText:
It was a cute typical boutique hotel. It had a great location, within walking distance to many other hotels, restaurants and shopping. The staff was very accommodating. I was upgraded to a jr suite when I got there. I asked if there were still 2 beds, they said yes. What I didn't know is that it wasn't 2 double beds as I had requested, but 1 queen and a small little cot type bed. It still worked out fine though. I would go back again. The room was clean and had plenty of new ammenities, however the bathroom was tough to use because it didn't have any counter tops in it, just a basin sink and a toilet. It was a nice bathroom but just difficult to find a place to put things.

All in all a fine experience. Would recommend.

review.title: Short bay trip
review.reviewText: I recently stayed in this hotel for a few nights for seeing a show in the city, for the price I paid it was great, it's just a shame the single occupancy room is a single bed, very unusual for USA... But overall good value..

review.title: Average
review.reviewText:
Room was very clean.

Breakfast is bread, bagels, muffins, with cream cheese or jam + Apples and oranges w/ Coffee, milk, apple juice, orange juice to drink. Downside is that it is served in a small room, on the fifth floor of the hotel. There are no tables and guests are expected to take the food back to their rooms to eat. We were told that a new, larger breakfast room was in the plans.

Valet parking only @ a cost of $25 a night. Took on average about 30 mins to get the car after requesting it. Had one problem with this service... they called our room at 8:30 in the morning saying our car was ready, when we had not requested it. There response was that there was a note from the night staff saying we wanted it ready for 8:30... we never made any request. Then some lady at the desk was a little rude asking us if we were going to use it or not.

Overall, my expectations were not exceeded, but I was not disappointed.

review.title: Comfortable hotel in a great San Francisco location
review.reviewText: Cozy, clean and comfortable hotel in a great location near Powell and Market. Around the corner from the Bart station and information center. Had AC but the ceiling fan was more than adequate. Breakfast buffet got us going each morning. Used the Info center to get our Muni pass (3 days for $20) and tips on Alcatraz, SFMOMA etc. Great restaurants in the area like Fish and Farm. I highly recommend Hotel Fusion.

review.title: AT THE RIGHT PLACE
review.reviewText: EASY ACCESS FROM AIRPORT TO UNION STATION. IN THE MIDDLE OF SAN FRAN SHOPPING. CABLE CAR COUPLE OF MINS AWAY. VERY NEAT HOTEL. HAD A ROOM WITH ATTACHED SHOWER/TOILET. PERFECT AT THIS PRICE

review.title: Location, location, location...and free internet and breakfast
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the heart of a great shopping area and a quick walk to the BART, cable cars, and the trolley. We also found it within walking distance of Chinatown. The room is very small and doesn't have air conditioning, though the windows open and provided some relief. Otherwise, it was perfectly comfortable and came with free breakfast and internet. We also booked a tour and a car to the airport through the concierge and found the staff very helpful. There is a club on the lower floor next door but it didn't bother us.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Clean hotel in a good location and neighborhood. Right around the corner from the cable car, Union Square shopping, close to Chinatown.

Not any problem with homeless on the street out front like many hotels.

The only problem I had was lack of A/C in the room and it tended to be hot when I got back at the end of the day.

review.title: Amazing Location; Very good deal
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Since it's a boutique hotel, do not expect a huge space at the room but it is very nice and clean. Perfect location; 2 blocks to union square, 2 blocks to BART and MUNI; it's basically right in the middle of everything. The price is very reasonable for the location. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location !!
review.reviewText:
Great Location because it's very close to BART/MUNI rail. Close to Union Square. Although, it's very close to the VERY nasty Tenderloin area and too-touristy Powell St. cablecar turnaround. Many good restaurants (Asian ones in the Tenderloin) and bars are within a short walk.
The Hotel is very clean and comfortable, but there is no air conditioning and the street noise could be a factor for light sleepers when the windows are open.
The staff was friendly and helpful. The prices are reasonable and valet parking is available for average SF prices.
In all, a great place to stay and I will return.

review.title: good price but no AC! No problem in the winter - they do have heat at least!
review.reviewText:
It's easy to assume things from the hotel description - things that aren't specified. We assumed the hotel was air conditioned, but it isn't. Sleeping in the room on warm nights left much to be desired. It was just plain uncomfortable.
I noted this challenge to the desk clerk, and she said yes, they are "working on it." I don't know how long they've been working on it, or thinking about it, but this hotel is significantly behind the times, comfortwise.
With a good price but no AC, we can only say that it'd be no problem in the winter - they do have heat at least!

review.title: Convenient but loud
review.reviewText: I was in town for a conference and found this hotel to be more affordable than the conference hotel. It was only a mile away so I figured it was worth it. The room was very small but adequate. The TV was tiny and angled on a desk so it wasn't all that great watching it. The bathroom was nicely stocked with Rusk bath products, which were nice. HOWEVER, that night, I fell asleep exhausted and was awakened about 1am by loud bass thumping noise. I thought it was some room partying but when I called the front desk, they told me it was probably the nightclub next door. They asked if I wanted to be moved to a different room but since it was late, I opted to change the room next next day instead. The thumping stopped about 2am but needlessly to say, I did not get a good night's sleep. The next day, they moved me one floor up but basically, it was almost the same thing the next night. There are 4 floors and maybe the 4th floor has little noise but I doubt it is completely quiet. If you want peace & quiet, this is not the hotel for you. But besides that, the location was awesome and the accommodations were adequate for the price.

review.title: A great find
review.reviewText: This was a great find, very convenient location, very reasonable rates. I was pleasantly surprised to find the quality of this small hotel, the friendly and attentive staff, the convenience of being a block from Powell street Muni and Bart station.

review.title: excellent hotel for the value
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have is that the room is a tad small, we keep hitting the bed frame with our legs when we move round the bed! Free breakfast and Internet connection are definitely a plus!

review.title: Great Room, Low Cost, Decent Neighborhood,
review.reviewText: The Hotel is clean and safe! The staff is friendly and professional. They brought us everything we needed fairly quick. The restrooms are clean and neatly organized. We stayed on the top floor and did not hear the music that came from Club Infusion next door. We did go to the club (on a thursday night) and it was sooo much fun!! did not expect that... you will find both young and older people there (ages 21-40). The free breakfast was fine. They do provide a safe inside each room. This is an area of San Francisco where people on the streets will talk to you and try and hit on you (lol) but if you ignore them they will not continue to bother you, again this hotel is safe, there is staff at the entrance door 24/7. Overall we had a great time! We were 3 guest and stayed in a Deluxe Double and everything went fine. No surprise charges!

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for me. Hotel is located in downtown San Francisco, a few blocks away from the Amtrak bus station where I was dropped off. Lots of things within walking distance: restaurants, clubs, Walgreens, variety of other stores, two cable car lines, subway station, and several bus lines. The staff were professional, friendly, and helpful. I was traveling alone and got a room with a double bed. It was small, but was perfect for me. Shower was a little small, but not a problem. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, closet was a nice size, minifridge in the room, wired internet free in the room, wireless internet free in the lobby. Continental breakfast was free and had a nice variety of foods. Also, they stored my luggage during my last day in town, which was very nice because I had to check out at 12:00 but didn't catch my next bus until 9:00 that night. Overall, I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location - would stay there again
review.reviewText: The Fusion is perfect located, close to the Cable Car, BART and MUNI. The valet parking is a bit expensive comparing to the room, but you never get a discount on that too;-). The room was small but had all I need (eben a small fridge). And the bathroom was nearly new. Only a was it bit noisy from the club and other guests.

review.title: Excellent location, very good value
review.reviewText: I was upgraded to a junior suite, which was nice, although it was still quite small and a bit dingy but the benefit of being at the back was it was fairly quiet. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. The bathroom was larger than average but the wardrobe was very small - not particularly a problem for me but it might be for some. The location just off Union Square can't be beaten and it is a short walk from Powell BART. The Tenderloin area down Ellis turning right out of the hotel is rather sad and some might find it a little worrying. Overall, very good value.

review.title: Great bang for our buck
