review.reviewText: Rooms small, but clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. Great location in Union Square. A block from BART and Cable Car. Many panhandlers, but none were obtrusive. Minimal amenities, but fine for our needs. If you're spending time in your room and need space, this may not be your first choice. For our purposes - namely a place to sleep - it was a good fit. Good location, easy access to transportation, budget friendly, clean. Would recommend on those points.

review.title: good location and value
review.reviewText: good value, but walls are very thin, can hear people talking in the hallway and also next door. Stayed at the top level above the club. I could hear some music at night but it was not too bad. The elevator is right at the entrance (lobby at the back); when the valet/bell person is not at the counter near the entrance, it felt like anyone can get in very easily. But overall no safety issues while I stayed there. Very convenient location.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel because it's nice location.

review.title: A regular to the Fusion
review.reviewText:
A very good location hotel at fantastic rates. Real continental breakfast ,you can count on.
I will recommend it to anyone on any day. The rooms are comfortable and right for the price they charge.
Most convenient location from tourist point of view also.
The staff is very helpful. There are many good restaurants just outside. You name the food and it is there.

review.title: I will always choose that hotal each time I visit San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very clean place
You will like to stay in the hotel
Good breakfast
Very geltile
Helpful
Very organized
Very nice
I loved that place

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is located just 1 block away from the Powell Station, 5 min away from Union Square and 20 min away from China Town (walking time). It's very convenient!! My single room was a bit smaller than I expected, but it's very clean, and I was surprised that it had refrigerator and iron. I will definitely stay at the hotel again if I visit SF!

review.title: Small but clean and nice
review.reviewText:
Negatives - No A/C so the room got warm at night from body heat, we were on the 2nd floor and could hear the bass from the nightclub below all night long, very small main room, TV was on the left-side of the bed so it was hard to watch TV from bed, poor cellphone reception, poor wireless internet connection

Positives - Great location, clean and new, nice bathroom, fridge to put personal food and drink in

Some of the other higher priced hotels suffer the same problems and cost more. Location made the hotel work for us, and I'm glad we chose it.

review.title: Can't beat it
review.reviewText:
I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Fusion. Upon arriving I was greeted by extremely friendly and efficient staff. My reservation was ready and the room was exactly as promised. The room was a bit small but it was spotless and everything worked perfectly. There is free wireless in the hotel lobby and wired access in each room. This is something other hotels in the area charge $9.00 - $15.00 per day so the price is even better for this hotel!

The location was perfect and it was not too noisy. I stayed in other hotels in the area including the Westin that were noisier. I would definitely go back and stay here again next time I am in San Fran.

review.title: Very enjoyable stay!
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean, attractive rooms, adequate (though small) breakfast. Excellent value when booked through expedia.

review.title: Nice little hotel for a conference
review.reviewText: Was in SF for a conference. The hotel was a short walk from the Moscone center where the conference was based. The breakfast left a little to be desired, as it was just bagels, toast, muffins, whole fruits, coffee, and juice, however, I was satisfied with the coffee and bagels. It would have been nice if the breakfast was open earlier (opened at 7). The internet access was weird, it required an ethernet cord, which the hotel provided, but wasn't at the desk, but on the wall under the TV, too far away to actually sit on the bed and use a laptop. That was weird but usable. Other than that the hotel was nice. It was comfortable and quiet, and the Asian influenced styling was funky. Overall it was a nice place to stay and didn't feel like a soulless business hotel. I would definitely go there again.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText:
Location, comfort, complimentary internet access, breakfast (simple) at <$100 are excellent features for leisure travelers or business trips. Moscone is <10 min away, BART station is 3 min away.
I forgot my hair style in the room when checked out, they kept it and my friend picked up later!

review.title: A Convenient Hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: It's a good choice for business/personal trips to down town San Francisco. The hotel is very clean and the hotel can also provide reservation for ground transportation from/to SFO.

review.title: Noisy but comfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room next to the stairs and people running up and down the stairs woke us throughout the night. Other than that a pleasant stay.

review.title: Great location, helpfel staff, clean hotel
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at Hotel Fusion, and I was satisfied once again.

review.title: Super functional at a great price
review.reviewText: As you can read in any number of reviews on Expedia, this hotel has rooms that are a bit on the small side (no smaller than many in Tokyo)...but still represent a tremendous value in an expensive American city. And if there is one hotel attribute I'd be willing to sacrifice, it's a big room. Hotel Fusion is clean and inexpensive, with modern fixtures and furniture that appear to have been recently renovated. The hotel is in an extremely convenient location, close to downtown, the financial district, and just a block away from a BART and Muni station. I asked, per the recommendation of numerous other reviewers, for a room on a high floor to avoid street noise as well of the late-night rumblings of a nearby club. The front desk staff accomodated me without issue and I had a great stay.

review.title: Art
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but very clean, great location and friendly staff. I will stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel at good price.
review.reviewText:
I was very happy with this hotel, with one exception: There was no table or desk in the room. There were small cabanas, night stands, and a refrigerator and safe, but it was difficult to use the computer on this lower furniture.

That would be by one suggestion to the hotel: to include a desk-height table, even if a very small one.

The decor was nice; everything was new, clean, and neat.

review.title: Simple Fusion
review.reviewText:
I stayed in a single bed room with ensuite at a very very reasonable rate. The hotel is right in the thick of Union Sq, close to all the iconic american brandstores such as Macy, Bloomingdales etc . Walking distance to San Fran Modern art Museum, Yerba beuno, and BART (underground) and the MUNI system (buses & trams to everywhere).
The room was small but perfectly adequate for one person for a couple of nights. plenty of storage space for luggage. Bathroom spotless. Nie products. Breakfast was simple bagels, bread muffins, fruit, coffee and juice. Perfectly fine to grab and go. They are planning a sit down breakfast area soon.
The only down side was that the walls are quite thin so was awakened very early (and late) by neighbours watching TV, talking etc. Staff were friendly.
Allup a fine place to stay.

review.title: Worthed when you have 30% discount.
review.reviewText: Well, I booked a king-size room, but when I arrive there they placed me in a queen-size room. Then I changed the room. Other than this all went smoothly. Breakfast was too cheap, there was no wireless in the rooms, but there was wired Internet. Overall, it is definitely worthed to stay there if you have a 30% discount like me. Otherwise, you can probably find better room around for that money.

review.title: Nice, Pleasing, Low Cost Hotel
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, was greeted by the door man who was very pleasant. The hotel lobby was clean and uncluttered. The corridors to the rooms were very modern and clean. The room, however was very small, But I am guessing most the lower cost rooms in these older San Francisco hotels are small. No chair to sit on. My biggest gripe however was the 25 dollar a day parking. I think this is the biggest rip off that most the San Francisco hotels are in on. Other than that a pretty pleasant stay.

review.title: Great location, great hotel to stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very near to Market St., Union Square, Underground (BART), Cable Car, which are more important to see and access. The place is very safe and near the good, but expensive food and entertainment places. Hotel is very clean, furnitures are in good condition, bathroom is good. But, first and second floors can be noisy, because of hotel's lounge near the hotel building.

I can suggest the hotel if price is OK for travelers.

review.title: good enough to stay in downtown for a couple of days
review.reviewText: We liked the hotel and surrounding... It was safe, and the surround was as well...

review.title: Excellent hotel, but caution!
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion, a perfect location. Totally great service. However, don't let them put you on the 2nd floor. There is a loud, very loud nightclub on the 1st floor (Club Fusion ). They did move me to the 5th floor at 1 o:oclock in the morning because my bed was shaking from the music, honestly.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: aaahh, gotta love downtown San Francisco- sure the rooms are small, on the warm side, and the location is kinda seedy- but its the city! The panhandlers are more entertainment than harm- the spot is literally 3 short blocks from the powell bart, which i (and many other travelers) rode in straight from SFO for $8. scored a great deal on the room, right in the middle of everything. Close enough even to walk to the tenderloin for a nice vietnamese breakfast. Staff was cool, rooms were clean, no problems. However, they do hold $100 for incidentals, which i thought was a bit pricey. For affordable, good eats you may have to walk a few blocks, just yelp it. If i can get the same rate, i'd stay often.

review.title: Good hotel with great central access
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location.The room was clean and the decor was nice. The bed a bit hard for my taste. We were located on the 5th floor (king sized bed/room). Unfortunatly,our location was above the hotel club. At night it was very loud with drunk clubbers on the street. Ear plugs saved me.I have always experienced loud nights while staying in S.F. and seem to expect noise at night. The bath products were good,( RUSK). Out of the 4 days we were there, I was only able to get the news paper on one day. The were out or the paper guy just did not show up until later?? The hotel rate during our stay was VERY reasonable for the weekend.

review.title: I love Fusion-C
review.reviewText: Perfect location, clean, friendly and very affordable! I will stay in Fusion when I will retun to San Fran!

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: clean room , convenient location , good for price

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: Great Location and good price.

review.title: Great Value, Great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price. great location, walking distance to everything, simply a clean basic hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We asked for a clean and quiet hotel room and that is exactly what we were given. The queen sized bed was comfortable and the flat screen tv was nice. We were in room 521. The bathroom was average in size. Our in room coffeemaker was nice and the coffee, cream and sugar were replenished each day. The free continental breakfast was sufficient: muffins, coffee, juice, bagels, cocoa, fresh fruit, and toast, but it is just a room with food and you must take it back to your room to eat. The location was excellent. With the purchase of a 3 day Muni pass for $20, we were able to ride the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf , Lombard street, and Chinatown, and take the bus to the Golden Gate bridge and Golden Gate Park and museums. Most transportation outlets were 1-1.5 blocks away from the Hotel Fusion including BART, Powel Street station. They have a computer room where you can roam the internet for free and print your plane boarding passes, they did not charge us for this. There is a free daily newspaper. We did not have a chance to visit the exercise room or the club, although on our last day someone staying on the second floor stated it was very noisy so I would recommend not staying on the second floor if you want a quiet room to sleep. Also we got a great price for the room on Expedia.
Never stay here.

review.title: Rooms are quiet, small, no view, but good location
review.reviewText: I was looking for a hotel near the Moscone Center with free breakfast, free internet, and a gym. Hotel Fusion has limited versions of all three plus historic quaintness for a great price. Breakfast consists of fresh fruit, bagels, toast, muffins, juice, tea and coffee, and it is grab and go (no tables to eat at). The internet is not wireless except in the lobby, so bring a connection cable -- they have a few at the front desk but often run out by the evening. The gym is a few aerobic machines, two benches, and some free weights. Up on the 5th floor my room was extremely quiet, partly due to the fact that almost every room in the hotel faces into very small courtyards rather than out into the street. The result is that you won't get a lot of street noise or natural light in your room, especially on the lower floors. But since I was out all day, this didn't bother me.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I went to SF a conference at Moscone. The hotel is in a very good location, convenient to BART, restaurants, the center, Market St. I thought the stay was very comfortable. No WIFI in the room, just hard-wired: bring your own cable.

review.title: Would totally stay again
review.reviewText: The location and price of this hotel cannot be beat. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The room I stayed in was small, but had fabulous amenities. The only drawback -- and I mean ONLY -- was that I stayed over a Saturday night and the club next door had its music booming until about 2 a.m. However, requesting a street view room would probably solve that problem, or simply staying a different night of the week. If you're staying in San Francisco, it's not like you'll get a silent room, well, anywhere. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: A basic hotel for a few nights
review.reviewText: Clean, but small room. Bed was comfortable. No wireless internet, just with cable. Close to public transportation (BART, cable car, bus).

review.title: city-centered, clean and cheap
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very close to union square and market street. Chinatown is within walking distance, and the car cable stop is just around the corner. The hotel is clean, my room was OK and the breakfast was OK. Definitly a place I stay again..

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and had a great location! The staff was very friendly!

review.title: Ultra convenient, a block from Union Square
review.reviewText:
I've got simple requirements - a clean room in a central location and Fusion ticked those boxes.

Rooms are a modest size, but I spent such a little amount of time in the rooms that it was fine. The location was perfect, I would definitely stay there again.

The only downside was the lack of Wifi which was a bit of a bummer, they gave me a network cable which didn't reach the desk which made checking in to respond to e-mails a bit of a pain.

review.title: The location is perfect, near the cable cars, subway and street cars too! Clean and confortable.
review.reviewText: The location is perfect, near the cable cars, subway and street cars too! Clean and confortable! Its not a luxury one but its fine to spend a couple of days.

review.title: Fun Weekend
review.reviewText: We will definitely go back to Hotel Fusion. The only critism is that our shower was small and we wished there was a breakfast room to sit in.

review.title: Great value- very close to downtown and transport
review.reviewText: For what you pay you cannot go wrong with this hotel. The room was clean and tidy. Its not a huge room, but its ok for couple of nights stay. Walking distance to Union Square and public trasnsport which takes you almost everywhere. Breakfast is served in a small room. You cannot sit there but its bg enough to keep you going till lunch. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I had lots of questions and they tried their best. Free cable Internet in ur room is a great bounes. I will def stay here again if I am looking to spend a fortune.

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: Have no complaints about this hotel, will stay there again when I visit in the future. Will probably bring ear plugs to help with some of the outside city noise, which was expected given the location.

review.title: Near Everything
review.reviewText: This hotel is great overall, the only problem I had was that the room did not have A/C. It worked out ok because the weather was cool, but if it had been hot I would have been pretty upset.

review.title: Better then expected
review.reviewText: Very nice accommodations and convenient location. Only downside was making our way through the crowd of young people waiting to get into nightclub when returning to the hotel at night. Hotel employees were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable - Good for Young Adults
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Fusion. It is located right off of the Powell St. BART, so public transportation was easily accessible. Also, you are located conveniently near all of the shopping and amenities in Union Sq. We didn't go out at night to the adjacent club, but we took a brief tour, and if you like posh lounges this will fit the bill. They will typically automatically upgrade you to a better room, but be sure to ask. We ended up with a corner room overlooking the street and were quite happy. Rooms are small, but that is the norm in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Hotel a little pricey.
review.reviewText: Only downside no Air con and windows couldn't be opened, room felt a bit stuffy.

review.title: Great Overall Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great part of town with tons of shopping and restaurants near by. Rooms are much smaller than they appear on the internet, at least ours was. Personnel at the hotel were very friendly and extremely helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel in an amazing location
review.reviewText: Will definitely stay here again - can't be beat for price and location. I do not recommend staying on the 4th floor front of the property if you are light sleeper - the morning foot traffic to the free breakfast is really annoying. That said, an overall great experience and I would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean the staff friendly near shopping and transit.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Best thing of this hotel is the quality/price ratio, as well as the location/price ratio. Staff at the hotel is very friendly. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fusion hotel for our vacation and found the standard room VERY small. Its nothing like the picture. We had to upgrade to a King room. The hotel is located near Union square But VERY NOISY, made sleeping very diffcult. The breakfast room was a small room with coffee and bagels. No room to sit, we had to eat in our room. The staff was very nice and pleasant to talk to. The hotel is in walking distance to many things: trolly/bus/shopping district/Union square and etc.. Great location

review.title: Single room
review.reviewText: Stayed in one of their twin rooms on the 4th floor - ideal for single travelers. No complaints.

review.title: Great Hotel & Great Location
review.reviewText: Clean, Reasonable price, perfect location (right in middle of Union Square). Rooms were in great condition although a bit small. Breakfast was nice also.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to a night club. The siren of police car and ambulance is there all the nights.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion was a great hotel with a great location. Newly renovated rooms were clean and comfortable, if a bit small...but who goes on holiday to spend time in their room? Continental breakfast was good food, no hot food though. Overall great hotel. Location was perfect for heading to any direction of the city. I fully would recommend anyone staying here.

review.title: Excellen!
review.reviewText: We had a couple of problems with the check in. But excellent location, very good prices, comfortable and clean rooms!!

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: This hotel was so much better than I thought it was going to be. The service was excellent, and no matter what time of day we ventured out of the room, we would always return to a clean room with mints on the pillow. The free breakfast in the morning is great, however it is served in a very small room, so if you dont like crowds of tired somewhat slow people in the morning, I would skip the breakfast.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: This hotel cost less than half compared to other hotels in the area. Yet, the hotel was wonderful. My room was elegant and comfortable. . .almost apartment-like instead of hotel-feeling. The continental breakfast helped me save money while traveling. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: great hotel, friendly staff. would stay again!
review.reviewText: We stayed here 5 nights and were very pleased. Everyone on the staff was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. The hotel is close to a lot of attractions- shopping, Union Square, cable car line. It's a little close to the Tenderloin, but you would have to go a few blocks before seeing anything sketchy- we felt very safe in our area. The room was very clean and efficient. The rooms have no A/C, and it occasionally got warm in the afternoons, but was overall very comfortable (we were there in August). The hotel provides an in-room fan.

review.title: Room hot & stuffy
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the perfect location, close to all shops & dining. In general the Hotel was very satisfactory only gripe is that the room was very hot & stuffy with no a/c, only a small floor fan that didn't help much. The room we got faced inwards so opening the window was no help either.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: I like this hotel as it has convenient location as well as helpful class. Room is clean and everything in order. Hotel appear to be safe and breakfast is fine although same everyday.

review.title: Everything you need in a good location
review.reviewText: Close to everything in a safe location. Small, quite and comfortable room.

review.title: Best value accommodation
review.reviewText: The hotel fusion was without doubt the best value hotel that we stayed in on a three week tour of the U.S.. It is ideally located, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the service teriffic. If only there was a hotel fusion in all major cities. Definitely recommend.

review.title: Near BART and price is good
review.reviewText: The position is very good. Only a short distance to BART POWELL station. The network is very fast and stable. Room is clean. Price is good.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: We stayed in the queen suite, for San Francisco it was very spacious. The staff was the best part of the hotel. They were very gracious and full of recommendations about the city. The bed was a little firm, but I would definetly stay here again. Parking was off site- but they valet your car whenever you need it. Their parking rate might seem a little high, but it was less than most hotels charge. The hotel is a little out of the way from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, but it right next to the Muni and cable cars, so its still very convenient.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: This is a relatively hip and well-placed hotel for an affordable price. The room, though very well-appointed, was on the small side. But we weren't spending much time there anyway.

review.title: Another fantastic stay at Hotel Fusion!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at Hotel Fusion. The front desk was very nice and let me check in before 3 PM. I think I even got a room upgrade - I booked a twin room and ended up getting a standard! I love the decor of the rooms, location, and service. Anytime I vacation in San Fran, I'll be staying at Hotel Fusion.

review.title: Small and noisy room
review.reviewText: We stayed twice at this horel. Both times, we rented the cheapest fare and got an extreely small room. The room had a bathroom, but the sink was in the sleeping room. Both rooms were extremely noisy due to the air conditioning machines in the court. Our rooms did not have A/C. There is free breakfast in a hotel room that has been turned into kitchen: Muffin, toasts, bagels, coffee, tea, juice, butter, jam, cream cheese. The breakfast is "grab n' go", you are supposed to go back to your room with the food you grabbed. The location is great, close to the cable cars, Bart and tourist information.

review.title: I loved this hotel
review.reviewText: My stay was wonderful. I loved my room with the flat screen tv. All the workers were very nice and helpful. The decor of the hotel was very modern. I really liked it and would recommend anyone to stay here!

review.title: OK Hotel
review.reviewText: Not bad, you get what you pay for.

review.title: Awesom location!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed there for a week from June 24 - July 1, 2009. The location is perfect, a block away from transportation and all amenities. Our room was the king deluxe and it was fantastic. It was very large and very clean. Great deal for the price we paid. Breakfast was meager - muffins, fruit, juice, coffee, bagel and toast. The fans in the room kept things cool as well as the open window, but that can be loud with street noise as Ellis St. is busy. Would stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for everything ...access to all transportation within a short walk. great place for the money

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: My adult daughter and myself stayed at this location on a short sightseeing trip to SF. It was a perfect location (only a block from the BART and the cable car and high end shopping). We paid for an upgrade to a room with two beds. (this hotel does not have many like this I suspect) the room was pleasant and the breakfast adequate, but get there early. It was very picked over close to the end of the alotted breakfast time. All in all a very good budget choice.

review.title: good location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: it's very convenient to take cable car or subway, and it's also easy to go to airport from there.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: This is a friendly little hotel, when I was there it was warm and humid, with no air conditioning the room was uncomfotable, they did supply a fan. I had to keep the windows open and the bathroom window faced an open window in the supply room. The hotel staff watched me take a shower, that was kind of weird. The location is good with a lot of resaurants nearby.

review.title: Good quality for the price
review.reviewText: Rooms are like new, very comfy and cozy. Very central, and the price is reasonable. Remi

review.title: Good Deal.
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, you can't expect more for the price. The only problem for me: the fire alarm.During my stay In the middle of the night the fire alarm went on (twice). Both of them were false alarm, but despite that, I'd stay in this hotel again. Worth the money.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: One of best hotel in downtown to meet your low budget travel plan, specifically for conference in Moscone West. It is keeping good maintenance and cleanliness. However, during my weeklong stay, there were two false fire alarms were really making noise pollution for such nice hotel.

review.title: It will be my first choice in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Acceptable price, powell station of BART and street car within 5 mins by walk.

review.title: Best bank for the buck
review.reviewText: This hotel is completely remodeled, so our room was brand new and really clean. I liked that breakfast was included (bagels, muffins, toast, juice, coffee), but you have to bring it to your room. There is no tables to sit where the breakfast is served. But, that wasn't a problem for us! I guess that is why it has only 2 star rating. But, really I think it deserves more. The location of this hotel was great; walking distance to Union Square, China Town and cable car starting point which is the best place to get on.

review.title: Nice choice
review.reviewText: Near everything, very clean and with a very good service.

review.title: Clean and peaceful
review.reviewText: My room was fairly small. But it was immaculately clean and well-maintained. It was also very quiet, which is not the case with some of the other hotels in this area.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: This was my 2nd stay. Overall, it was pretty nice and comfortable. The people at front desk were very nice and helpful. I also like the location.

review.title: The best choice
review.reviewText: Our room was perfectly clean and every day we found a little piece chocolate on our pillows. The hotel stuff was very nice and helpfully. It was the best stay we ever had in a hotel.

review.title: Friendly and Knowledgable staff, Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location near the shopping district and the trolley stop that takes you to other attractions. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I loved the complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby after being outside in the cold (yes SF is cold!!). The free breakfast each morning is great for people on a budget. My room was extremely clean and quiet. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Stuffy, window wouldn't open
review.reviewText: The first room I was in 427, the windwo wouldn't open, so they moved me to another room. This was after complaining for two days. They moved me to room 327, the window opened. But, I couldn't get an outside line to make any phone calls to my bank, message service, and my physician. I don't carry a cell phone. I finally got really angry and they fixed the phone. All in all, for the money it was O.K. I've stayed in worse. The mexican workers (maids, etc, were very nice, polite, as was the concierge. Desk staff was not helpful, some, downright rude.

review.title: Comfortably hotel near dountown
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, good position in San Francisco Dountown. The hotel is very clean and the people is polite, so for that rate I think is a very good option. May be the issue that the hotel should resolve is: To find a breakfast place (we have to go to the five floor, prepare our breckfast and return to our room).

review.title: Great place to stay but you need ear plugs
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an affordable handy place to stay this is the place (make sure you book a queen room) Double rooms are tiny. Night club can be heard from Thurs till Sunday 3am you need ear plugs. Staff are great and apart from nightclub couldnt have expected more

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the stay at the Hotel Fusion except for being on a low floor above the NightClub below. The pounding of the speakers at the club do reverberate to the lower floors of the hotel which could make it very uncomfortable for some. I would request a higher floor. Another thing is the couple in the room next to mine must've been in heat and went at it all the way until the sun came up. That was kinda disgusting to listen too. That happened after the NightClub downstairs closed so my first night there wasn't very restful. The rest of the nights there was more tolerable since I knew what to expect minus the sexing couple next door. I called my first night there, thumping and romping. LOL...All in all this hotel is centered in the right location for all you need to do and is very convenient. I'd recommend it highly.

review.title: Very confortable, nice style, privileged location!
review.reviewText: Rooms are modern style decorated, very confortable, extremely clean all days of my stay. There was a small frerigerator in the bedroom, very useful for storaging water, beverages, fruits etc. Location was the most convenient possible, one block from Powell station, still it was very quiet any hour of the day. Very friedly and helpfull staff!

review.title: Excellent place to stay downtown
review.reviewText: Close to everything downtown, convenient to Bart, MUNI, cable cars, bus; simple, excellent, basic. Only negative is that breakfast needs to be improved -- they have poor quality toast, muffins, juice, coffee only. Bring your own fruit and vegetables. Otherwise a fine modest hotel, I would stay there again no problem.

review.title: Great hotel shame about the noise
review.reviewText: This hotel is brilliantly located, the rooms are very comfortable and modern and the service is really good. The only downside is that the windows don't really block out the noise from outside and, as it is a very central location, there is a lot of noise to block out - delivery vans at 5am each day were the main problem! However, as long as you are a deep sleeper or take a pair of ear plugs the hotel is great and I would definitely recomend it.

review.title: Hotel Fusion is a great value!
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at Hotel Fusion in SF. The location is awesome, just a block from the BART/MUNI station in Union Square. The price was great! The customer service was fantastic. The room was incredibly nice, with excellent amenities, and a fully packed mini-bar and snack bar, with better prices than I've seen in most hotels. The size of the room was just a tad smaller than I'd like, but it was still very comfortable, and totally worth the price paid. I'd definitely stay here again, and often.

review.title: Affordable and Clean
review.reviewText: Small, but has all the necessities.

review.title: A pleasant surprise, perfect location for Convention Cneter
review.reviewText: Refurbished boutique hotel was a great choice for us during a convention in SanFransisco. The "breakfast" room, while compact, offered bagels, muffins, toast, juice and coffee - a great start to the day. Exercise room offered a treadmill, eliptical trainer and some free weights and was empty each time I used it. Staff was so friendly and helpful and the free coffee in the lobby was an added bonus. We were both totally satisfied with the whole experience.

review.title: Good things come in small hotels
review.reviewText: Stayed for a convention, excellent location 4 blocks up from the convention center. "Breakfast closet" on the 5th floor provides adequate continental offerings on the go. Room clean and well appointed. First room on second floor was undesirable and asked for better room which was offered.

review.title: Such a great place!
review.reviewText: This hotel was such a great place to stay. Other than the room being a little small and no air conditioning, it was perfect! It was quiet, the bed was comfortable, the staff were friendly and my room was very clean. When I checked in it was a very quick and efficient process. There was always a Concierge at the front desk and one morning I was waiting awhile for my ride to pick me up, and he came out to check on me! I got a great price and it was a great location. Only 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable cars and the bus stops right in front of the hotel. If you are traveling with a family, the King size room is your best bet. If you are traveling by yourself, as I was, the standard Queen room is perfect. All in all, this was a great hotel and it really enhanced my trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Stay at Hotel Fusion!
review.reviewText: I traveled to San Francisco alone a couple weeks back, and I'm highly satisfied with my stay at Hotel Fusion. The staff was very welcoming, helpful with directions, and always there if I needed assistance. I could not have asked for a better location either. All transportation (streetcars, cable cars, bus lines, subway) are within a block or two from the front door of the hotel. Union square is only a minutes walk away and is full of things to do. Hotel Fusion is central to all parts of the city including the Fisherman's Wharf, Haight Ashbury, Castro, and other points of interest. I loved how each time I returned to my hotel it was clean and welcoming. Every time I walked through the hotel doors (which are key entry only after dark for added security)the staff wanted to see how my day went and what I had planned. Your stay at Hotel Fusion will be the last thing you have to worry about when visiting San Francisco. If you are on a budget, want a great location, and high energy staff, come to Hotel Fusion!

review.title: Great location, basic comfort
review.reviewText: In SF on business for 6 days, and this hotel was surprisingly comfortable. Great location. Basic comfort and amenities works well for business travelers who are just looking for a place to settle down for the evening.

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: I'd never been to a boutique hotel before. It was a nice experience. The room was pretty, beautiful furniture, a bit small, a bit dark, but I chose a single bed room. Hotel employees were very nice and helpful. The only thing I think they could improve is breakfast. It was not wery good, far from continental... I found strange that you had to pick it up in a small room and take it back to your own room.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: This very conveniently located hotel -- near Powell and Market and Union Square in the heart of the city -- was a terrific home-base for sight seeing and enjoying the city. Hotel staff was cordial, helpful, and welcoming. Maintenance and cleanliness were excellent. My only (minor) complaint is that the room got afternoon sun and was hot (in March), but with an open window and the fan they supplied, I was comfortable. I plan to visit Hotel Fusion the next time I'm in SF.

review.title: if a return to san francisco, i`ll pick this hotel again
review.reviewText: the best deal between price and services, excellent ubication

review.title: Great low-cost hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel, and I'll stay again. Not without its faults, but for a rate that is about 1/2 what some other area hotels are charging, you can't go wrong.

review.title: Good Learning Experience for Next Visit
review.reviewText: The hotel has a wonderful location and the price I paid was exceptional for SF.It is definitely a good place to stay near the Bart stop from either airport and in the thick of things of downtown SF.The room had a clean new feel to it and everything was clean.You could get fresh linens each day or choose to be eco friendly.You could enjoy a great continental breakfast (go early) which saves a ton in a relatively expensive city.You can easily walk to great shopping, restaurants, Union Square, Chinatown,Financial District, or take public transport to Fishermans Wharf or the Embarcadero. The only negative is room locations. Make sure to not stay on the street or along the "club" side where constant beats keep you up at night until 2 or 3 am. Best idea is to call ahead and request a non street or club side room. Also make sure to visit the room before you make a final choice. I stayed on the 4th floor in a odd numbered room. Take the even numbered room. Otherwise a great visit to SF. Sunny days and pleasent evenings during my stay 2/26-29.

review.title: WOW! very impressed...
review.reviewText: very last minute travel plans, got an amazing deal. front desk was amazingly friendly, upgraded my room for free. decor was very nice, clean, comfortable. this place is right in the middle of everything! cant believe the location for the price i paid. plenty to do within walking/short bus or cable car ride. night club/lounge next door. will definetly check them out again next time i head to the bay!

review.title: tiny hideaway
review.reviewText: My room was so tiny that I could lay in the bed (which was in the center of the room) and adjust the blinds on the window with barely a reach. As a single traveler, I found this more quaint that troubling. Overall, I would say that the hotel was a gem, a very small one, but a gem nevertheless. It was located right in the heart of everything, barely a stumble off the Powell Street Bart stop and a half block from the Muni. The breakfast was as small as the rooms, but a nice addition, and the mint on my pillow at night made me so happy I'd found the place. I will return.

review.title: My Stay at Fusion
review.reviewText: For the price and location, it wasn't a bad deal! Right around the corner was Nordstrom, Macys, H+M, CB2, it was seriously my paradise. A couple blocks in the other direction, however was a bit shady. Pros: continental breakfast in the AM. good muffins, toast, etc. Near everything I wanted to be near, right downtown. Was walking distance from the office. Cons: smelled a bit wierd in the room. I actually went and bought an air freshener. which didn't really help all that much. I was on the top floor but the floors felt thin in that so, i am sure the people below me could hear me walking around. I didn't have any neighbors until the last night I was there, but as soon as they got there, I could hear them talking, their tv.. etc. Lastly, it was COLD in the room (at night). granted it was february, but the little heater in the room didn't heat the room up much. but i am always cold, so maybe it's just me. all in all, it was cheap, and i would stay there again if i was on a tight budget, but i might try something else next time.

review.title: good hotel - but loud area
review.reviewText: the hotel was nice - convenient location to union square and the cable cars. only downfall was that it is incredibly loud in the area at night - and no air conditioners in the room. however, they did provide a fan.

review.title: Nothing Fancy, but clean
review.reviewText: Small convenient hotel downtown, we parked in the parking lot a block away. Took a taxi to see Beach Blanket Babylon, $7. Easy off from the freeway. A little noisy between rooms.

review.title: The staff and service at this hotel is excellent!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff at the hotel do their best to accommodate your needs. This is a very convenient and reasonably priced hotel solution when I want to stay overnight in the city. Very clean and stylish and the location is absolutely in the center of everything.

review.title: AWESOME :) I just loved it!
review.reviewText: I definitely recommend this hotel to everyon! Great place to stay! Nice people!

review.title: Little Room. Little Price.
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, but so was the price. Conveniently located and comfortable.

review.title: Good price, even better location.
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was a great choice. The location was fabulous, walking distance to many great places, ie: Chinatown, Westfield Mall, museums etc. It was right next to the cable cars that take you directly to Fisherman's Wharf. As a single female, I always felt safe. Another added bonus, the BART was a 5 min walk. The staff was friendly and courteous. My only negative feedback is the breakfast was pretty sad. Don't bother getting up early for it. And my sheets had stains on it, so did the carpet(bring house slippers).

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: This was an amazing price for a hotel right in the middle of the action and including breakfast. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Too many issues
review.reviewText: They put us in a room over a very noisy club so the noise from the street kept us up all night. Loud party in room next door. Bath tub didnt drain. Great location though!

review.title: Decent hotel but wasn't expecting such a small room
review.reviewText: This was a good location if you're in town for a convention at Moscone Center. Hotel is 1 1/2 blocks away from the Powell St BART stop and Powell cable car turn-around. Plenty of great dining locations within walking distance. Only negative to this hotel was the size of the room. Not sure if this is standard in San Fran, but it felt like you had to step out of the room to change your mind. The bed was in the corner of the room which made getting out of bed in the middle of the night cumbersome if you were the person stuck against the wall. If this is a concern for you, spend the extra $$ to upgrade your room.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Located near Union Square and near to Powell BART Station. Also near the Powell Cable Car line.

review.title: Downtown hands down
review.reviewText: Location was just great, right in heart of San Francisco. Couldn't ask for better hotel. Room was very clean and big washroom. but few tv channel. No wireless internet in the room. You have to go to front desk for cable , but it was super easy to set up. Really great value for money. Just Awesome

review.title: Likely Wont Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is right in Union Square, chances are I wont stay here again. Service, although friendly was not that good. The combination safe wouldnt work and I had to call for service twice, waiting for a total of about an hour until someone arrived. Granted there appeared to be only two employees working at the time, management should have been more aware that it was going to be a busy night. "High speed wireless" was awful as it was rather slow and intermittent. They advertise as complimentary internet service but I was charged $3 to borrow an ethernet cable. And the room was very small, resembling something more like a European hotel. And lastly, who the heck was it that was knocking on my door at 425 am??

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, cheap price, but the bed felt like I was sleeping on a rock. Not sure if I'd stay there again as there are many hotels in the area. Great location though.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion location was great, as was the friendly, helpful service of the staff. But, I was not impressed by the stained bedding and carpeting in my guest room. Additionally, the pillows were rock-hard. So, this is probably a hotel I will not revisit.

review.title: You don't get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: We've been going to SF for years, primarily vacations so are pretty familiar with the city, but this trip was mainly for business. Chose this hotel due to it's central location proximity to the Moscone Convention Center. Most of the hotels in town were booked months in advance for an annual scientific meeting so prices were increased accordingly. The room size is a little smaller than other SF hotels we've stayed in. The carpet was stained & there was a mild mildewy smell from the bathroom. Overall the hotel is rather run-down. While poor service at a great establishment can ruin an experience the converse is not true. They staff were friendly & helpful but could not overcome the poorly designed hotel which had no sound insulation in the walls or ceilings. Apparently when the people upstairs use the bathroom the pipes run down through the wall behind the bed so you know your neighbors habits. People walking across the ceiling sound like mastadons on a rampage. I'm grateful we weren't here in the summer because the lack of a/c coupled with no insulation on a busy street would make it unbearable. I would not stay here again unless there were no rooms in town or they've undergone a complete overhaul.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Good points about the hotel: great location near the Powell Street cable car turnaround; attentive staff; extremely clean bathroom; light continental breakfast for free - bagels, muffins, fruit, coffee and tea; room amenities included room safe, coffee maker, fan, iron and ironing board, hair dryer and flat screen TV. Bad point: no air conditioning.

review.title: Small room but cheap
review.reviewText: Got the cheapest room because I only needed it for an overnighter. The cheapest rooms are extremely small. But OK value considering the area it was in.

review.title: Good hotel and great value for money
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very good central location - easy access to all the attractions. Breakfast is served in one of the rooms, so you pick up what you would like and go back to eat to your room, which was perfectly fine for the trip, but may not be suitable for all. Very good value for money.

review.title: Bring your own air con.
review.reviewText: When booking a hotel in the US, I always assume that the room will have some form of air-con, if only there for when it's necessary. Even the cheapest Motel has it. My assumption was wrong. We stayed there in late summer. The weather was warm, the nights were chilly but the room was like an oven, day and night, windows open or not, no matter how cold it was outside. Leaving the windows open was impossible. Although the area has little traffic at night, every conceivable vehicle with a siren passed the hotel, all night and every night. Trucks delivered during the small hours and we were treated to the beeps when the trucks backed up, slowly. We had to buy an electric fan and earplugs to sleep. The hotel looked great, on the surface. The reception is very modern, everything looks recently remodelled and there are even mini TV screens mounted in the walls next to the elevators, for whatever reason. The list of surface expense goes on. Some of that money could have gone into room comfort since I don't tend to sleep in the reception or hallway when at a hotel. The concierges were superb but the reception staff seemed clueless and badly trained. The best aspects were the location and the Sushi restaurant opposite the hotel, which was unbelievably good.

review.title: Nice, even with a cold
review.reviewText: My wife spent three days just lying in bed with a bad cold, but it was comfortable anyway. The room was a little noisy, from the shower next door, and also noise coming in when the window was open, since there's no A/C, but in general we liked staying there. Complimentary breakfast was convenient and good (bagels, grapefruit, muffins, tea, etc.), and in the lobby you can get California-ish water, flavored with strawberries, cucumbers, etc.

review.title: Noisy and Terrible View
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a nice location to Union Square but that's about it. Must park in public lot and walk two blocks to hotel. Room was clean and comfortable but had a view of only ugly rooftops with loud generators buzzing 24/7. It was a hot day for SF (90+degrees) with no air conditioning and I could not even open my windows at night without hearing loud generators buzzing on the rooftops next to my room.

review.title: Would stay again...
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location - just a block off Powell Street. The cable car stop, Union Square stores, BART and MUNI bus stops are within 1-2 minute walk. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for the summer season since there is no A/C. During our stay (October 11-19), it got hot during the afternoon inside the room, which gave us all the more reason to get out and do something! A small fan is provided which kept the room comfortable in the mornings and evenings. The staff was very polite and helpful with information on restaurants and directions.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION--A PLEASANT STAY!
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I feel they made a real effort to offer customer service and I appreciated the continental breakfast [not extensive but generous], and the afternoon wine receptions as well. The hotel is clean and well-furnished and in a great location near Union Square. My only slight complaint was internal noise, I could hear the tv from the next room, but otherwise I would stay there again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Good hotel - rooms are very small, but comfortable. Staff is very nice. Located in a decent area though it border Tenderloin. Would stay there again.

review.title: Very good hotel, would recommend
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Hotel Fusion on our honeymoon and were very impressed. The staff were all friendly and helpful, it is an excellant location, free breakfast and free internet use. Don't go expecting a 5 star hotel but it is clean and comftable, our room was a decent size but no air conditioning which meant it was hot at night, they did however provide a fan. The breakfast was good but not varied and you have to take it back to your room but it was good despite this. We would definatly recommend this hotel and if we go back to San Francisco we would stay here again.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Great location, good value for money and efficient staff. A little city noise, but no different than staying in London's West-end.

review.title: clean and friendly very central
review.reviewText: the hotel was close to all ammenities and one block from cable cars staff were very helpful could not fault anything about the hotel.

review.title: Wiring problems in building
review.reviewText: For the money this hotel is decent enough. the location is top notch, and the staff is attentive and polite. The only major problem is the wiring is sub standard and you can't always count on an appliance or light to function properly. My min-fridge didn't keep anything cold, and my iron failed halfway through a shirt

review.title: wonderful!
review.reviewText: I was delighted by Fusion. Rooms and hallways nicely remodeled. Refrigerator was nice. Windows open and close easily. CD player for inroom music. Will definitely be back.

review.title: visitor from san diego
review.reviewText: no thrills, good for the price and for one night stand

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Fusion is great if you are only staying tops a night or two and there is not a heat wave in San Francisco. The room was the smallest we have ever stayed in. Better for one person not more. There was no air and they provided a fan which was not efficient enough for comfortable sleeping. Also there were two of us in the room and even with making numerous calls, housekeeping only left us one face towel and one washcloth on most days. The location was wonderful but there were many other hotels right in the area that I wish we would have checked out.

review.title: Don't let the **1/2 rating fool you
review.reviewText: My wife & I deliberately made San Francisco the last stop on our month-long 'round the world' adventure, and as the final place to lay our heads, Hotel Fusion did not disappoint. We enjoyed the friendliness of the staff, especially the presence of the Concierge. A standout was the comfortability of our spacious room & even larger bathroom (a welcome relief after experiences in Europe!). Perhaps the best feature was its location: right in the middle of Downtown made it very easy to get everywhere we wanted to go, (as long as you plan to make Fisherman's Wharf & surrounding areas a day trip, rather than a stroll). With only a 20 minute journey to/from the airport also, it inclined us to make the most of our San Fran experience. If we returned, we would be looking forward to a fully 'fused' hotel. That is, by its own admission, Hotel Fusion is still building/renovating their breakfast room, and the interim measure of an almost broom cupboard-sized space for take-away breakfasts was disappointing. Apart from this hiccup, we would highly recommend Hotel Fusion as a most comfortable place to stay, and deserving of at least one more star in its crown.

review.title: safe -close to union square -nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to union square and close to bart Powel Station and tram station at Powel street.I feel safe as You can take.Have cable flat TV ,clean and nice rooms..They serve breakfast from a room(you go and grab breakfast ;like juice,jam,etc;jut keep in mind; there might be line as it is a small room and people wait to toast their bagels...Overall I am satisfied and liked the Fusion Hotel...

review.title: Good value for the area
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion was satisfactorily clean and comfortable; kinda funky. The location is pretty good, within easy walking distance to Union Square, shopping, bars and the trolley. The staff was nice to me. I got free Internet access in my room, although I was charged 3 bucks for my stay to use an Ethernet cable (bring your own if you can). The continental breakfast is decent, nothing special (bagels, muffins, apples, juice, coffee). Overall, I was quite satisfied with my choice to stay there.

review.title: will patron again
review.reviewText: I initially booked the king deluxe room but was upgraded to the queen junior suite when I checked it (good start to a weekend getaway). The room was very clean and spacious. Hotel staff was very friendly. Location was ideal, situated about a 10 minute walk to Union Square, Market street, and if are feeling adventurous, the Tenderloin (though a rough neighborhood, Little Saigon is located there and has tons for great eateries). The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel is that the walls are paper thin. I was able to hear the other guests one both sides of me. I would definitely stay at this hotel again (but will bring earplugs).

review.title: HOTEL FUSION - GOOD VALUE FOR THE PRICE
review.reviewText: Location was EXCELLENT - right in Union Square! Just a couple of blocks from cable cars, shopping & everything. Room was a little small with no place to sit and read, but was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were incredibly freidly and helpful. They're were always asking to help out or see if there was anything they could do for me. It was a real pleasure getting to know everyone that worked there. The room was very large and had a nice bathroom. The location is perfect too. It's slapbang in the middle of downtown. I couldn't have asked for a better location. It's also fantastic value for money. The only downide of the hotel is that downtown can get quite noisy at night and it fails to keep the noise out. So if you're a light sleeper that might be a problem.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion is perfectly situated in downtown, allowing us to use the BART to easily get there from the airport, the trolley to get to the Wharf (although we walked -- it's easy walking distance if you're feeling a little ambitious), and your feet to wander downtown. Hotel staff were all incredibly friendly. * Of course, there is no air conditioning, so we propped open the window and stuck the fan in it - which I recommend! * The hotel had a cute modern flair in the ole' building and a continental breakfast provided in a tiny room to send you on your way.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: s perfectly placed in San Francisco, Close to all shopping,transport and entertainment. The staff are very freindly and helpful. There is no air conditioning but a very efficient fan was supplied, but may be a problem in high temperatures. I will stay there again on my next visit to San Francisco

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location for shopping, just round the corner from the beginning of the cable car line. Staff were brilliant and very courteous and willing to help. Also just round the corner from Cafe Mason, a typical diner with lovely breakfasts.

review.title: Would be nice but...
review.reviewText: There was constant construction across the street and on the first floor of the hotel. Work crews and equipment started at 6AM EVERY DAY except Sunday. Breakfast room was tight and some travelers did not grasp the concept of "Grab 'n Go". Great location, but the construction made the stay less than satisfactory.

review.title: Excellent hotel, excellent price
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel and I was just as pleased with everything as I was the first time. This establishment is a boutique hotel but with Days Inn or Best Western prices. Rooms are quite small if you get the single twin bed rooms, but everything you could possibly need in your room is efficiently packed into the space including a fairly large bathroom, a large closet, refrigerator, combination safe, dresser, writing table, and flat screen TV. There is also a very good self serve free breakfast in the morning consisting of toast, bagels, cream cheese, fruit, muffins, juice, coffee, and hot chocolate. The hotel is fairly quiet at night and the walls are thick enough to filter out your neighbors. The only negative is that the single twin rooms face other rooms across an air shaft, so you'll sometime hear people across the way through their windows. If you close your window at night, you'll be able to sleep soundly without a problem. The hotel is near tons of food and shopping choices and near all transportation options to all the major tourist destinations. The neighborhood is safe at all hours. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for the budget traveller or for any one else not interested in staying in a large impersonal hotel chain.

review.title: Hotel Fusion, San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel has no AC, but the room had one of those Vortex fans. Room was on interior that faced the inner walls, preventing any circulation whatsoever. Appears to have new ownership, so lots is in transition state. Bathroom shower had curved shower rod to give the small tub-shower area a sense of more space. Unfortunately, it caused the shower curtain to rest against anyone sitting on the commode. Mac convention was in town, so it was difficult finding a room. Price and location were reasons for selecting hotel.

review.title: Best Deal for a Conference
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Fusion two years in a row. I was out for a conference at the Moscone Center. The Fusion is close to the Moscone and Market St and there are a ton of great restaurants very close. The Fusion has the best combination of location, price, and quality. It includes wireless internet access in the lobby and wired your room so I brought a wireless base station to my own convenience.

review.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of the City
review.reviewText: Great rates and a great hotel.

review.title: Good value for Money, very central
review.reviewText: Hotel was as described on Expedia. Breakfast was Grab and Go ! Which was very awkward on paper plates carrying them to your room. This was due to their breakfast room being refurbished.. Otherwise, style, cleanliness was excellent. Rooms not great in terms of sound proofing, we did't need to switch our TV on, just listened to one next door.... Very very central for the shopping.... Staff friendly.

review.title: PERFECT HOTEL
review.reviewText: My wife and I were very happy staying at the Fusion. Easy check-in. Lovely big room, clean and tidy. Modern TV with loads of programmes to chose from. Coffee making facilities, fridge etc. Breakfast was good, and free use of computer/ internet in the Business suite was a definite bonus. Staff were always helpful and friendly. The Hotel is very well positioned for communications and shops. It is only five minutes walk to Union Square and two minutes to the Cable Cars. There is a lot of traffic in Central San Francisco but our sleep was not disturbed at all.

review.title: Great staff! Great location, price, service, cleanliness. Not a single complaint, will stay again!
review.reviewText: You'll love the Fusion if you like a good price, extremely clean rooms, a workout room in 201, a free continental breakfast, really nice guys working the desk and consierge desk, nice amenities in the bathroom, and when the clock gets unplugged accidentally, it works again without resetting it. Great location near Union Square, extremely close to the Powell and Hyde clang clang trolley cars, easy to get to Lombard and walk the crooked street after taking a trolley. Tip: buy the all-day pass, you'll get on and get off plenty of times. Also buy the Gray Line 2 day double decker pass at Union Square next to Macy's.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The main reason to stay here is if you want a hotel with a great location. It is literally a block from the start of the cable car route (and an F-line stop), which both will take you to a lot of the usual tourist attractions. The rooms themselves were not that great; they were small and some don't have A/C (oh, and continental breakfast consists of cereal or muffins). But the concierge was extremely helpful and we thought the rooms worth it, given the location.

review.title: Tiny room
review.reviewText: Hotels in San Francisco, especially near Union Square or the financial district are expensive. This hotel is slightly on the lower end of the regular price. The hotel room is really tiny though with a twin bed only, which is a bit strange when you are not used to that. The hotel offers free wireless Internet but in my room I never received a strong enough signal in order for it to work. The complimentary continental breakfast is limited but that's pretty much standard.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel was superbly situated for downtown SF and then also for the cable cars to Fishermans Wharf or the trains, trams and buses to the respective sites of SF. Also, ideal for anyone coming via the BART trains from SF airport. The rooms are not the biggest but have big beds, are comfortable and clean and also they laid on a buffet style breakfast which is ideal for people who want to get up early and ensure they don't waste any time during their stay. The only downside was that, because the hotel is near Union Square and downtown, it was quite noisy early/first thing in the morning from about 6 am onwards. Else, no problems with friendly staff and also had 2 PC's for free internet access.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: hotel located minutes from union square, cable cars and powell BART station(30 mins direct from airport)really is ideal location for exploring any area of the city-hotel clean modern and comfortable-only slight issue(for some-didn't bother me)is lack of air con in room-on very hot days it could be pretty warm in room-tip! ask for room on top floors facing the back-seems these are quieter

review.title: Good value for San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Modern clean rooms (although small). Good value and location close to shopping, restaurants and transportation.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion is a real find. Great position,just along from the Cable Car on Powel and the Bart Station. Very central. I would certainly recommend this hotel. The hotel is of a very high standard, superb shower, lovely toiletries and big rooms. When we were there, the breakfast room had not been completed which was not a problem as they laid out the breakfast in room 507 and we were in room 502 which meant we could take the breakfast back to our room. Only problem was that there was building work going onm outside our room which started about 5.30am - not the hotels fault.

review.title: Excellent - Best Place to stay in San Francisco !
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent ! The service from the front desk and all hotel staff was top class during our entire stay, we had a small toilet issue and the front desk had a serviceman up to our room within 10 minutes to fix it. Half block walk to the cablecar turntable and market street tram cars.

review.title: A Good Value Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a well located city centre hotel. Reasonable sized rooms for an inner city hotel. Easy to find and good to reach shops, restaurants and transport. Friendly and helpful staff. Only downside was a less than generous continental breakfast provided in a small room with no place to sit down. Otherwise great. I would definitely use it again.

review.title: Reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. Free internet but you need a network cable. The room was well lit, very clean and new looking. It was very small though and a bit oddly arranged, with no bedside cupboard or table to put your watch or glasses on at night, the bathroom door immediately next to the head of the bed, and the internet data port was across the room from desk or any place you can put your laptop on, so you need a relatively long cable. Aside from that it was a nice place to stay in an excellent location.

review.title: Great location but bit noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location just off union square,at the cablecar turnaround and perfect for shopping beside Westfield shopping centre,Macys,and all the big shops.The room was very clean with good tv,but otherwise a bit basic.Outside the hotel is a bit noisy with traffic and bells from the cablecar so take this in to consideration when booking.The room does not have air conditioning.We were there in April which was not too warm but i imagine it would be too warm in summer.Also the breakfast is very basic just bread,juice,tea/coffey,muffins.It is in a room on the 5th floor and you have to take it back to your room to eat.Overall not a bad hotel for the price.

review.title: Hotel Fusion
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great find. Following recommendation from a friend and due to great rates we booked this hotel. The rooms were comfy, clean and well furnished. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Finally and most importantly the location! Round the corner from a number of cable car stops, close to shops of Union Square & Market Street and easy access to other parts of city.

review.title: Don't overlook this Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very good location. 1-block from cable car that takes you to the Warf. The hotel is very clean and great service. Staff very friendly. 1-block from Market Street/Powell BART subway. If arriving SFO airport, just take the BART to Powell Station and walk 1-block, cost around $5.35 compaired to $35-45.00 taxi. Every restaurant within 1-2 blocks. Great place and will book this hotel again. I was there in March/April so can not comment on air conditioning for summertime.

review.title: Great Staff! Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! My boyfriend and I were in San Francisco for a week. The hotel was super easy to get to b/c it was about a block from the BART station, the cable car and the historic street cars. The continental breakfast was simple but convenient. It was set up on each floor and consisted of juice, coffee, muffins, croissants, toast and oranges/apples. The staff was always friendly and eager to offer advice about the city. Our room was clean and decorated in a modern decor. There was a client appreciation gathering with complimentary wine and champagne one afternoon. I will definitely stay there again the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Good Deal and Good Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion was a good bargain. We were somewhat put off by the number of panhandlers in the area,but we found that this was a problem throughout the city. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The breakfast was adaquate and plentiful. Great location. Easy access to all modes of transportation. Was exactly what we wanted.

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: location is excellent , rooms are clean,staff very helpful and friendly and in the morning they provide breakfast that you prepare yourself and take to your room, most hotels do not include breakfast in the rates.I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind not having a "luxurious decoration".

review.title: Good Mid-Range Budget SF Hotel
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great. Close to Union Square, BART station, Market Street, restaurants, etc.. Though only a few blocks from the so-called 'bad area' (Tenderloin district), wife and I always felt safe. Staff were always very helpful and pleasant to deal with. Rooms were plenty big enough and clean. Beds were comfortable too. However, the sounds of the city (sirens, car horns, etc) didn't make for the most restful sleep so while I would recommend this hotel, make sure you are prepared for the noise (bring earplugs!). Also, parking anywhere downtown is expensive and parking spaces are scarce so if your plan is to stick close to downtown and do the odd excusion outside of the city, I would recommend renting a car for a day or 2 from one of the nearby rental locations to avoid the $25/day valet parking at the hotel. Otherwise, the location, friendly staff and nice room make it worth staying at.

review.title: not impressed at all
review.reviewText: location is ideal if you want centtal san francisco but the downsides are it s a very noisy hotel. the offered breakfast was scartcely what you d call abreakfast, more of a tiny room you stand with in, picking about pastries and coffee. the tv in several rooms isn t functioning properly. all in all, not the best experience although personnel was rather helpful.

review.title: great hotel, clean, friendly front desk staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel room was a little smaller than i had pictured, other than that the stay was great! Front Desk staff was helpful and on top of their game. Great location for shopping, everything you would ever need is right around the corner.

review.title: Great local on a budget
review.reviewText: great hotel for the money. No air in the hotel and a bit noisy with the window open, but overall a great stay.

review.title: Clean but basic hotel.
review.reviewText: The room I had was quite small, but as I wasn't spending a lot of time in there it was ok for my purposes. The breakfast is quite poor compared to some other continental breakfasts & you are better off finding a cafe to eat at. The hotel itself is very central to everything in Union Square and is modern & clean looking inside. I found it easy to get to from the aiport via BART and easy to get around the city using various public transport. The staff were friendly and more than happy to help out in any way.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: I arrived early in the morning from a long flight and was not sure if I could get a room at 9 am. The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating, so I got a room to rest. The only small complain I have is the lack of desk and chair in the room. It was very difficult to sit in bed and work on the laptop for my 5-day stay.

review.title: its location is a very good one
review.reviewText: i got a roon that is on elis street and aconstrution was going on was a lot og noise i coul not sleep next morning i spoke to the manager and i was move to another roon a junior suite wiith no extra charge was nice

review.title: Affordable and best location
review.reviewText: I don't have to pay alot but the hotel offers a 5-star service to make me feel rest-assured and safe. They take care of my luggage even before I even ask them for help to store it after I have checked out the room. They would ask me if I need help with my luggage while I was still fanatically packing in the room ready to check-out in a minute. I asked front desk for a little help with the location I want to go visit and they brought over the google earth on the internet and showed me the street view of the places I was going to visit. The free internet connection in the room is very useful for my travel and contacting friends while I am on the road.

review.title: City Centre
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel right in the heart of the city centre. A bit noisy at night, but comfortable and very friendly staff. Definately recomended.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: However, overnight parking was very expensive even for San Francisco, and my bed was quite small. The hotel was clean and the employees nice.

review.title: Recommended hotel for Business/Personal travel
review.reviewText: My room had two seperate rooms, each offering plenty of space, and were very clean. The location is perfect for travel or business: shop til you drop all within 10 city blocks or easy access for business travelers. If you do stay for business be sure to get a room that does not face the inside court (no cell or aircard service if your room faces the inside court). For the price I was very impressed with where I was. Location, location, location. Everyone was extremely helpful and genuinely friendly.

review.title: Great place, nice staff, close to all
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. the walls are a bit thin so you cant get too loud nor can you neighbors. Everything was clean and spacious. The staff was helpful in finding places to eat and party alogn with ensuring that you felt comfortable. The housekeeping was great too, she keep the room clean and I felt safe leaving my items out and about, she even folded my pjs.

review.title: Great location at fair value
review.reviewText: It has a perfect location, nothing fancy but if you are just looking for a room to sleep in and a very central location in San Francisco at a good rate - this is it.

review.title: Adequate but not much more
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion was clean and the front desk was responsive and the in-room services (TV and Internet) worked. The room however was tiny and rather noisy -- was hard to ignore the many foreign tourists celebrating something or other into the night. A fair value for the price paid but not an especially memorable experience.

review.title: small and chic
review.reviewText: Neat place. Good service. Good price, especially considering the location. Basic, but cool.

review.title: Very good location. Room facilities are new.
review.reviewText: I was generally impressed with the location and condition of the hotel. Less than 5min walk from the Powell BART station. Near to the Westfield Shopping Centre and Union Square. Almost every fixture in the room was relatively new. A simple continental breakfast was provided, although it wasn't mentioned. A pleasant surprise indeed. Also, there is internet access in the room. Just ask for the cable from the hotel counter. The internet access only cost $3 for the entire stay! The minuses. Only 2. 1) The room is rather small. I stayed in one with a King bed (Rm 206).
