There isn't much walking space. 2) Can be noisy. We could hear the bells of the Cable Car making a turn-about. Also, occasionally heard sirens from ambulance/police cars.

review.title: Great Great Great!
review.reviewText: Oddly enough, this hotel has great reviews even though it's cheap and 2-starred. Suspicious as we were, we decided to give it a go, and we didn't regret it! It has a great center location, but yet the room is quiet. Nice plasma TV, nice mini-bar, helpful business center with internet connection that helped us looking for attractions and discounts. Excellent service, everyone is so very nice. We had a coast to coast trip with San Francisco as our last stop, and this hotel was the best we had (and we had a lot, and good ones!). If you're coming to SF and wish to have maximum hotel for a minimum money- this is your place.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Excellent central location and very comfortable especially considering the price. Great value for money.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed for 8 nights at the Hotel Fusion and were extremely satisfied. The location of the hotel was perfect, as it was so central to restaurants, shops and transport. I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers on a budget, who want the best value for their money.

review.title: Superb location... great room
review.reviewText: The hotel is just few blocks from BART and you can even take BART from airport to the hotel if you can manage your own luggages. The room is small but clean and new. Bathroom is clean and functional with more than enough towels provided. Bed is comfortable and clean. LCD TV with integrated DVD player is a nice touch. Mini fridge is quite useless since it's just cool enough to store beverages. Microwave is availble in breakfast room. Look out for great deals around and book in advance and you won't regret it. Highly recommended for budget travelers who don't compromise quality.

review.title: I'll suggest this hotel
review.reviewText: The location is very convenient (few seconds to Union Square, Powell Muni and Bart stop and cable cars' lines) even if during the late afternoon and evening there are some homelesses in the surroundings. Room are very clean, new and well equipped (even a wide flat screen). Do not expect too much from the breakfast included in the price, anyway it is better than nothing.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: As a single traveller, I would definitely recommend this hotel - nicely furnished, clean room, comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff, excellent location very close to Powell Street/Market Street transport interchange, giving easy access to cable cars, buses, underground MUNI and BART (the latter useful for airport, Berkeley, etc.). Also very close to a wide range of shops and eateries, tourist information centre under Hallidie Plazza, and post office in Macy's. Complimentary breakfast of sliced bread, croissants, muffin, fruit, and hot drinks/fruit juice can be collected from breakfast bar, and there is a small gym and a 'business centre' (currently a couple of computers with free internet access - useful). This is a great hotel from which to explore the wonderful city of San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: This is a modern, comfortable and friendly place literally 3 minutes walk from Union Square. The room wasn't exactly large and the breakfast facilities were basic to say the least, but I can't fault the quality of the fittings. Free internet is a nice bonus as well.

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText: For the price we paid, and considering it's SF, it was just right and we are probably going to book this hotel again. Staff was very nice, and the condition of the rooms was great. The room was quite small, so if you like a lot of space, might want to address that with them before you book.

review.title: Great value for the money in hip modern setting
review.reviewText: Very friendly front desk staff in the modern, clean lobby. The hotel is smack in the middle of everything, and 2 blocks from the BART Powell St. station. Room was very clean, but slightly noisey as my room was on the front on Ellis St. I live in the city so didn't keep me up, but you'll want to know if you're a light sleeper. They provide all the amenities of the 4-5 stars, except room service, without the high prices. Very good value for the money.

review.title: Affordable find in a great location
review.reviewText: Centrally located - walked to the SFMOMA and Union square. Neat old building and staircase, rooms had great updated/modern decor. The walls were super thin, could hear the person's phone conversation in the room next door. One valet parking spot. Breakfast is bread, muffins, coffee and juice. Would go here again, cheapest and lowest parking prices.

review.title: Excellent Hotel for a very Decent Price!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fusion on a recent trip (early december 07) - the staff were very friendly, acoomodating and helpful. The room itself was well proportioned and well thought-out. It was comfortable for 2 people sharing a queen room for 8 nights. Location is great...very close to Powell and Market Street shopping! Lots of storage space! Shower was also really nice (better than mine at home!) Somethings that could have been better: Location is great and there are many bars and restaurants close by, however garbage and bottle removal from these bars and restuarants happens at about 4am daily. Usually woke us both up. Quite noisy for about 30 mins each night. Also cleaning staff are up early vacuuming rooms nearby (2x at 7am in the room next to us). Other than those small things the Fusion was a FANTASTIC value!

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, great location.

review.title: A great hotel in a wonderful location
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hotel Fusion for 7 nights in November. I was a young female alone in the city and I was worried about being there by myself. My apprehensions quickly faded away. The hotel is in an unbelievable location. Near major stores, restaurants, theatres, and steps away from the transit system (BART, MUNI, cable cars). I could walk to several places including Union Square and the Chinatown gate. The staff was friendly and obliging. I kept the DO NOT DISTURB sign on my room door at all times and the cleaning staff respected it. The breakfast room was adequate. They offered juices, coffee, croissants, muffins, and toast (although you had to eat in your own room). The room I stayed in was a twin room, which was perfect for me. A clean and comfortable bed, a fridge, a TV, a lovely (and clean) bathroom with towels and toiletries, and an in-room safe. There were several clean drawers too. The only downside was the thin walls, you could hear muffled talking and when the TV was on in other rooms. It wasn't an annoyance, though. I slept soundly every night. All in all, I recommend this hotel to everyone. Whether you are alone, a couple, or in a group, this a great choice.

review.title: Great location and value, But....
review.reviewText: Great location and staff, but lack of air conditioning prsents problems with late night early morning neighborhood noise in open window. Staff is great very helpful, location is perfect for BART, Cable and street cars. vlaue parking lots within a few blocks. Price is excellent compared to other area hotels.

review.title: Very reasonable price; great location
review.reviewText: Positives are the price, location and overall cleanliness. Negatives are the street noise; the breakfast consists of some fruit, bread, butter, jelly and few rolls; wireless and wired internet service very slow and not reliable (at least this was free but I would have paid for a service that worked). Room on the small side but OK.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location (near Moscone, Union Square), tidy if small rooms, fine for solo business traveler. Would return in a flash.

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: Lovely little place, room small, but sufficient. Nice location near Union Square and close to cable car stop. Continental breakfast in a small room with limited selection, but again sufficient. Friendly staff. Shopping and nice restaurants near by.

review.title: I'd go back there again, without question
review.reviewText: It reminded my wife and I of a European hotel. It was both modern and comfortable. The room was very clean. The neighborhood was very close to a lot of different things to do. The only problem was some of the pan handlers, it gets to the point of absolute rude behavior. But there are many places in SF that are the same way.

review.title: Excellent, especially for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and well-appointed, and the room was comfortable and attractive. It's literally right next to Union Square, so the location could not be better.

review.title: worth the price
review.reviewText: I had been there for around a week on a business.All the staff was extremely polite and professional. Situated in the center of downtown and close to the market street and the cable car station it is an awesome place to stay. Free internet access saved a lot of bucks. The candies and drinks left in the rooms was a very innovative idea which I liked. Complementary breakfast was a great addition.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was brilliant! Excellant service, and very clean and spacious room. Location was amazing, 1min walk to Powell Station and 1min walk to Union Square. Only problems - No A/C, but had a fan, and the breakfast was not that good (pastries, choc muffin, orange juice. Really enjoyed this hotel, will stay here again for sure!

review.title: Great location - just a shame you can hear everything from next rooms!
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Hotel staff very friendly - always willing to help. Rooms are small and no real breakfast room ( it was the size of a cupboard with cold snacks ! ). **Biggest problem** is the walls are paper thin. You can hear everything from your neighbours and I mean everything. We were moved to a higher floor and paid extra for a bigger room and we still missed 3 nights sleep (out of 10) due to noise from rooms next door. Would not recommend.

review.title: LOVED IT!!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed there for our 10 year anniversary and we couldn't have been happier. The room was really comfortable and the shower was great!! We would stay here again and would tell all of our friends and family about it.

review.title: Small, comfortable, no frills hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, just what i wanted, a clean room and bathroom, with a minibar and TV. Albeit the room was small, but i expected that, and i mean who stays in their room much when in San Francisco!!! The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly too, with 24 hour coffee/tea/chocolate available in reception. Breakfast was included in my stay, i would just mention where it advises there is a breakfast room, dont expect a sit down breakfast buffet. It is basically one small room with a toaster/bread, muffins and juice/coffee machine, which you then take back to your room. It was fine and met my breakfast needs, but just thought i would mention. I would definately recommend this hotel for someone who just wants a basic room in a central location (great for shopping, right near to Union Square) and the cable cars too.

review.title: good place and nice pople
review.reviewText: the hotel is locatet in e wery goog place, some rooms are small; however, friendly front desk staff ofert us a bigger room (thanks!) it was visible that the hotel was wreshly ronoviatet and clean. continental breakfast was given in a small room with no place to sit. It consisted of muffis, bread, crousante, juices everyday.`

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fusion in early October 07. Went online before and found this hotel by reading reviews. So glad we found it! We are happy to suggest this hotel to others for the following reasons: It was extremely clean (spotless), comfortable, and the decor was new and modern. The staff were friendly and provided us with suggetions on what to see and how to get around. The front desk has great maps, etc. This location is wonderful! Great if you want to shop, eat, check out the trollies, and the pubs. **incredible shopping nearby!** Regarding the hotel rooms, I was pretty impressed that although this hotel is older, it has been completely rennovated and is 100% wheelchair accessable. Our whole room (including the washroom) was fully equipped for anyone who has special needs. The Fusion also leaves complementary RUSK haircare products and lotions which were really nice. I liked the fact they didn't use the typical "cheapo" shampoos etc. that are typically used by hotels. The room also has a safe, and a fridge (fully stocked) and the Fusion leaves a large and very tempting basket of snacks and candy. This neighborhood is absolutely safe. There is an area called tenderloin which you don't want to go into, but it is several blocks away. You can't go wrong if you stay at this hotel. There is no reason to spend a fortune on a really expensive hotel - the Fusion was a really great stay.

review.title: Great Deal Great Location
review.reviewText: Small room, but well designed, recently remodeled, clean and comfortable. Staff was very accommodating. Would stay there again.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: Terrific value & location! The front desk staff was extremely cordial and helpful with a variety of requests. The room was smallish but very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again! Don't necessarily rely on the "concierge" in getting you a hard to get restaurant reservation though. Being independant and savvy can pay off better.

review.title: Great location and incredible SF impression!
review.reviewText: This was a great experience staying at Hotel Fusion. Customer service was friendly. Staff was helpful with everything we asked. The environment is clean, comfortable and modern. Also free internet access was provided as well as access to a small gym! The Hotel was a two minute walk away from one of the main shopping centres as well as it being a one minute walk from the BART station which we used as transport from the airport. Being a block from Powell St. That is more convenient for you to go everywhere in San Francisco. The Hotel was ideally located for exploring the city on foot. The Hotel Fusion made our holiday perfect and is an ideal place to start exploring the fascinating city of San Francisco from. I strongly recommend to everyone planning to visit this wonderful and friendly city to select this unique hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText: The room was on the small side and could be noisy at times, but given the price, I thought it was a great deal. Great location, clean, everything in good condition, and cable tv. The staff was also really nice -- they let me leave my suitcases in their luggage room for a few hours, after I had already checked out.

review.title: Unique!
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect was the stay in San Francisco. If you're tired of the "same old - same old" check out this hotel. It was very clean and very convenient location to the cable car and the center of the city!

review.title: Small but nice.
review.reviewText: Cleans rooms, friendly staff. My single room was a bit cramped. Good deal for the location near Union Square.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable, with friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel is in an excellent location for Union Square and downtown San Francisco. I would recommend that you request a room on higher floors and as it can be a little noisy at night. We had a room facing out onto the road on the 5th floor and heard very little.

review.title: A clean place in SF
review.reviewText: That's great place. Not very expensive and confortable. Parking is near the hotel.

review.title: Great location, nice and clean
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a suite, which I'm sure was much roomier than a standard room. The suite was very comfortable and clean. Not much closet space, but since we were there only for a long, casual dress weekend, that was not a problem. The location is great, and the service is friendly. There is a very basic free breakfast, which was nice to have too.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Room was small but clean and well maintained. Great location and a very reasonable price.

review.title: brilliant location
review.reviewText: Brilliant location, very close to union square, shops, bars and cable cars. Staff were very helpful, would definitely recommend staying here.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but comfortable. They have everything you need apart from air conditioning in the summer. A fan is provided but would advise spending a bit more for a room with air con. The breakfast is continental but adequate. great location for shopping and transport links, you really are in an excellent location.

review.title: Top Marks
review.reviewText: This hotel could not be faulted for my recent 9 night stay. Everything from reception staff through to the room and facilities was all I could ask for with breakfast included! The location could not be more convenient - BART from the airport is a couple of minutes away as is the cable cars and Union Square. This would be my first choice on another San Francisco trip.

review.title: Would definately go back
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was perfect for shopping! There were a ton of stores walking distance...including a 6 level mall with high end shops. We were able to walk to dinner, but there wasn't as many restaurants as I expected...you don't want to walk off the beaten path because you could end up in a not so safe area...there are lots of homeless and crazies walking the streets (as with any large downtown area) The hotel is just steps from the Powell/Hyde St. Cable Car which can take you down to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier #39 etc. As for the hotel itself...the rooms aren't huge...but we were very comfortable. There is no A/C, you don't need it, however we did sleep with the windows open and the streets below never quite. Didn't bother us though...its definately in the middle of the city, so we were prepared for some noise. Hotel staff was great, very friendly...as were leaving the hotel they arranged for a private car to drive us back to the airport ($47, about the same as a cab) It was a nice finish to a great trip.

review.title: What a relief - its as good as they say! Top marks
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. First of all its very clean, and has everything you need - flat screen tv, mini bar, tea and coffee in room and a safe too. Room had bath and shower and wardrobe - I know people say its small and it is but put your clothes and suitcases in the wardrobe like my partner and I did and you'll be fine. Nice windows that open very good tempreture. There is a gym on floor 2 and a lovely continental breakfast on floor 5 - get there early though for toast, muffins, couisants with butter and jams, juice and tea or coffee great start to our day, much nicer that we expected too. Hotel is new opened about 18 months ago so all clean and fresh. Most comfortable bed ever. Nice staff. Free papers downstairs. Overall would very much recommned as not only is hotel fabulous but location is too. Walk out the door and your next to all the city shops - starbucks, burger king, subway, and an italian all within 2 minutes. The public transport is all within 2 minutes also. Fantastic

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was tiny and the bed was kind of hard. Our room with a "view" had a brick wall on one side. There isn't any air conditioning so the room gets hot during the day. They provided a small fan but that didn't help much at all. The hotel staff was great though. They were very nice and helpful. It is also close to union square.

review.title: An enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: I've spent a week at Hotel Fusion San Francisco and I must say my stay was very enjoyable. My reservation wasn't the simplest one, since I had to stay more days than I previously estimated, but at this time the hotel was apparently sold out. To make a long story short, the staff managed to add the days to my reservation while keeping the same room. Everything was clean (the most important aspect for me), the installations were simple, but totally functional. The location is very good for those who intend to have access to places in downtown, near Union Square, Mosconne Center, Sony Metreon, Westfield Shopping Center, Powell Cable Car Station, etc. The staff was very nice and polite. So, if you are going to San Francisco, would like to be at a great downtown location, and doesn't need fancy luxury, I would recommend Hotel Fusion for sure.

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: This Hotel was an Excellent choice, we will definitely go back when visiting San Francisco. It's very close to anything you want to do in S.F. Any kind of transportation needed it's just arround the corner and the service of the Hotel is great, their staf can get you shuttles, restaurant recomendations, maps etc.

review.title: For the money and location...great!
review.reviewText: I spent a week in San Fran and the location of this hotel was excellent! Near major shopping and near the main transit connections, for money I really can't complain. Hotel itself was very clean and staff very helpful. The room was cleaned and tidy everyday. Even with no a/c, the breeze kept the room cool and comfortable. Besides, if you were hot, there is a portable fan in the closet. Yes, the room was small but what more do you really need.

review.title: Very Impressed & Convenien
review.reviewText: I was really amazed at the quality but yet affordability of the Hotel Fusion. The rooms aren't gigantic but just right,and chic. Yes, there is no AC,but don't need it b/c of the climate of San Francisco(also bring a jacket or sweater no matter what time of the year you visit SF). If you do feel that you need a little air,there is a fan provide but doubt seriously that you'll use it. The locale is just right. It is downtown SF, and if you need to get to the Fisherman's Wharf for sights & attractions(visit Pier 39) there's cable cars on Powell street(less than a block away)that can take you. I truly recommend this hotel, and will stay there again my next visit to SF!

review.title: Excellent Value - Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent value for the money - clean, quiet, well-appointed rooms with great showers in an ideal location. Leave your windows open while you're out, though - our room got a (tiny) bit stuffy during the day. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Fantastic Deal
review.reviewText: My room was pleasant and well-designed; the staff were even more pleasant and very helpful. Located a nice walk or short cab ride from the city's best neighborhoods, food, etc. and convenient to public transport. Hotel Fusion really impressed me.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights during August. The hotel itself is perfectly clean and modern. Our room was small, we had 2 suitcases by the door as you couldnt move them around the bed so very hard to unpack! Other than that, great place, good location for union square, not much nightlife in this area though. Make sure you dont go too far right out of the hotel as you are going into tenderloin. Lefty O'Douls is 2 blocks away and they do a great carvery.

review.title: A gem of a hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Recently refurbished, the Fusion is clean and comfortable, with very friendly staff. The rooms are not large, but perfectly adequate. The location is ideal for Union Square and the city-centre attractions, and the Powell Street cable car turntable is just around the corner, providing easy access to Fishermans' Wharf. At the time of writing there was no restaurant, but one is planned, and in the meantime free breakfast (toast, juice, coffee etc.) is available to eat in your room. Initially we had a room next to noisy air-conditioning plant, but the staff were happy to move us to a quieter room.

review.title: The place to stay!
review.reviewText: A small but excellent hotel, reasonablly priced, in an amazing location if you want to be in the centre of it all! Staff very friendly and helpfull. Continental breakfast just adequate but enought to get you started for the day. Definately would return to Hotel Fusion.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: We were only staying in San Francisco for two nights over the Labor Day weekend and looking for a reasonably priced hotel when I found this gem on the internet. It was very nicely decorated, clean, comfortable, near to Union Square, cable cars, good dining, etc., etc. AND the staff was delightful and helpful (even printing our boarding passes for us without a charge)! We will return and will encourage others to stay including our daughter who attends USF every other weekend to work on her doctorate and flies up from Southern CA after teaching all week.

review.title: Would Recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!
review.reviewText: It was SUCH a great value. Amazing location, beautiful, cozy rooms. There was a free wine tasting hosted by the manager with delicious local wines! The concierge Rich, was extremely helpful and nice. We never booked anything through him, and he was still the example of courtesy and friendliness! People sometimes complain about the noise, but we were streetfront and had no problem whatsoever. It's a wonderful boutique hotel in a PRIME location! We were here on our honeymoon and loved it!

review.title: Budget hotel in Fantastic Location in SF
review.reviewText: Being only 2 mins away from fantastic public transport (BART, MUNI & famous Cable Cars), Hotel Fusion is extremely well situated. Rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped (with own coffee maker & fridge) but EXTREMELY small and somewhat dark - so perhaps more suitable for petite travellers. Concierge service is variable - I had to make several calls before I was reluctantly given details of MUNI train times to the airport! Never one to use the in-room bar, I was unfortunate enough to be charged for bar use unknown to me. When this showed up on my credit card bill several days later, I phoned the hotel & queried it immediately. Staff were polite and helpful and promptly refunded the charges. Have never tried the complimentary breakfast offered.

review.title: sweet hotel
review.reviewText: great location, parking is 25 bucks a night about 1 block away, which is normal for San Fran. Very nice room and comfortable clean bed. Great food, bars, and shopping with in walking distance. Bart station is a block away and will get you to the mission district easily which is a great spot for bars food and art

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: A perfect stripped down, no frills place to stay. Location is unbeatable.Hotel personel were so nice. The room was a little warm but a fan was provided.Most SF hotels do not have air conditioning. If you want your Hotel stay to be glamorous, stay someplace else. If you just need a place to stay in order to explore SF for a longer period of time, I dont think you can beat The HOtel Fusion

review.title: Left my heart in...
review.reviewText: My sister and I recently spent 10 days in SF and were very pleased with our stay at Hotel Fusion. We were greeted by jovial and accommodating staff, Fusion gave off a serene ambiance the moment we stepped in. Although we weren't able to snatch a city-view room (they are heavily booked), our third floor room was not bad at all, with its minimalist flare, the 10 nights were comfortable and the room was always spotless. As noted on their site, there is no air conditioning, but an electric fan is provided, and cracking the window a bit is more than adequate to let in some fresh air and perfect SF weather! Will most definitely visit SF again and stay at Fusion...that is if they aren't overbooked!

review.title: Good location for tourism
review.reviewText: This hotel is very good for tourism. It is near Powell street (and cable car) and some good restaurants. The room was clean but a little bit small. I was in a room for handicap person. It was not really convenient but it was good for the price paid.

review.title: Absoultely Stay at this Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely easy to find once exiting the BART system directly from the airport. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and provided service you would expect at only the finest of facilities! Our room was extremely clean and maid service was kind and pleasant. The hotel is in a SAFE AREA. We ended up getting a wheel chair room due to checking in so early, which allowed us to have a massive walk in shower haha! it was crazy. THIS PLACE IS THE BEST VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY!

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Excellent choice, good location, great service - tiny rooms, but spotless and in great condition.

review.title: good choice for money
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in the city center, with BART, cable cars and Muni in 2-mins walking distance. The only thing I can complain is the size of the room. It is small, with the bed right in the center of the room. And the edges of the bed base are sharp. I was cut several time on my legs when I went to toilet or got some water. They might consider to put the bed along the wall. Apart from that, it is a quite enjoyable stay. Very convenient for everything.

review.title: Nice hotel except for the valet parking
review.reviewText: It is a cute boutique hotel with minimal services. It is truly centrally located so very convenient and the front office staff was very friendly. We had a delux king room and it was quite nice. The concierge, however, was rude and did not smile once or even look at us when we were asking about our car that was taking so long (20 minutes) to get to us even though there was no other person waiting for the valet. Do not use the parking service thru the hotel. If you want a quiet room, make sure that it is away from the elevator. We had to listen to the people talk and the elevator "ding" all night.

review.title: Tiny but good enough
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion has apparently undergone a recent face lift; it looks and smells new. Our room was compact, about 150 square feet, but had most of the comforts of home. The bed was very comfy, and linens and towels were replaced as requested (we tried to do our part to conserve water). Drawback: no a/c. A window without a screen opened to an air shaft, with LOS to other guests' rooms. We made do with a provided fan. The bathroom was really tiny. There was only an occasionally leaky shower stall, not a tub. A medicine cabinet was provided for your toiletries; good, because there was NO space for them otherwise. A couple of extra towel rods, or even hooks would have been nice. Maid service could show up any time after about 9 a.m., including late afternoon while we were napping. The hotel has no complementary parking, and parking all over San Francisco is difficult and expensive.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! I liked the decor & it was very clean. Good walking distance to Chinatown & Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion was clean, comfortable, and the guest services were usually more than adequate. It is small and so are the rooms, and the mirrors are oddly low, but as I was there on my honeymoon we didn't need anymore space. The continental breakfast consisted of toast, muffins, oranges, juice, milk, and coffee which wasn't the healthiest way to start the day, but it did help us save a few bucks. Overall, I recommend this hotel!! (not for small kids however)

review.title: Excellent location, very good price.
review.reviewText: I travel more than 40% of the time worldwide for the past 14 years in my job. My wife and I took a short break to SF while the kids were at camp with the Gparents. The location of the Fusion was perfect for our break. We took the BART from the airport to the hotel (within one block), and enjoyed a low budget, hassle free vacation using the MUNI public transporation in the city. Considering the rating and the price, the Fusion met or exceeded expectations. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

review.title: Friendly and courteous staff.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location - close to the heart of Union Square! We live just 27 south of the city and decided that we should stay in SF instead of driving home after a late night party. We were impressed with the friendly service provided by the staff. The hotel was in walking distance to private club where the party began, which was a huge bonus since parking in the city can be a challenge! Overall our stay was pleasant and the hotel is such a great value for your money! We will definitely return.

review.title: Great little place
review.reviewText: Very small room with no A/C, but we didn't go to San Francisco to stay in our room and even in July, we were fine w/o the A/C. Take the BART from the airport, don't both with a taxi or the shuttle. Very close to shopping and public transportation, great restaurants close by. The staff was very helpful and funny!

review.title: The Heart of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We were directly above Ellis on the second floor for a week, armed with Ciypasses. :) We had a wonderful time. Hotel supplied a computer cable for our laptop, free of charge, so we had internet. Staff was friendly and helpful to all questions. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. With open windows, the garbage trucks, etc, woke me up for the first couple of nights, but this is city living and we adjusted! Hotel has no a/c, but no big deal during our July stay.

review.title: Cute and cozy boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area; great central location for public transit (a block away from the cable cars and BART); right by the Westfield Mall and other Union Square shops. Many bums around but were all friendly and did not pose a threat to us. The room was on the small side, but was neat and clean. It had a nice flat-screen TV. The free breakfast was just juice, coffee, store bought mini muffins, butter croissants and toast. Nothing to write home about. Our window had no screen, and it opened up to a roof with many other windows- not much privacy. Also, the maid barged in on our room once at 8am, and came at random times without warning. Overall, we recommend this hotel due to the central location and warm and friendly staff.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed at the Fusion Hotel for 7 days-we were totally impressed by the quality of the hotel, the helpful staff,and the excellent location- Union Square, one block from the cable car turn-around and the Muni/BART station. The rooms were like new, clean and artfully decorated. We did,however, upgrade to a junior suite for a minimal amount, because the room we reserved was quite small and the queen bed was more like the size of a double bed. Other than that, our stay there was great and we will definitely stay at the Fusion when we visit San Fransisco again. the rooms were small

review.title: Good value - with a couple of flaws
review.reviewText: The Fusion is a nicely maintained completely refurbished hotel near Union Square, the cable cars and BART. The staff was extremely helpful and the common areas are small but well-appointed. The free continental breakfast consists of coffee, orange juice and packaged muffins, but hey, it's free. I was traveling solo and had a twin-bed room, which was small but well designed. It had a small desk, a chair, and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. The biggest problem was that the mattress was very hard and uncomfortable. It was also warmer than usual in SF and since there is no air conditioning the room was a bit stuffy. Still, it's a nice budget hotel in a city with generally high room rates.

review.title: Good, Cheap, but no AC...
review.reviewText: Nice, small & a good location. Stayed in the inside rooms with a small window with no real circulation. If the window had faced the street, well that would have been nice & cool. Good place to just sleep & shower.

review.title: Location,Location,Location
review.reviewText: Great location,close to transportation,union square,shopping,restruants. The room was small but clean and the double bed was comfortable. Friendly service. Ask for 5th floor as the floors squeek and the breakfast is on the 5th floor.

review.title: Great place to Stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Fusion. The room is very clean and modern, the staff helpful, the location is very central and in a safe area and the price is really good. In the room, there's coffee/tea making facilities, ironing board, hair dryer, small fridge, small safe, flat screen TV and the sheets and towels are very soft and fluffy. Hotel comes with free breakfast - coffee, hot chocolate, juices, muffins, croissants, bread, butter/jam. The hotel is so close to a big mall (Westfield Mall) which has a nice food court, Information Center, BART train station, Muni subway station and bus stops and lots of shopping (Union Square).

review.title: cant wait to go back for the 3rd time
review.reviewText: had a great time in sf, HF made is better for me to sleep and be comfortable, room was small but clean and so was the bathroom, I wish they had ac lol.

review.title: Fantastic!!!
review.reviewText: Prime location, clean, well-maintained, great staff - highly recommended!!!

review.title: excelle
review.reviewText: Excellent location right in the middle of downtown. Near shops, dining, and easy public transportation access (BART, streetcars, cable cars, buses) to all tourist locations. One block from: Market St., Union Square, & Powell St. Cable Car stop. Rooms are small but have everything a traveler needs. Feels more like an apartment building than a hotel (in a good way). Very clean and tidy. Excellent value. Hotel provides a very good light breakfast buffet each morning: fresh fruit, juice, muffins, croissants, and toast.

review.title: A rare gem in San Francisco's Union Square area
review.reviewText: We were delighted with this hotel which punches above its current status in terms of its cleanliness and convenience for all the sights of San Franscico's Union Square and Market Street shopping areas. Staff were friendly and helpful and the unexpected free buffet breakfasts a definite plus. Rooms are clean and well maintained, having recently been renovated, but travellers should not expect the benefits of air conditioning in all rooms (hardly necessary in San Francisco at any time of the year). Free internet access is available in all of the rooms, and those wishing to end their stay in style may like to take the Lincoln (limousine) service back to the airport which cost just $5 more than the taxi had cost. Altogether, the perfect budget hotel with excellent access to Union Square, Powell Street cable cars (2 minutes), Market Street tram service to Castro / Mission areas and the Piers via cable car. Other commentators have mentioned the less salubrious areas to the right of the hotel (along Ellis Street), but it is not necessary to go in this direction to access any of the sights and a visible Police presence was reassuring. Altogether no worse than any other 'downtown' area in a big American City.

review.title: Great location and value!
review.reviewText: Fresh decor and two minute walk to tram turnaround and shops. Stayed in a single room,comfortable beds and fresh looking. Only complaint was the lack of natural light as only one window in bedding area. As with the rest of San Fran,expect a lot of homeless people to approach you for change as soon as you hit the streets.

review.title: Best Choice I Ever Made!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Fusion 6-22 to 6-25. Expedia had a rating for Fusion of 2.5 stars. Something is terribly wrong with the rating format. Fusion staff were very nice and helpful. The cleaning staff were on their job also. The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished and set-up in a contemporary style. The rooms are a bit small but fine for two people. I loved that the window faced Ellis Street and you could here the mood of the city. One of the best things about Fusion was I was one block frm the BART system which can get me anywhere around the Bay area, one block from the Trolleys, and a couple of blocks from the F bus line which takes you from the Whorf to downtown and visa versa. Just two blocks away is Weisfields shopping center, you can imagine whats in there. Shuttle service was a breeze to and from the SF airport. The Concierge was incredibly helpful and very knowledgeable. If you plan to visit SF I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE HOTEL FUSION. The price is right and you will be happy you did.

review.title: It is what it is!
review.reviewText: Let's be honest, this is a 3 star hotel and you get what you pay for. My requirements were location, price and cleanliness - Hotel Fusion more then met my expectations on all three. Another reason I picked this hotel was it included a continental breakfast, unfortunately, this was very disappointing. The fruit was no where near ripe and on the verge of being rotten, some pieces were actually bruised. Apart from that I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, Will Return
review.reviewText: I was thoroughly impressed with this inexpensive hotel in the heart of San Francisco. It's close to Union Square and Moscone Centre, it's clean and quiet.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: When I booked the hotel, I was a little concerned by the lack of air conditioning, but I couldn't ignore the price, especially given the location. This hotel is just around the corner from Powell Street Cable Car and BART stations. Besides, I wasn't planning to spend much time in the room. The room was comfortable--when I left the window open. San Francisco is very mild, even in June. However, it was a bit noisy--my room was right on Ellis St. Closing the window cut the noise a lot, but did cause the room to get hot. They offered me a fan, which kept things comfortable. The room and especially the bathroom were very small, but adequate for my needs. Free high-speed wire internet was a nice bonus (bring your own cable)

review.title: Fusion
review.reviewText: The Fusion was a nice hotel, very close to Union Square, the cable car turn around on Powell Street and the BART which you can catch from the airport. All a few minutes walk away. The hotel was clean, the room well equipped and the staff friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was very simple, toast, croissants and muffins and a choice of juice. Although get there early as once its gone, its gone!

review.title: Excellent centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and clean well kept rooms, what more can you ask for in a reasonably priced centrally located hotel. Location is excellet for shopping and transport links to the rest of the city.

review.title: San Franicisco Union Square gem
review.reviewText: Ideal location, easy access. Just around the corner from the BART station making it easy to get to and from the airport. Room adequate for one or two. Continental breakfast a welcome perk. The juice and coffee were great, with the rest of the offerings adequate. Filling, but nothing special. Walls a little thin and one noisy neighbor can ruin the stay. Fortunately, the noise was brief and not too late at night.

review.title: Clean, small room/single bed, central to Union Sq but bed too hard for me
review.reviewText: I was disappointed in small size of room and only a single bed, but I said to myself, how long does one spend in the room anyways? However, bed proved to be way-too-firm for my back (I do have some back problems). If you want economy and like a hard bed, it's fine, but not suitable for everyone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This place was cute and close to everything, i highly recomended. Literaly you can walk everywhere union square, chinatown, westfield mall. There are a lot of restaurants near by.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The location of Hotel fusion is great It was in great walking distance to many shops and restaurants and was also extremly close to the bart and the muni system! It was quite small but very clean and the front desk staff were very friendly. The only complaint I have about the hotel was that we were next door to the elevator and you could here people getting on or off. Other than that we were very satisfied.

review.title: Great place to stay. I would book it again.
review.reviewText: Other than the rooms being a little small, they were very clean, professional, and the service was A1. The location is great, in the centre of San Francisco's downtown area, but parking is a little bit of a challenge if you have to drive there.

review.title: Hotel Fusion - Great Price & Location
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion was a located in a good section of Union Square, a few homeless people, just say sorry, no spare change and they leave you alone. The room was small but it is a boutique hotel. Small breakfast was offered, muffins, toast, juice, coffee & tea. Great price, I stayed from 5/12/07 thru 5/19/07.

review.title: Great Downtown San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Although my room was a little small, the view out my window was of a neighboring wall, and there was some occasional noise; this hotel represents excellent value for the dollar. The housekeeping staff kept it immaculate. The front desk and valet staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The room's physical amenities (i.e. shower, flat-screen TV) were practically brand new (at this point in time) and functioned flawlessly. Hotel Fusion is located very close to a wide range of shopping and dining establishments, as well as municipal transit stops and cable cars.

review.title: Pretty Good for the Price
review.reviewText: It was clean, they were friendly. The shower was a bit leaky but that's alright. I was a bit worried by the sign about how there's some sorta cancer causing agent (probably asbestos) in the building, but it seems half of San Francisco has that problem so it's all good. Altogether a great location. Fitness center could be better, but for the price I can't complain too much.

review.title: Loved HF
review.reviewText: Went there for 8 days, very clean and comfy for the price. Hotel staff was great, and the lipton tea, that was even better lol. Will def stay again!

review.title: Great staff, great location, great value for money, no complaints.
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Hotel Fusion for one week. This hotel is in an excellent location, two minutes walk from Union Square. Staff very helpful, room clean, and modern, and well for the money I was very pleased and satisfied. Would have no hesitation staying at this hotel again.

review.title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice. In our opinion we couldn't have stayed in a beter location in San Francisco. The cable car and F line are both blocks away, and bus services are also nearby. Don't be put off by the Tenderloin being close by as the area surrounding the hotel is fine. This was one point which almost made us choose another hotel, but so glad we didn't. The reception staff were extremely friendly, the friendliset I've ever encountered in a hotel. They happily provided information when we asked, even checking the itnernet and printing info off for us. Our double room was imaculate, and we had booked the standard room. We had 2 beds, 2 flat screen tvs, a fridge, a safe and a large bathroom. We were not disturbed by noise at all which was excellent as we needed our sleep at night! The complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning was an excellent start to the day, with muffins and croissants available along with toast facilities, tea, coffee and juice. The whole holiday we could not believe we had picked such a great hotel, especially for the price we paid. I have been recomending it to everyone who is considering a trip to San Francisco since I got home!

review.title: Good option
review.reviewText: Very well located with easy access to many public transportation options. Don't rent a car since the valet service is a rip off.

review.title: Best budget option near Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location, clean, simple, value for money

review.title: The good and the bad
review.reviewText: It was an excellent location to see downtown San Francisco and the staff was amazingly helpful, knowledgeable, and polite. However, I picked the hotel for two other reasons. I wanted a gym and wireless internet service. Unfortunately, the signal was too weak to ever connect with my laptop and the one treadmill at the gym was broken.

review.title: good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I was very happy with my stay at the Fusion. Rooms are basic, but it's a great location near Union Square and I don't go to San Francisco to sit in my hotel room. Staff is very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Excellent hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is in a prime location for the heart of the city. The staff on the desk were very helpful, the hotel very clean and the rooms great value for money. Will recommend it to friend and family without question. Catch the BART from the airport and its only a 5 min walk from the station.

review.title: Trip was a success!
review.reviewText: My room was perfect and I was very comfortable the whole week in San Francisco. The location was perfect and for the price it was awesome. Why spent more money for the same quality of service. This hotel was a great success!

review.title: Great central location at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Apart from the really annoying concierge guy, the hotel far exceeded expectations. Location is spot on for shops and for hopping on the cable car to fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel in good central location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near to Union Square, and to the excellent shops.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: This hotel was really a bargain. I booked for 7 days and only paid for 5. The location is great, at two blocks from Union Square and one from the Power Station. I heared the street and the bell from the Cable car, but it wasn't that bad. The room was always clean.

review.title: the price is right
review.reviewText: this hotel is very good. the staff is very friendly and the room is very good. free internet with lcd tv and dvd player in your room with the best price you can get.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion, what can i say, great location 1block away from the bart, clean, friendly service, modern, clean, rooms are a bit small, but clean,I would stay at this hotel all the time, i cannot brag enough about this hotel.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Reasonable price!

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Me and my boyfriend when for a trip to San Francisco for 7 days and wanted a nice hotel which was near to all the shops, transport etc. but didnt cost a fortune. Hotel Fusion was exactly that. The Hotel employees were among the most helpful and friendly staff I have encountered on holiday. They went out of there way to help us find places around San Francisco and helped us arrange trips! The queen bed room was nice but quite small. Clean towels and bed linen everyday. Bathroom was huge and spotless. Hotel Fusion was in a great location! Walk out of the hotel and turn left and you have cable cars to your right and 2 minutes walk to the left you have Union Square. Close by you also have buses that take you everywhere but the BART and MUNI were the best modes of transport and they were next to the cable car. I dont have a bad thing to say about Hotel Fusion, it was great for a hotel with friendly staff, clean basic rooms and cheap. The only slight thing about San Francisco as a whole was the amount of homeless people who were everywhere! Although I think that San Francisco should consider making begging illegal, San Francisco is a great place to visit and we would definitely go back in years to come and would definitely go about to Hotel Fusion if we were going to stay in the same area.

review.title: If it seems too good to be true...it probably is
review.reviewText: The price of this hotel was surprisingly cheap to be in the middle of the downtown area, but of course there was a huge catch. If you are planning on renting a car or driving to San Francisco, good luck finding cheap/free parking anywhere in the downtown area. This hotel is no different. The only parking available is valet which starts at $31 a night($46 if you have an SUV or van). The room was nice and comfortable, but the walls were very thin. Overall, I would not stay here again because of the outrageous nightly parking rate.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Obvously the room is tiny, the window view was a view of another persons window. The beds were hard. other than that the staff was very friendly the rooms were clean and the location was great.

review.title: Excellent choice, would recommend to my friends
review.reviewText: Clean, well maintained, friendly staff, close to everything, great price, no frills, decent breakfast, comfortable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Again, VERY clean and comfortable, staff was great to us! Continental breakfast is consistently good/quick...toast, juice, muffins, coffee, fruit. Small rooms offer everything you need and not much that you dont. (fridge, safe, closet, flat tv, desk, all non smoking) If you want to check out San Fran and be right in the heart of it all for a smaller budget and just need a clean, quiet place to sleep, dont hesitate to stay at the Fusion. 5 stories, so it's easy to get up and down quick. 1 complaint- fridge in room didnt work very well.

review.title: Excellent Location, small room
review.reviewText: Hotel is in excellent location in Union Square. It is right around the corner from the Trolly and Powell Bart Station. You can walk anywhere... the mall, Bloomingdales, Nordstrom, Saks, Macy's, restaurants, shopping, China Town, etc... We even walked back from Fisherman's Wharf which was a little far but just so you can idea that the hotel is centrally located. I would def stay there again. The only thing that bothered me is that I asked for a Queen size bed and we got a very small room with a full size bed with a brick wall as our view. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The room did get stuffy and we had to open the window at night, but there was no screen on the window. Overall it was an excellent stay and the staff is extremely friendly. You can book tours and ask them anything about what to do while your there.

review.title: Nice and Affordable
review.reviewText: The staff at the Hotel Fusion was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small yet have all the essentials. The location was also fantastic, very close to Union Square. The only minor issue was that there was no screen on the window. We left the window open cause it got a little stuffy and hot at times and it was fine even without the screen. However, since we went in March I imagine it would get hotter in the summer. Not sure if they have air conditioning or not...

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: This was money very well spent. This modern hotel is located centrally, within walkining distance to many interesting ereas. The staff was helpfull and polite, and the hotel gave a clean and hygenic impression. If visiting S.F again I will deffinatly stay at Hotel Fusion and I highly recomend it everyone

review.title: Hotel Fusion Review
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel literally 2-3 blocks from all of the major dining, shopping, attractions etc in San Fran. The amenities are few but not needed in a location such as this. You are 2 blocks from the Westfield Center, a huge indoor mall with the world's only spiral escalator. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again!

review.title: Great deal!
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay here again! It's very rare to find a hotel this nice for such little money in such a great location.

review.title: Excellent service and value
review.reviewText: This hotel is a gem. Friendly service, right by Powell Street station, plus the cable cars, and really good value. One or two niggles that others have mentioned, but nothing big.

review.title: Nice Hotel en Downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Hi, me an my wife stayed in Hotel fusion for 7 nigths, is very close to the Cable Car station, Bart and Metro line N and the street cars. (You can take the Bart from SFO Airport to the hotel, very cheap). Near to nice places like Union Square and one block of Marquet St. Is Clean, cozy, includes a little breakfast. The rooms are small but well conditioned. All the people in the hotel helps you and gives you good advices.

review.title: Classy and easy for BART Riders
review.reviewText: Just one block and a half from the Powell Street BART stop, I was glad I chose this hotel for my weekend business meeting. I'm big on using public transportation and this was a great fit. The room was clean, the bed linens were of high quality and the flat screen TV was great! The bathroom was modern and the water flow was fine. Truly 'Asian contemporary' like they say on the website. You're within walking distance of Union Square and I was glad I didn't have to rent a car.

review.title: I will come back to that hotel hundreds of times!!!
review.reviewText: I go to SF often. I have been staying at different hotels. This hotel is the best in town for me. Location is covenient for shopping and shightseeing. Price is affordable. Rooms are clean and stylish. Staff is super nice. I have been staying in this hotel twice. I will stay there next time, too!!!

review.title: Great location and price!
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location. Accessible to the street carts and the subway. The food options near the hotel were great. The room was small, but all I needed was a bed. The only weird thing was that the sink was outsied the bathroom and there was no counter space.

review.title: A great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms and a nice ambience. What more do you want from a hotel? As a previous reviewer said, you don't go to San Francisco to sit in your room!

review.title: Value, service and location
review.reviewText: For the price, the Fusion was a great value. Nothing fancy but clean, quiet and convenient. I would definately book there again in the future.

review.title: Excellent Deal
review.reviewText: During our stay in San Francisco, we wanted to stay where all the action was in Union Square but not pay a hefty price. Hotel Fusion was a wonderful hotel; the service was great, the rooms were very clean (but small), and we got a great deal!! We definitely recommend it to other San Francisco travelers!!

review.title: good price, location and service
review.reviewText: although there are not too many decroation, it has very good location and service. price is attractive too. room is a little bit small, but clean and comfortable.

review.title: a little bit small
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and clean, but smaller than I expected it to be

review.title: Beautiful, friendly...
review.reviewText: While you can almost miss seeing it from the outside (in the midst of San Francisco's architectural "eye candy"), once you're inside, this hotel is beautiful and avant-garde. The staff during my stay was very friendly and helpful, and I had a feeling that everything was carefully and thoughtfully planned. This is probably the best "boutique" hotel that I've stayed at in San Francisco...

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: I was in SF for a conference and stayed at the Hotel Fusion because it was a little less expensive than other Union Square hotels. I was very happy with it. I felt safe walking there at night, it was close to everything, and the room was perfectly comfortable. The room was a little on the small side, so I wouldn't have wanted to spend lots of time in there, but it was nice enough to do a little work in and for sleeping. The free internet (with an ethernet cable) was great too.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is great,it is right in the heart of everything, a 2 min walk to the mall, the cable cars and everthing else you could think of. Walls are pretty thin but the room is very nice, with a flat screen tv w/dvd player, nice shower, very nice and helpful workers.Would stay again for sure.

review.title: Relaxing stay and great location
review.reviewText: For people who don't want to pay extra for a swimming pool, conference rooms or room service; this place could be for you. The hotel is located one block from the Powell St station for catching public transportation and is right on Union Sq, just outside of the financial district. The hotel is also on the edge of the "don't go there" part of town. But just go left or straight out of the hotel (not right) and you are fine (left to the Powell St station anyway). Free continental breakfast fare: o.j. and cranberry juice; coffee/tea; assorted muffins/croissants/toast; and oranges. Complaint: Real cream/milk would have been better for the coffee instead of those God-awful packets of dried fat. (We simply ate at one of the many fine places like Boogaloo Cafe!) Complaints: hotel sign was not lit at night, and no plug behind desk for coffee maker. Big deal. Room tips that worked for us: 1) 5th floor (top - no above noise and this is the breakfast floor) 2) Courtyard room - away from the street and elevator 3) Wheelchair access (bigger bathroom, but remember mirror, hangars, etc. are all lower -- and no bathroom door hooks). Enjoy your stay.

review.title: Fusion Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was tidy but small, the bath-room was cold and for breakfast there wasn't fresch milk. There wasn't the wireless connection and they lent me the clabe (I stay there 7 night, I mean, they should made me a service) Otherwise, the location is fantastic.

review.title: Best deal in SF's shopping district
review.reviewText: Good service. Very clean and modern. LCD TV in each room. Free high speed internet. 1 block away from Union Square.

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: It was the best option for low budget accomodation. It is very well located, near to Union Square and shops area. The room is small but very clean with new furniture and nice decoration. I would definetely come back!

review.title: Unbeatable value for money
review.reviewText: I scored an excellent last minute deal on Expedia and couldn't have been happier with this hotel. You can pay a lot more to stay at tired, old 4-5 star hotels in San Francisco, or the same price to stay at 'boutique hotels' which are frayed around the edges. Hotel Fusion is impeccably remodelled, impeccably clean, exceptionally comfortable. I loved the flat screen TV, which even has a built-in DVD player.

review.title: Will use again!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel as a combination of pleasure and business. My husband joined me for the first three days--it was a bit too crowded for 2 and not enough room for desk work (TV sat on desk/bureau). There is not high speed internet access and there are no screens in the window. REQUEST A FAN--it gets very warm (no air conditioning) and the privacy is not there if you open the window to put in the window fan. Very slim pickings for the continental breakfast. HOWEVER, the hotel had great service, a wonderful concierge, and incredible access to the cable car, BART, MUNI and convention center. I would get again, but for one person only.

review.title: I'll be back...
review.reviewText: A great little hotel in the middle of everything. It was renovated about a year ago so the room, bath, bed etc were fresh and new. Nice, helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Great Location, Great Price!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Fusion for 1 night during our trip to San Francisco. We were pleased with the location and the overall condition of the hotel. No air condition, but they were happy to provide us with a fan which worked nicely with the cool night. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but had everything we needed and was very cozy and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: wonderful location!
review.reviewText: the location was perfect for shopping and easy access to anywhere. the hotel was clean and the people were helpful and friendly. the rooms were small, but well appointed. the sheets and duvet were of good quality. the roman shades were new and attractive. the flatscreen tv had loads of channels and was in perfect working order. my only complaint was the "breakfast". it was stored/served in a tiny, cupboard of a room. and mainly, there was no milk/cream for the coffee. they provided packaged creamers. a pot of fresh milk on ice would up the quality. i would stay there again.

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText: cheap, good location but very small

review.title: Youth hostel
review.reviewText: If i were to think about where i would go to be locked up in a hospital this is it. NO AC, they bring you a fan. Single Elevator may not work (good thing it's only 5 stories. Rooms smelled funny, bed had plastic cover under sheets (I guess they get bed wetters?) and twin room....well it's nice to be able to touch either wall of the room you are in while in bed. A refurbed homeless shelter, with "charm" Bah

review.title: Good location. Clean. New. Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Good location. Clean. New. Friendly staff.

review.title: Great Cheap Boutique In Heart of SF
review.reviewText: Great VALUE for hotel. Centrally located to ALL... SAFE. Comfortable. Friendly staff. Brings many of the amenities of larger and more exspensive modern hotels into a realistic and affordable level. Read the other reviews here - and honestly - the beds are firm and comfortable. Flat screen tv. Refrig in room. Free internet. Small but totally Modern bathroom with dryer. On the downside - no AC... but many apartments in SF don't have it either as the city is typically on the cooler comfort size. That said, I needed to open the window and yes, could hear the cable trolley and some street noice. Check out days was only day too warm and wished I had ac; prob due to daylight sun and was out seeing city on other days!! I will absolutely go back to Hotel Fusion.

review.title: Trendy boutique on an excellent location
review.reviewText: Good service and nicely decorated. Great location: close to main highway entrances, Union Square and across the street to major Hotels. Just have to complain of the valet parking, takes a while and (in my case) were not too careful. Overall, if planned with time, it can give the best for your San Francisco experience.

review.title: A good, basic low-budget option
review.reviewText: This basic hotel provides very clean and reasonably comfortable accommodations. Since there is no air conditioning, if you need the window open, there will inevitably be some street noise. (Even though SF nights are generally cool and air conditioning there is superfluous, I found the room hot and stuffy without the window open.) My single room was very tiny, but adequate for a one-night stay. The neighborhood is constantly bustling and not San Francisco's most picturesque, but the street on which the hotel is located feels safe for walking. The hotel is very centrally located and there are numerous restaurants in the area. Be prepared to find a significant number of homeless people on the adjoining streets. Breakfast is basic, and the fitness room consists of a couple of cardio machines and some free weights.

review.title: Quaint hotel in heart of downtown
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion was a nice hotel to stay in. Everything we wanted was nearby and very accecible from our hotel's location. Our only dissatisfaction was that the hotel does not have airconditioning (and in TX we LOVE our airconditioning). The weather was nice enough to leave the window open but due to the busy downtown location, made our room quite the noisy spot to stay. Especially during the night, keeping the window open was essential for airflow, but was very distracting.

review.title: Central locale-comfort lacking
review.reviewText: Modern updates a nice touch to older traditional hotel. In need of air conditioners. Bathroom a bit tight. No full length mirror. Central location is a plus! Overall a decent stay.

review.title: Great Location, No A/C
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location, down the block from The Body Shop in Union Square and was very affordable. However, it didn't have A/C. They offered to bring a fan up but never did, until we went down a few hours later an some guy was like, "Yeah.. it's coming!!!" (Obviously not very professional) The hotel doesn't have the best customer service and the front desk was very slow. Also, the concierge wasn't very prepared to give good recommendations.

review.title: Nice stay, but loud!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, centrally located with friendly staff. Room was very warm, so we needed to leave the window open to get some breeze. Knew it would be a loud corner and it was.

review.title: Gem, Highly recommended
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! The standard queen rooms are perfect for two and clean. We were even surprise to find they offered a light continental breakfast. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The location is perfect. You can catch a cable car or any other public transportation one block away. There is no A/C in the rooms, but it was very comfortable with the fan provided by the hotel. The weather was perfect so no A/C was needed (and we're from Texas!) Highly recommended if you're looking for a nice place/location at a reasonable price. If we return to SF we will definitely stay at this hotel again. Rooms have a safe and a mini-frig. The sushi place across the street is also great.

review.title: Nice hip place in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Nice hip place... Very cool decor. Small complaint - the elevator bell was a bit loud, especially since my room was right next to it... It woke me up a few times throughout the night.

review.title: Excellent value and an incredible location
review.reviewText: The Fusion appears to have undergone a recent refurbishment and our room was excellent, though a little lacking in furniture! The location can't be beat if you want to be near Union Square (1 block away) and is just steps from a number of excellent restaurants. Study the one way system before you drive there and you should have no problems. Valet parking was expensive but there are a number of much cheaper self park places in the neighbourhood so that's not really a problem. Overall we were delighted. We had come to the city for a family birthday and our brother stayed across the street in a "big name" hotel for more than twice as much. Our room was just as big. We would highly recommend this hotel and would use Expedia to get the best rate.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Good location and price

review.title: This one is a winner!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! There's nothing about it I didn't like. It's been recently remodeled, they tell me it re-opened in April. The staff is well trained and very nice. The location couldn't be better! It's a block from BART/Muni Powell subway station and that'll get you to and from SFO. There's tons of restaurant in the area, you'll never be hungry. It's only a block from Market Street, a major transit hub, plus the F-line which takes you to fisherman's wharf in about 15-20 minutes. I didn't get a chance to use the cable cars, but they're a block away too. You'll enjoy this place!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great place, nice price

review.title: Shopper's Delight
review.reviewText: Great location you don't need to walk more than a few blocks to find dinner, dancing, shopping and more. Right by trolley line but noise wasn't as invasive as I anticipated. Friendly staff helped me map out several places I wanted to go even calling to get cross streets and make reservations for me. Comfy beds, and room had a foyer that had it's own door so that my other travelling companions could use the bathroom, hang up coats etc. without disturbing those sleeping in the main room. Oh and the shampoo and lotion smelled really good too. Great hotel!

review.title: Needs work
review.reviewText: It was a good deal for the price but is new and needs work. Only one ice machine and it was broken. Room was tiny with the foot board of the bed (hidden under a comforter) constantly hitting my shins. Bath was large enough for a dresser or table that it could use as other furniture was lacking. No bath counter space. Hard pillows and wrinkled sheets were probably the result of laundering them on site. Many problems offset by great location friendly staff and clearly a work in progress. Breakfast was sparce.

review.title: Hotel Fusion - San Francisco
review.reviewText: At half the cost of "brand" hotels I was pleasantly surprised by how nice my room at the Hotel Fusion was. The room decor had recently been redone, the bed was very comfortable and the location was terrific. You are within two blocks of Union Square and all the shopping. The trolley is also within a couples of blocks. It is difficult to find a better value with such a great location.

review.title: Don't expect too much
review.reviewText: 1. No airconditioner, it was toooooooo hot. 2. Staffs are not friendly. 3. Too noisy.

review.title: New favorite union square budget hotel
review.reviewText: The Fusion was a last minute add on to my trip this summer. So I was looking for the cleanest and safest budget hotel in Union Square(which isnt easy to find) and I found it! The room I had was spotless and had a very fresh feel to it. And to my surprise the flat screen tv and the bathroom shower were 3/4 star hotel quality.

review.title: Would use again
review.reviewText: Great staff,very helpful. Nice rooms, nothing fancy. But being out on work most of the time, just right. No A/C that I could find but cool days and nights allowed window to be open. Very central to all downtown points. 1 blk from BART and streetcars.5 blks to Mosconi. One poor point(most of this area) trash and delivery truck noise starts early! Don't plan on sleeping-in peacefully.

review.title: Great Location and Good value for the money
review.reviewText: The hotel was very welcoming and the workers couldn't have been more helpful with giving me information about restaurants and things to do. The room was small but very clean and pleasant. Ask for a room in the back so you can open your window at night--no air conditioning, but it certainly was cool enough. The included breakfast was a tad skimpy--just toast and a muffin and coffee. Nothing to write home about.

review.title: 'My hotel'
review.reviewText: I really like this hotel. It has everything I want: safe, clean, perfect size room for myself (I don't like big room', hair dryer, coffee machine, free internet access, light bfast, LCD tv, close to shop2 and not expensive!

review.title: Reasonable price at great location
review.reviewText: Modern design hotel with very friendly staff. Clean rooms with modern furniture. Nice slick 32 inch LCD facing the bed. Water from the shower is nice and strong. Rooms are ok size for a downtown SF location. Very satisfied with the rooms at this price. Only downside is that it's very quiet and you can hear people talking at night if they are talking loud. Parking is expensive though at U$31 valet. But this is downtown SF. Very good location. 2 blocks down is the visitor center where you can buy your tram/bus day passes. Would definitely stay in Fusion Hotel if I'm back in SF.

review.title: very clean
review.reviewText: nice location;close to powel station, union square, station of cable car. room is small but clean including shower room. good for solo-traveller.

review.title: nice and clean
review.reviewText: this hotel was great, but partially because we got a deal on it. had i paid the full rate, i might not have been as satisfied - but even so, it was newly remodeled, clean, and the staff were super helpful.

review.title: Great small hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is good value for money. Hotel is clean, rooms are comfortable (although might be small), staff is friendly. Location perfect for SF city lovers.

review.title: A new hotel that has possibilities
review.reviewText: The Hotel Fusion has only been open four months. It is a nice clean hotel with an Asian minimalist feel.A nice location with some street noise but that is to be expected for the outer rooms.Staff was courteous but the concierge was scarce most times.The continental breakfast is definitely "light"and not worth the trip up to the fifth floor.Great bed and linens!!Overall a great experience.The hotel just needs to work out some of the bugs. Thanks

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, staff friendly and helpful. I had an issue on checkout re international call rates and the management went out of their way to rectify the problem. Will definately stay there again - highly recommended for singles, couples and business travellers. Hotel has been refurbished, rooms are clean and well decorated.

review.title: OK for price
review.reviewText: Fusion is a good hotel considering its location, downtown San Francisco, and its age. The room was clean, the staff cheerful, knowledgeable and helpful. My only complaint is that the room is tiny. As my trip was business and I was alone that was not a handicap.

review.title: Awesome.
review.reviewText: Recently re-built/re-modeled, new, mildly fashionable, nice people, accessible to the Bart by two blocks or so, nice flatscreen tv, nice new shower, quiet, had to leave too quickly for breakfast (so no opinion), small room -- but if you're just one or two for a casual night's stay, you can't beat this place. For the price and central SF location, phenomenal.

review.title: No Air Conditioner- shoe string budget hotel
review.reviewText: *Extremely* small rooms. The rooms clean, well kept, and maintained. No fridges or microwaves in the rooms, Ice is available on one floor. The complimentary breakfast was only comprised of, blueberry muffins and apple, cranberry, orange juice. There is a tiny workout room for two people in the basement. If you are traveling in the spring, summer, or fall, be accutely aware there is no air conditioning.
