The hotel does *NOT* include complementary parking, but they will park for you at 31 dollars a day, or you can find a parking area within a few blocks to park for 30 dollars a night, to save a dollar. Center rooms (all looking inward in the building) have very poor ventilation, and if you call room service, and complain loudly enough, you might get a small fan. I used mine to draw a bit of air from the center area, it takes a long time to cool down the room so that one can sleep at night. The hotel did not make me aware of the fact they could scrounge up a small fan, until I complained about the room- and very tired from the lack of sleep...it stayed hot all night long without the fan. An associate that stayed there with me was lucky enough to get an exterior room, which even had a view of San Francisco (instead of looking in the window of another room 10 feet away and facing you), which allowed the normal wind that blows outside to cool his room off after awhile. Recommendations to travelers is to demand a fan at check-in.

review.title: would love to keep a secret!
review.reviewText: This is an excellent little boutique hotel. The hotel has been refurbished very tastefuly. the old charm of the hotel's original layout was kept while every part of the hotel was updated to modern standards. The interior decor is well done with a modern asian style. We booked on expedia and as it so happens, everytime I book on this site the rooms I get seem to be the less desirable ones at the hotels. In the case of this hotel we ended up with 2 rooms that were intended for disabled patrons. Aside from everything in the bathroom being set low for a person in a wheelchair, problem being I am 6 1/2 feet tall, the bathroom was very large and well laid out. The room service person had a problem giving us the right amount of towels each day and we had to call the desk everyday to send up shampoo supplies. The desk was very courteous and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here due to the great location to the area attractions.

review.title: Nice Little Hotel
review.reviewText: i spend alot of time in hotels and this one was pritty standard. good, clean, comfortable though. you don't really go to san fran to sit in a hotel room do you. Happy alround!!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conviniently located, about 2 blocks from Mosconi Conventional Center, downtown San Francisco. The stay was very comfortable, with a clean room having a comfortable bed and a flat screen TV. I happy with the service and overall cleanliness. Would definitely reserve a room at this place, next time I visit the city. One minor drawback is that the rooms are not equiped with an AC and hence it gets hot during the afternoons.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: I've stayed in a lot of US hotels and motels, but the cleanliness of this one is absolutely superb. Friendly staff, nice rooms, even the bellboys were nice fella's. Breakfast only includes a(very) small buffet, served in a tiny little room, where you can't sit down. Some rooms with Ellis Street view are noisy, due to only single glazed windows. This hotel, however, offers great value. We keep good memories of it.

review.title: Has Everything You Need
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Very clean and employees are polite and helpful. Great restaurants nearby. Only thing to be aware of which I wasnt is that parking is very expensive per night and it adds an extra chunk of money on top of the price of your stay. But overall great place to stay and I would recommend.

review.title: Great hotel, great value
review.reviewText: For the rate, this hotel was outstanding. It's not a five star hotel, of course, but the rooms are sparkling clean and nicely arranged, the young staff is courteous and friendly, and the location is great. My only complaints: tiny bathrooms, no A/C, thin walls. On the other hand, the bathrooms are neat and flawless besides being tiny, you don't need A/C in SF, and most guests seemed to be educated, sophisticated people who wouldn't stay up until 3 am partying in their rooms and keeping the neighbors up. The pros definitely outweigh the cons. Overall, a great experience.

review.title: Good location, but small & austere room
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and all shopping places. Room was clean, but very small with bare-bone amenities.In short, don't expect anything nice.

review.title: Conveniently located & clean hotel for a long weekend
review.reviewText: You will be happy you have chosen this place. This is a great place to stay if you're visiting SF as a tourist and just need a nice, clean place to sleep. The location is convenient, the service is good, room is very clean and big (delux king), hotel staff are friendly and helpful. However the room is a little noisy. Even when the windows are closed you still can kind of hear the traffic from the streets. Anyways, if we come again to SF this is our hotel choice.

review.title: nice hotel in SF downtown
review.reviewText: I strongly recommend this hotel

review.title: nice place near union square
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel, reasonable price. Great location, just beside Union Square. For that price you can't get anything better in SF downtown. Hotel stuff was very helpful.

review.title: very clean hotel
review.reviewText: i really liked the hotel fusion ,its very centrally located in the downtown center of sfo.,but the rooms did not have a mini bar so that was not very good., also i never received messages left for me from my friend when thy called when i was not in the hotel.

review.title: Clean, simple
review.reviewText: Simple clean hotel in Downtown SF. Good for a long weekend. Not good for business travelers as the room that I stayed in has no desk. Also, there is no mini-fridge, so you get thirsty at night. Otherwise, a good place to crash.

review.title: Please Dont change!
review.reviewText: What a find! Why stay a block away in the Marriot or Hilton when Hotel Fusion is there?! I was worried about the area, but it was GREAT!Right next to Huge shopping, Union Square and the Cable cars, Bart and Muni! Hotel Fusion is my Hotel of choice in San Francisco! The staff is more than friendly and very helpful. Cant say enough, Im just glad we found it!

review.title: A Hidden Gem Balancing Price and Location
review.reviewText: The only budget hotel that had 100% recommendation on Expedia was the reason I booked four nights here. The location is fantastic - a block away from Powell Station and a cable car station, so easy to get to and from the airport using the BART. Located downtown with great shopping and restaurants nearby. The rooms are small, but the hotel was renovated only four months ago, so the carpets are clean, hallways bright, mattresses are new (those new thick foam mattresses that conform to your body - I prefer the old-fashioned spring ones), wall-mounted LCD TVs, new showers and even boutique-grade toiletries and thick towels. Small coffee machine in the room and free USA Today newspaper in the lobby are nice freebies. They have a tiny gym with only a treadmill, elliptical machine and a weight bench - not much, but more than you would expect from a 2-star hotel. Only drawback is that staying downtown is pretty noisy early in the morning. Do youreself a favour and ask for an inside room or one that does NOT face Ellis Street. I was told by a local resident that there was a recent bedbug infestation in the cheaper hotels and hostels, so I was wary about staying in a hotel that was too old or cheap, so this was a great find.

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is centrally located (right by union square!). Staff was very accomodating, friendly, and knowledgeable about the area. Room was a bit small and the continental breakfast was disappointing. But its cleanliness and decorative style, not to mention all the restaurants surrounding the hotel, made up for it! Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice Hotel but ...
review.reviewText: The hotel was good with everything except that the room was too small.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly emplyoees, very good mattres, every thing new in the hotel (TV,bed...), rooms little smallish definitely reccomend

review.title: If only it would last
review.reviewText: I had considered writing a terrible review just to preserve the hidden value. To be frank I refilled my Rx for xanex before travelling - (just in case) - they weren't needed. Don't be fooled by the lack of images or other feedback - this place is in a great location; the rooms are new and include all the creature comforts you'd normally find in a marriott; the staff was thorough and professional and they'll even valet your car for less than local garages (with in/out ability). Two thumbs up.

review.title: very good!
review.reviewText: positive .. let us check in hours early w/o charge! .. free internet .. all staff very nice & cheerful .. newly redone, clean rooms negative .. bring yoru own LAN cable, hotel charges a couple of dollars for lan wire rental

review.title: Very comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: Try to get a room w a view.

review.title: Pretty good value - despite some minor issues
review.reviewText: Overall I agree with the reviews posted here. Particularly the staff - they are rock stars. I was expecting a bigger room (but have no basis for comparison in SF), nonetheless it was clean, central & cozy. A couple minor issues, I got locked out of my room each morning after breakfast when neither of my cards would work (and yes, the breakfast is very basic). The noise from the shower next door was not insignificant - but didn't last long. And there is no air conditioning - so it was tad warm at times (but I opened my window). Really though, pretty great value!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a perfect location, a couple blocks from Union Square and near all the public transportation. That being said, wasn't overly impressed with the room. It was clean, the bathroom was small and below average, and there wasn't A/C, even though its usually chilly there. The beds were decent, i'd say below average. However, it was clean, affordable and in a great location. If that is what your looking for , that its fine .

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I was at SF for a conference at Moscone Convention Center. Hotel Fusion is conveniently located near union squar, bart and its only 4 blocks from the convention center. The room was absolutely clean, hallways were also clean and in excellent condition. I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Fusion very much and the people were very friendly and nice. I definitely recommend this hotel!!!

review.title: not spectacular, but good enough
review.reviewText: As boutique hotels in SF go, the Fusion was comfortable and clean, and in a safe area. It had its quirks, but considering its price and location, it wasn't bad. The staff were very courteous and helpful, and the hotel seems to have been renovated very recently. Great restaurants nearby, and just a block from the cable car terminus. Just don't wander too far west from the hotel.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: I wasn't hoping for much, as I was staying for one night. Just needed a place to crash really. Next time I go back to San Francisco, I'd like to spend at least a week and would stay comfortably in this hotel for that time.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Fusion is a excelent hotel in the San Francisco downtown, two blocks away from BART station. It is placed next to the Powel street which has a lot of good shops and restaurants. One block away from the hotel is a cable car station. Hotel rooms are small, but very clean and cosi, with a confortable bed. Service is excellent, front desk works 24/7 and they will provide you with a lot of immportant info about the city. Breakfast is included in price, thoug not so good, only coffee and mufins. But, since it is served in a small room, it's a wondderful opportunity to meet other guests. Highly recommende it!!!

review.title: Relaxing Haven
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, great attention to detail (down to the thick, fluffy towels, firm foam bed and flat screen TV/DVD) and friendly staff made a great trip even better. The room was very comfortable, quiet and great place to relax and unwind after a long day or for a quick nap during the day. All in all, a snazzy hotel in a surperb location!

review.title: great place for the money
review.reviewText: A very cute hotel in Union Square. Decor is modern. Staff is very responsive including leaving Alka Seltzer tablets in the room in case we had a post St Patricks Day hangover

review.title: Great, clean, and friendly.
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located, extremely clean and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom -- had real, fluffy, white towels. The hotel doesn't seem to be particularly business friendly, but that was okay considering everything else. I will definitely stay here again.
